Reviews.Title: “Fantastic array of flavors”
Reviews.Author: Travis H
Reviews.Content: We ate at SoBou last night and had an incredible meal. The food was phenomenal and the service by our waiter Dana was exceptional! We had several small plates including the duck and butternut beignets, shrimp and tasso pinchos and the pork belly; these were all excellent not only because of the taste, but the accompanying sauces and presentation as well. This restaurant is a must try and you will love the decor as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff and decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love2taste
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the W French Quarter about 2 weeks ago. My husband was there for work and we went along w/ him to finish out the summer. He was still working when we checked in and the front desk gave us a hard time because my name was not on the reservation. After dealing w/ his secretary and central reservation to get my name added, I finally got into the room after almost 2 hours. When we first walked into the room, it was modern as expected. Upon closer inspection, you can see the room was heavily painted over and the cabinets and material used were sort of Ikea and cheap. The carpet was dirty and the bathroom was tiny and dark. I have stayed at a few other W and my expectation for this brand is quite high because of my past experiences. Our room only had a tiny window w/ a view of the courtyard. I was not too happy w/ the set up and went downstairs to ask for another room w/ a view. I met Halbert at the front desk and he said there were none available at the moment but 2 might become available the next day. he made some notes for us to be moved since we were staying a total of 3 nights. we had all of our things packed early next morning for the bellman to move our stuff once the other room became available. we came back to our room around 3pm and everything was still there. i had to go downstairs to check on the status and after waiting for about 45 minutes, the girl at the front desk finally said another was available for us to move. After spending another hour to move and get settled, we saw that the new room on the 2nd floor was e bit dirtier and the bathroom was even smaller. there was no way to fit anymore than 1 person. You had to move around the door in order to close it and sit down on the toilet. the toilet paper holder was broken and the paper kept on falling on the floor and there was no counter space to even put the paper. We slept the 2nd night in the new room and the bed is normally the best thing about the W, but no this hotel. Both beds felt like the spring wanted to pop. We thought the internet would be included w/ the full price we paid, but it was not. Even when we paid, it did not work. When I went to the lobby, I voiced my Internet issues and there were 2 other business men there w/ the same issues. I asked if they had a computer for guests and they did not. They offered to print what I needed but there was no way I would let anyone see my private information. The amenities at this W was really limited and what they did offer was painfully expensive. The valet was almost $40 and internet was not cheap. The rooms at this W was just ok, not horrible but not that great. I shared my thoughts w/ the GM and he was very patient in hearing everything i had to say. I did also tell him that I thought Halbert and a few other valet and bellman staff were just great. Overall, the staff was quite good but the shortcomings of the hotel were quite long and could be fairly easy to address. I suggested that he should comp every guests the internet charge because it was not working properly. In addition, when the hotel does not provide it in the lobby, they should comp it for all guests. He did comp us one night and I thought that was a good peace offering for our experience at his hotel. If we come back, I would consider staying here again especially if they make the effort and fix the rooms to the W standards.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Excellent from check in to check out!”
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: Everyone from front desk staff to the valet was friendly and excellent! We were only supposed to stay overnight after our wedding before flying to our honeymoon, but due to hurricane Isaac we had to stay an additional night. The hotel staff went above and beyond making a pleasant experience out of an unpleasant situation. We were very pleased and would gladly recommend this property! I hope to stay here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing visit”
Reviews.Author: HBLUMBERGToronto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the W in the French Quarter (August 15-19). We booked this hotel with a little trepidation as Iâ€™d had a really horrid stay at one of the W hotels in NYC. However I cannot rave about this hotel enough. The location is great; the rooms are extremely comfortable and have a really fun decor throughout. The pool, whilst small, was great, it was wonderful to hang out there after a hard day shopping and eating our way through NO. The food at the restaurant is fabulous and donâ€™t get me started on the cocktails.... All of this is great, but to some degree what you would expect of a luxury boutique hotel. What really makes this place so totally amazing is the staff. Iâ€™d read a few reviews whilst planning our stay and to be honest had been a little cynical about the staff reviews. However, we did not receive even good service when we were there; it was exceptional ALL of the time. Without exception! The team was never â€œin your faceâ€� but they made you feel utterly unique and important. No request was too much trouble. I feel terrible not listing out everybody who made our stay so wonderful, but 2 people I have to single out are Abbey who runs the bar, nicest lady ever who makes the best cocktails! Sheâ€™s really inventive, it was fun to give her the â€œI feel like something kinda .....â€� challenge and see what she gave you, it was unfailingly a winner each time. Just donâ€™t expect to be able to walk away from the bar when she is done with you! The other person I have to single out is Staci on Front Desk. Amazing, fantastic, wonderful. She really sealed the deal for us. Nothing was too much trouble; she was always warm and welcoming and really went beyond the call of duty to help us with all our requests. Staci alone has completely made us rethink our opinion of the W group. We cannot wait to get back to the hotel! Thank you for such an awesome stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the Cost!!”
Reviews.Author: sherrye r
Reviews.Content: There were people talking and making noise in the hall, etc. at all hours of the night. Children running up and down the hall. Lack of services we were accustomed to with other hotel chains. My son and daughter-in-law also stayed at this hotel and were extremely unhappy. An over flowing commode, lack of blankets in room, noise, etc. We will not be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Tradition Lives in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Seddmo
Reviews.Content: The tradition of friendly people, great food and plenty of fun continues at the W Hotel French Quarter. The property was recently renovated (including the restaurant) and everything looks great. The hotel is two blocks from Bourbon Street and located in a perfect location to walk to all the major downtown attractions. It was my birthday and Staci (concierge) was very helpful finding the perfect place for dinner. Alex (night manager) was extremely pleasant and went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed at the 24 pool (she made our trip worth coming back ...). All in all, the property was great. The rooms were a little small, but then again who goes to NOLA to stay in their room! Who Dat!

Reviews.Title: “Shame on You”
Reviews.Author: 2LITravellers
Reviews.Content: As a platinum SPG member we stayed here on points. Our room was not ready when we arrived so we went for lunch. Upon returning, the room we were given was the dirtiest hotel room I'd ever seen. I travel for a living and spend each week in rooms costing far less than this hotel and had never seen anything so dirty. The carpet had stains everywhere, the walls were stained, the furniture stained, even the decorative box spring cover was stained. I was afraid to put my bag down. There was also a small window with no view. I went back down to the lobby and politely expressed my displeasure. After about 15 minutes of management discussions away from me, I was told if I was patient again, another room would eventually be ready. I sat in the outdoor courtyard hoping to get some work done in the meantime, but could not get on the internet as it wasn't working. We were later placed into a completely renovated room with a balcony overlooking the pool. A beautiful room and experience. Night and day from the other room. We had a nice stay from that point on, but I kept thinking how dreadful it was for the hotel to try and offer filthy rooms at a premium price. Regarding the renovations, to be fair, they look great, but if you look closely, our furniture drawer couldn't close and the paint on the bathroom mirror looked liked a kindergarten project. The hotel did refund one nights points for inconvience which was appreciated. My review is a few months late, I hope the W gets better as the renovation continues, but shame on you for offering that original room.

Reviews.Title: “It's the staff that make the difference......”
Reviews.Author: tradecomm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite small compared to the other name brand hotels in the French Quarter and bordering area on Canal Street. This "boutique" hotel while we stayed there was completing renovations and as a result some painting, hammering and other slight inconveniences were noted. Let's first look at the rooms: When we originally checked in we were given a room next to the gym or what the brand calls "sweat". The room number is 230 - this room is very small and would suggest the smallest in the hotel with maybe two-three feet on either side of the kingsize bed and a bit more at its foot. The bathroom is also very small as are most of the bathrooms in the hotel. The theme of the room includes a large painted "trumpet bell" in black and yellow as it tries to echo the New Orleans sound. Two other rooms that we evenutally ended up in also were themed in the same manner. When the staff asked how our accommodations were and we noted how small the room was, they immediately looked at moving us to one that was more spacious. This new room 220 was a corner room however had air conditioning issues which resulted in a third move to the 5th floor with a dormer window. The Sobou restaurant in the hotel has a limited but wonderful breakfast menu. Try the french toast with bananas and fosters sauce - incredible!! Hotel Courtyard - small outdoor pool but a nice area to sit, relax, read and have a beverage. Staff - what can I say....some of the staff really made a difference - Staci at reception who welcomed us to the hotel; the young lady who checked us out and a young lady whose name escapes me from the "engineering department" - thank you!!! Location - if the French Quarter is where you want to be - great location and minutes from Bourbon and Canal Streets. Business Centre - none. There is also no guest user computer. The front desk will however gladly print your flight boarding passes for you. Would I stay there again? Yes...but not in room 230!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Gobeachmama
Reviews.Content: Great location! We loved this hotel. We especially love the courtyard on the 2nd floor. It's not a very big hotel but it's conveniently located near Jackson Square and easy walking distance to anything in the French Quarter. The service is not up to the standards of the typical W but we are fairly self sufficient so it was fine. We asked for different pillows and it took 2 calls ad 2 deliveries to get it right but they tried. The lobby was busy and service is slow there but the check in customer service rep was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “SoBou restaurant is a must!”
Reviews.Author: SuzyQinHou
Reviews.Content: We did not stay at the W, but we did go eat at SoBou, the restaurant just off the lobby. The food is a modern take on traditional Creole, but not at all fussy. We had cracklins with pimiento cheese fondue and shrimp & tasso skewers for appetizers. Amazing! Just try them! Our party of 9 had a number of different dishes, but everyone loved theirs. Two of the foodies in the group said the gumbo was the best they have EVER had. The burgers also rated high, as did the cuban sandwich. The atmosphere is great and the service exceptional. You can sit in the bar area, where they have beer taps IN the tables, or wine dispensers in the wall. We sat in the dining room, and ordered our wine by the bottle, but the other looked like fun too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Drix-Zietsman
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, albeit a bit disorganised. A lot of guests had to wait for their rooms to be ready, we waited about 1 1/2 hours, but went for lunch while we waited. Our room was good, but lacked a big mirror, also a chair to sit in inside the room. The outside area was lovely. The staff are very friendly and efficient. There was not enough hot water in the shower, but it may be because of the heat in New Orleans. However, for guests who prefer hot showers, it is a problem. The restaurant, SoBou, was expensive and not worth the price - we only had a breakfast there and decided to rather go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The devils playground”
Reviews.Author: Shawn D
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. The room was great, very modern, comfortable bed, and very nice and clean room and bathroom. The restaurant and bar are amazing. They have a few tables with beer taps at the table very cool. The bar is very modern and well stocked, if Abby is your bartender then your in for a treat, she is the best. Great staff and service. I stayed with my uncle and his friend booked the room and he did not know I was coming so when we asked for a room with two beds they had nothing available so they took some $$ of our bill and gave us two money vouchers towards the bar or restaurant. Great location a few blocks from bourbon street so you don't get all the noisy rift raft at night, and walking distance to Jackson square and the Frenchman. If Acme has a line 30 deep which it usually does go across the street to Felix's its better and is where the locals go, huge fresh oysters the best I have ever had. Enjoy the devils play ground I did.

Reviews.Title: “The best bar in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Randi S
Reviews.Content: While in New Orleans for a business trip, I stopped by the SoBou Bar and Restaurant for happy hour with several colleagues. The ambience is great! And, there was a diverse crowd! I asked Jonathan, the mixologist, to make me a "sweet, fruity and refreshing" cocktail...He created a masterpiece. The drink was delicious and became the drink of the night. We named it the "Brandy Nicole" after yours truly. Our waitress Sharon was magnificent. She was attentive, helpful and pleasant all around. There were many of us, but she was able to tend to our individual needs and kept a smile on her face. She even gave us recommendations for other restaurants in the area that we might try during our trip. Overall, it was a very pleasant experience in a great upscale bar/restaurant. Definitely 5/5!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Food.”
Reviews.Author: CopanoJoe
Reviews.Content: This W is newly renovated (though it appears a few items are still being worked on). My room overlooked the courtyard pool area and was relatively large as compared to other W properties. However, it should be noted that walls seem very thin as there is lots of noise from the hallways. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. With that said, the hotel could use some additional front desk staff during the day. The best thing about this hotel is Sobou. The food is excellent as are the cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot horrible bar manager.”
Reviews.Author: A_Benz1969
Reviews.Content: After spending 3 nights on a work function, the location is great central and close to all the shops and action. Rooms where very clean and a decent size for a boutique hotel. Friendly staff all around. Only complaint was the bar staff and management where morons. We had a party of 40 and booked the place at night and they shut it down first night as we returned for drinks. They where all still there but I think the manager wanted to watch the bathclorette....The next night they remained open having one server for 40 and didnt know what she was doing as the same manager sat with his thumb up his bumb in the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Barb2035
Reviews.Content: Funky hotel in the heart of the French Quarter. Rooms are comfortable and good sized., so ask for a balcony if they are available. Newly renovated with a very moderns design, although not always practical like the knee height vanity in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel & Staff in the Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: romanzwriter
Reviews.Content: We are frequent visitors to New Orleans, since we live about an hour away. We have tried many different hotels in both the French Quarter and Arts District of downtown. Since we are Starwood gold members, we try to choose one of their many hotels in the area, but if a great deal is found or a new hotel goes up in the area, we like to check them out. There are great qualities and other not so great things about each them. But our stay at W last night trumped them all! First of all the customer service is wonderful. We told them that it was my husband's birthday and from the moment we stepped up to the front desk, and spoke with Stacy, we were treated like royalty. We asked if there were any upgrades (as gold members, we can be upgraded if available) and she set us up in a wonderful suite, gave us comp. drink cards and personally walked us to the room. Stacy is what every front desk worker should be: friendly, helpful and cheerful. She made you feel like that they were proud that we'd chosen the W for our hotel stay. I can't tell you the amount of times, we were barely acknowledge, much less welcomed, in other hotels. Not so with the W French Quarter. The hotel has recently been through a renovation and the results are fabulous. The W was always modern, but now it's even more so with a little fun and funky thrown in the mix. It reminded me of the hotels in Sydney Australia. Very high class. (I have uploaded pics) Our Studio Suite had two rooms: A sitting room, with a TV and an oval sofa and flashy lights in the wall and ceiling, a huge bedroom area with a mini bar, desk with stocked with office supplies and TV , and beyond that, a nice size balcony with table and chairs. The bathroom was in two parts one where the sink was and other with the toilet and deep bath with shower. The hotel has a wonderful courtyard with a small pool and lots of comfortable patio furniture to lounge in. It has also open a new restaurant w/ lounge called SoBou (replacing Baccos). Great food and atmosphere. The location of the hotel makes it an even better attraction since it's only a 3 blocks from the Square and St. Louis Cathedral. (It's on the same street!) Very convenient. Bottom line: This hotel has it all and everything from the service to the comfy beds it top notch. We'll come back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Canceling Reservations!”
Reviews.Author: Dustin B
Reviews.Content: After reading the 50/50 reviews of the W French Quarter I was hoping some of the bad reviews were just picky people. I booked my reservation for nights in the Mega Room and was promised one of the jacuzzi patio rooms. A week later I called to confirm the reservation and they said that the room might not be available and wouldn't know until check in since they might still be under renovations. Renovations that I was told would be complete in late July. To top it all off, it took me 3 days to just get in touch with the hotel! The first time the computers were down, they took my info and said they would call back. Never heard from anyone. Second attempt a day later resulted in the phone just constantly ringing and never being picked up twice that day. Third attempt resulted in me getting forwarded to the main reservation line, which has no idea what is going at the hotel itself. Do yourself a favor, stay anywhere but here! This is a prime example of the service industry gone wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, staff better, new restaurant delicious”
Reviews.Author: bedwards1951
Reviews.Content: We have been here twice in the last year. Renovations are also done. The new restaurant is done and the Eggs Benedict was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “ambrester july 14th 2012 room 1425”
Reviews.Author: ambrester
Reviews.Content: i arrived at the "w" EXTREMELY stress out!!! from the moment i walked into the hotel the staff was OVERLY accommodating! i don't remember the ladies names at the front desk..due to the fact that i was upset and crying (july 14th, 2012 @1700) but they BOTH were very understanding and EVEN offered me water and wine! the room was fabulous and the service was prompt and "over the top" friendly with southern hospitality...all the way to the way they answer the phone.."whatever-whenever"..i normally don't write reviews but i just wanted to let you and whom ever else that reads this to know that the "w" COMPLETELY turned my weekend around..and for "that"..i thank you! lastly, i may have the wrong location of the "w"..but whenever i return to NOLA (or any other location)..i WILL be staying there! to include: kevin, lilay, kevin, tony, the two women at the front desk and jonathan (at service/security desk) sincerely, ambrester

Reviews.Title: “Starwood Resort-use points”
Reviews.Author: Susan39564
Reviews.Content: We had a nice time at the "W" in New Orleans. The Courtyard was lovely; the room was tiny. We used our Starwood points.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: onlyvelvet
Reviews.Content: Clean, very friendly staff, cool courtyard, great location in the Quarter. Not to mention the place sure smells GOOD when you've spent too much time on Bourbon Street :)

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Ongoing Construction Problems”
Reviews.Author: AJ H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are Starwood Preferred Members, and we visit New Orleans every year for our anniversary. This was our first visit to this property, and likely the last. The hotel is (allegedly) almost finished with a total remodel. The courtyard is beautiful, and the remodeled rooms, like the one we stayed in, are in questionable taste but quite comfortable. However, we were not told when we booked our five nights that the entire hotel remains open while it is a massive construction site. We woke up every morning at or before 9 am to the sounds of hammering and sawing right above our heads. The room next to the pool is a staging area for the construction of the new restaurant, and the lobby is blocked from the restaurant construction by a hanging black sheet. When we complained about the noise, the staff essentially shrugged and told us there was nothing they could do about it. They politely confirmed that the construction started at 9 am, and that even if we moved rooms, that the property is so small that the noise travels, and that they couldn't guarantee that any room would be quiet. This review is not a complaint about the staff, because there is nothing they could do. In fact, they refunded us a few Starwood points and I think they were helpless. This is a complaint about Starwood and W Hotels. It is ridiculous for a luxury hotel group, one that is expensive and has a reputation for excellence, to keep the hotel open and take money from people when our room, at certain points during our stay, was not habitable. It is an insult to us as customers and as Starwood members. We went on vacation to relax and enjoy ourselves, and instead we woke up every day when the hotel decided to begin construction. If I wanted to wake up early at a set time every day, I would stay home and work. We will likely look for some other hotel group with a better reputation for treating their customers with more respect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy H
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed there for a night. It was my first trip to New Orleans, and the staff (especially Helbert) had great recommendations for food and entertainment. They were incredibly nice. Parking was cheapish and on-site, so I just drove right up to the hotel and valet-parked. The room was what you'd expect from a W: stylish, comfortable bed, nice bathroom. There is some construction going on at the hotel, which is sort of annoying, but it was not a problem on my floor. There's a great pool as well.

Reviews.Title: “Phenominal Hidden Gem in the Heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Rusty T
Reviews.Content: Great Great Hotel. Has the New Orleans Charm but very trendy and is a true boutique hotel. Everything was comfortable from the room to the courtyard to valet parking. They have their own personal gated valet so your vehicle isnt mix matched among others r shared with paid public parking. Location couldnt be better. The staff was super, Thanks to Daniel in Valet and Staci and Shanti at the desk. The stay was great!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings about this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: slhansen219
Reviews.Content: It's really hard to write this review as I have such mixed feelings about it. This hotel has a fabulous location & is more like a boutique hotel than a standard hotel. The hotel has so much ambiance with a BEAUTIFUL courtyard with a small pool. We were there for 5 nights & during that time the hotel offered free drinks in the courtyard on 2 occasions for several hours (11-6 on one of the days) Wow... was that great!! But, for some reason, they BLASTED music so loud you could not carry on a conversation. We asked them if they would turn it down & they complied. It was still too loud... I'm talking loud like a rock concert, so we again requested that they lower the music again & they again complied. It was still horribly loud so we requested earplugs, which we were provided, but didn't really help & also made conversation impossible. As you have probably read in previous reviews, the hotel is still under renovation. Seemed most of the renovations were taking place in the front, Chartres Street side of the hotel, where the reception area and the restaurant, SoBou (due to open July 9), are being remodeled. We thought the renovations would have no affect on us as our room was on the courtyard side. Well, to our dismay, we were awakened at EXACLY 9:00 am on 2 occasions.. Although the rooms were nice, & actually quite large for a standard "Wonderful" room with 2 double beds, there seemed to be a lack in planning. Our biggest complaint about the room was... THERE ARE ZERO towel racks in the bathroom (or anywhere else in the room)... there is a grab bar inside the shower (no bathtub) where the towels were hung. So, you have to remove the towels to take a shower & then there is no other place to hang them when you are done, except on door handles or back on the grab bar. There was wall space large enough in our room to accommodate a towel rack so I hope someone reads this and rethinks this towel rack situation. I did call down to reception to see if we could get a towel stand, but they did not have any. The room was also not equipped with a magnifying makeup mirror, but reception was able to provide us with one. I travel a lot & have found that makeup mirrors are very common in hotels & even cruise ships so I was surprised they did not already have them in the rooms. Also, there are no drawers & very little counter space in the bathroom. The bedroom was better appointed. There was a large flat panel TV in the room and a nice desk. This room had at least 6 easily accessible electrical outlets which is very rare in most hotels, so there were plenty of places to plug in all of the electronics that are now so necessary in our lives. There was no real dresser with drawers, but there was a cabinet area underneath the television with drop down doors that revealed a couple of shelves that you could use as drawers, just a little harder to access your belongings. We found the staff at the hotel to be very friendly and accommodating. At one point one staff member even ran a personal errand for one of my traveling companions. Wow... who does that? It was also very helpful that we could get our airline boarding passes printed in reception and delivered to our rooms, so we got to bypass the aggravation of getting our boarding passes at the airport. I'm sure I will return to this hotel in the future as I believe most of the issues are related to the renovations. & PLEASE... turn the music down in the courtyard!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Amexwtc
Reviews.Content: Very good location, although one of the floors and main lobby under construction they did a good job. Very friendly and helpful. Although one of our rooms was not cooling down, they fixed it and took care of the situation. Rooms and beds very comfortable. Great inner patio with couches very comfortable. Our first time at a W

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice.....Every Thing you expect from a W.....”
Reviews.Author: mcatrace
Reviews.Content: W French Quarter is such a great location! We were able to walk to everything! The room we stayed in was somewhat small but it was new refurbished and very clean. Honestly, I was not expecting a huge room considering that the building is somewhat old but it was very nice. The hotel is undergoing renovations right now so there was some noise and debris but it was not a problem. The noise was always during the day and never first thing in the morning. And the staff was AMAZING. Everyone went above and beyond to make sure that we had a terrific stay. We actually had to tack on another night unexpectedly and they were fantastic about accommodating us. From the bellmen, the bartender and the front desk everyone was super nice and helpful. When we come back to New Orleans we will definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location In French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: NextStopIsWhere
Reviews.Content: Chic, friendly vibe. Beautiful courtyard! I could just lay out there all day. Great location in the French Quarter. I liked this boutique hotel. New Orleans is always fun to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Simply crappy and poorly managed”
Reviews.Author: Dajohurey
Reviews.Content: A bunch of us planned a weekend getaway there the weekend of June 7-10th, 2012. We flew in from all over the country-- NY, San Francisco and Nashville. We were never advised of any renovations or construction when booking, however were notified by a lamo emil just l two days prior to arriving. Our reservations were $350 per night per room and we had three rooms which were non-refundable. Upon arrival, at600 pm, rooms were still not ready. There is no bar, no restaurant or any public space to occupy except outside surrounding the pool area. Banging starts at 8:00 am promptly, so don't plan on staying up let and sleeping in on your holiday-- this is not an option. Staff was very courteous and tried to be helpful, but the situation is out of their control. Rooms were not cleaned unless you called reception to remind the front desk. The rooms are comfortable as well as beds and bedding. This is not what one would expect of a Starwood brand. Shame on you Starood-- this is not Ho Jo's. They comped us all a free night which still does not make up for the bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Pleseant stay even with the constuction”
Reviews.Author: Christy B
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the W French Quarters for one day/night on our way to Florida. They were in the process of renovating, so they only had a make-shift lobby. I've stayed in W hotels before. They have very nice lobbies, so I can only assume this one will look great once it's complete. When we arrived, we were greeted very nicely by Daniel and Mark. However, they only had valet or street parking available - street parking is hard to come by so we had to valet which was a little pricey. On our way to our room, another couple mentioned the noisy construction early in the mornings during the week. However, on the Friday and Saturday morning we were there, we didn't notice any disturbances. The hotel was very clean, and the staff was notably friendly. Daniel and Mark working the entrance were very helpful and knowledgeable of the city, giving recommendations of areas to go and places to see. We're interested to see what this hotel looks like once the renovations are complete, and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Boutique hotel close to all the action”
Reviews.Author: Trickynickysd
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many W's and this one was way different as it was not a high rise or resort, but a boutique hotel. The nice thing about it, is its blocks away from Bourbon street, harrahs, and the river . They have an Acura that will drop you off do you don't have to cab it , if you want to go somewhere else. They have a small quaint pool with nice big towels if you want to get some sun. The nice thing about being in a small hotel is that it's easy to go back and forth to the room. They have a nice courtyard with cabannas to have a smoke or to mingle with hotel guest .All the employees were very nice and made us feel at home . one employee who stuck out was Quentin. He went above and beyond for any need we have . The restaurant was under construction so we didn't get try that. The other W is a little ways away and a big high rise , so if you want a more hotel feel go there, and they have the gym. I believe ours did not unless it was under construction. You don't want to go running in New Orleans unless you like the smell of trash and pee, as especially by Bourbon street it gets pretty grimy with tras

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At W in New Orleans French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Trakerman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a last minute trip to New Orleans in May to use up a credit with Delta that she had from the previous year. The W was the only place we could get that was not booked up possibly because they were undergoing renovations. We had asked for a King bed but a double was all that was available. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a King Spectacular room we just had to wait for it to be ready. Which was perfect because it was early in the day and we were in the heart of the French Quarter, and that meant we were off. We explored, had lunch, shopped and explored some more. When we got back to the hotel our room was ready and it was spectacular. Very modern look and feel, just great decor. We were treated to a couple of splits of wine, white for my wife and red for me. Anything we needed or asked for was given and granted. Concierge was fantastic, confirmed our flights and got us our boarding passes and brought them to our room. Check out was 11:00 am but because our flight wasn't until 5 pm or so, gave us a late checkout of 3 pm. Everything was perfect. Their courtyard was beautiful, I forgot. That was our fifth trip to New Orleans and we would definitely look to W as our new first choice. So much more, not enough time or words. A trip is what you make of it, and it was easy to make it wonderful at the W in New Orleans French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: NKCANBC
Reviews.Content: You think the W you think glamorous and gorgeous ...neither unfortunately. Seek elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: stormy49
Reviews.Content: We made reservations for our 43rd anniversary, June 5-10 and called months ahead to be sure the renovations would be done, we were assured they would be completed by the end of May. We arrived on a Tuesday late morning and were told our room was not ready, so what we noticed was they had no bar, no restaurant, no lobby, an 8 x 12 room for check in, the area around the pool was crowded with workers working on either rooms or the restaurant, hammering, pounding, drilling, what did we walk into? Chaos.....our room was ready by 2 and they put us in 204, a big mistake. Next door they were working on a gym/workout room? It sounded like they were in our room the noise was so bad, we called and were told no rooms were available, call back on Wednesday. We were awakened at 8:15 by hammering, pounding and more drilling, we complained again and were told to go for a walk, this went on for 3 days and finally they discovered a room they could move us to, it is now Friday afternoon and I told my wife that now we could have some peace and quiet, no, they worked thru the weekend, the noise level tho was lower. This was not the trip we envisioned, not for our anniversary. We were assured by the manager, we would be comp'd some points but I won't hold my breath. No one should have been put in room 204, not with the work going on next door, my wife was in tears several times because of the situation and the front desk was no help. It has a wonderful location, when we went for a walk, everything was close, Bourbon St 2 blocks, great places to eat, I find no fault with the location, rooms ok but not SPECTACULAR as we were told, pool was small, all in all a forgettable trip, we have stayed at some remarkable W's and Starwood Resorts, this was not one of them. I will be forwarding a letter to the W hotel management as well as the Starwood management, what we experienced should never have happened and for a manager to tell us to walk around more to get away from the construction was just a stupid remark.

Reviews.Title: “Who Chose the New Decor”
Reviews.Author: Physician005
Reviews.Content: I had a pretty nice stay for three nights at the W under renovation in the French Quarter. Great location, nice staff, service variable, but OK, and I am fussy. Was in a new room. The good news is that unlike most W's there was enough light for my aging eyes. The bad, the new decor is really terrible. Why didnt they keep it simple instead of painting the walls orange with an eyesore of a design as the focal point of the room and the ugliest carpet I have ever seen. Could have been amazing, now certainly comfortable, and the good part is you close your eyes at night and dont have to look up at the scary design above you. I'd stay again, but sorry for the poor designer.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average W”
Reviews.Author: JJFigs
Reviews.Content: Below average W property. First, the property is undergoing renovation. When we booked our trip a few months ago, they told us the renovations would be complete by early May. When we arrived, renovations were far from done. So right off the bat, I was kind of turned off. However, based on my husband's status with SPG, we were able to get a newly renovated room (the only floor that is renovated is the 2nd floor). Overall, the staff was pretty good- we really liked the Bellhops and housekeeping- both were super attentive and accommodating to our needs. The front desk staff (in a makeshift lobby) was a different story. They were rude to say the least. The rooms- okay, I have to say, I was very surprised to walk into a renovated room and find it completely off brand for W properties. I expect consistency from the W brand; I usually get that consistency with every W property I stay at. I'm not sure what's going on with the design of this particular W. I felt like I was in a bad porn movie when I walked into our room. The walls are black and gold (okay, I get it, the colors of New Orleans, but really, did they need to do the entire room in these colors) with one wall and part of the ceiling in a green grass design accent. The bathroom was bright orange and black tile everywhere. The mirror in the bathroom had a cut out of a bow tie. I'm sorry, but I think that is weird and so off brand. I also felt like the construction was kind of shotty. The shower was not level so a puddle formed at your feet and the shelf in the shower that holds the shampoo, etc was also uneven. The good news is, the beds were exactly what you would expect- super comfy- great nights sleep. Construction was being done on all the floors above us, so if you were in your room between 9am-5pm, you heard construction. The W gym was not finished so they offered to either shuttle you to the other W (about 8 mins away) or you could walk to the Sheraton (just a few blocks) and use that gym. Not awful, but not convenient either. Since they do not have a dining room during construction, you could order room service- but it was slow and they were out of a lot of things. So not a great option. The pool- super small. Only about 12 or so chairs - very small area. But the actual courtyard itself was really nice- lots of great seating and peaceful. The best part of this property is the location, location, location!!! You are in the heart of the French Quarter- walking distance to EVERYTHING. Seriously amazing location. I honestly don't think I would stay at this property again- I'm sure when the renovations are done, it will be significantly better, but for me, it was so off brand that it just turned me off.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!!”
Reviews.Author: mdghoover
Reviews.Content: I have been here twice in 2 years and it's the best location in the French Quarter! The first time I stayed there I was with my husband and we had a great time. The bathroom was huge, the room was quiet and the bar was open! Went back with my best friend for 4 nights and we had an upgraded room (we had a balcony room and that was fantastic!) and it was newly remodeled so you would think it would be better. I am a Starwood Gold member and travel often so I expected the W standard amazing room! The bathroom was like a postage stamp and there is only 1 mirror and it's in the bathroom. The walls are thin so you can hear your neighbors. There was construction but I was forewarned about it so it didn't bother us. However, the fire alarm at 2:30AM was the worse part of this experience! The court yard with the pool and couches are nicely shaded with a relaxed atmosphere. The staff was very accommodating and helpful! You do have to pay about $40.00 a day for parking so be aware if you are driving to NOLA. If you are flying into NOLA take a taxi ($33.00) or a hotel shuttle ($20.00 per person). If you travel only in the French Quarter you do not need a car. The hotel does have a shuttle within a 6 mile radius before 6PM. I will be going back to the hotel and the main reason is because of it's location and their staff! Even the construction crew were professional and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but with construction going on not a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SterlingNY
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W two nights, platinum Starwood member (gold for life). Room was ok, but had only one very small window that did not look out on anything. The room was old, which showed in the details (the shower head sprayed water everywhere if you tried to move the head). The reception area, bar and restaurant were under renovation. The hotel did make up for this by giving free drinks at the courtyard pop up bar. Front desk staff seemed lackadaisical and not interested. Cleaning staff were very good. Pool is small, but nice. Location makes up for most faults. I suggest waiting until renovations are done.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and ambience”
Reviews.Author: KMD814
Reviews.Content: This is the best of both worlds - you get the modern "cool" factor of the W Hotels chain and the great location in the French Quarter. They have a beautiful patio in the back with a small pool. Check it out at night - beautiful place to have a drink. The lobby is very small and the restaurant attached to the hotel changes often - I wouldn't count on that for eating. The good news is that you are within blocks of some of the greatest food in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Halbert Joseph Superstar at W!”
Reviews.Author: Evelyn F
Reviews.Content: Our room was very spacious for a "W" room and the balcony provided a great view and feel of the French Quarter. The room's decor was fantasic and all the little touches and amenities made the stay very comfortable and enjoyable. The pool/patio area was very nicely laid out and enticed us to hang out there for coffee in the mornings. The location was absolutely perfect for taking in the sights, sounds and truly feeling the vibe of New Orleans. However, the best part of our stay was the superior service we received from the staff, especially Halbert Joseph! He made us feel like we were royalty. His incredible service began even before we arrived, when he took the time to send us information on tours and restaurants we might enjoy as this was our first visit to this fantastic city. Upon our arrival he greeted us as if we were family. He anticipated our every need and knowing this was our first visit to the area, marked up a map for us laying out a great plan so we could get in as much as possible for the time period we were there. He always had a ready smile and his first question was always if there was anything he could help us with. The rest of the staff was courteous and friendly as well, but Halbert is definitely the superstar standout! We will go back there as much for Halbert as for the rest of the great amenities offered by this super W location.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: worldthetravel
Reviews.Content: The rooms are huge, the bathroom is awesome, the location can't be beat. W in general is a great hotel chain, but this is a super boutique one which makes it even better. They even have a small little pool/bar to go hang out at. It's perfect for a great weekend getaway. You have the chill hotel, surrounded by the good old french quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect NOLA Vibe”
Reviews.Author: Brianorchid
Reviews.Content: STACEY BROKE MY HEART- the rooms were nice and the place had an amazing vibe as soon as you walked in. The staff was more like friends than any other placed I have ever stayed. They were very eager to make sure you were having a good time. I truly was sad when I was leaving. Stacey, the lady at the front desk was very fun and personable. I cannot wait to plan my next tip to NOLA and at the W.

Reviews.Title: “Small, quiet, not your typical W”
Reviews.Author: ilove-europ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and it was our first time in New Orleans. We were there for a wedding at the Royal Sonesta. Since we are Starwood members we deciede to stay here instead using our points. It was not like the typical Ws with the loud bumping lobby. But it was a nice change especially since this city is so loud everywhere else. We stopped by the other W and if you are looking for the typical "W feel" then stay over there. The hotel was under construction when we went so there was no bar or restaurant in the hotel. That was a little annoying. And when they opened a temp bar in the courtyard it was only there on fri, sat and sunday night. But once they re-open that should be taken care of. We really liked the location and could walk eveywhere. The street is pretty quiet and you can't hear street traffic but the rooms aren't that sound proof and we could here our neighbors. We had 2 different rooms since our original reso wasnt available at chek-in. We much preferred the room facing the courtyard vs the room with a balcony overlooking the street. That was loud when the neighbors would smoke and drink outside on theri balcony. Acura service was always full everytime we tried to use it but the bell man would get us a cab everytime. Service was great and the concierge helped us out with 3 dinner reservations. We loved Cochon and Commander's Palace!! Overall, I would stay here again but would hope that the bar would be open along with an eating area.

Reviews.Title: “Construction ends in July”
Reviews.Author: crowdiggity
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel I've always wanted to stay at after walking by it many times while visiting New Orleans. They have 96 rooms and it should be charming and authentic. It was anything but. The noise started at 7am with saws and construction crews hammering away. The noise was all around. I felt like the hotel's priority was not of the guests but more for the construction. I checked out the very next day and went to the W New Orleans which isn't as good of a location as the W French Quater but has a true W feel. This is the first negitive review I have posted in 5 years. I recommend staying away from this hotel. The check in staff were very helpful and nice but the hotel was sold out and they had very limited options.

Reviews.Title: “Halbert at the front desk”
Reviews.Author: Esther W
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a whirlwind trip throughout the states. We arrived in New Orleans after driving non-stop from Largo Florida to be greeted by Halbert who was efficiency personified. Although only there for 2 days, he was always at the desk (does he ever sleep!) and his warmth and genuine care added greatly to our stay.

Reviews.Title: “a Big Easy decision”
Reviews.Author: Summer L
Reviews.Content: As a Mississippi native and Atlanta resident, I have the highest standards of genuine Southern hospitality and I can say without a doubt that the staff of the W FQ has raised that bar. I have spent a lot of time in New Orleans in the 30 years of my life, but never had an experience reveling our stay this past March. Halbert, Shahidah, and the entire staff fully welcomed our bachelorette party over the St. Patty's Day weekend and no request was too great. From last minute party planning to decorating the rooms to locating batteries for our strobe light, they were exceptional! We stayed in the adjoining carriage house suites which were over-sized and perfect for a group of girls to simultaneously get ready. The private courtyard of each carriage house room had a hot tub and made for the perfect night cap. By day, we enjoyed the pool in the fabulous traditional French courtyard complete with an outdoor bar. A po-boy restaurant around the corner even delivered a cajun lunch to us poolside. We had the most exciting and comfortable stay possible and are planning to vacay there again this year. The W FQ defines a Southern Boutique Hotel........ So after feeling totally spoiled and engrossed in the Nola culture, our lodging decisions from now on will be...... Big Easy ones. :) Thank ya'll for the experience, Summer

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Chad B
Reviews.Content: Love this place. The construction is a pain, but should be wrapped by summer. The staff was so over the top nice and helpful it made up for any jack hammers. Especially ask for Halbert and Daniel. The two guys were super cool and couldn't be more helpful. Southern hospitality at its finest. Ya'll.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, great staff”
Reviews.Author: wundrwomynn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this W for a convention but also wanted to be in the quarter so this hotel was convenient. Construction did not bother us at all - we didn't hear any noise unless we were outside or next to the window & it didn't start until about 9am anyway. I think they get room service from a nearby hotel but why would you waste your time/money wating in your room when you're in New Orleans? The staff was so helpful & friendly. They were trying so hard to make sure everyone was happy during the renovations. And plenty of hot water! A nice stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Low quality while under renovation”
Reviews.Author: Andrew K
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly and helpful, but the noise from construction is intolerable. Also, it appears as though maintenance of existing rooms has fallen by the wayside until constuction is completed--both the sink and showerhead in bathroom were broken when we checked in. They should either close the hotel during consutruction, or offer discounted rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: 003jack003
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful in assisting a surprise trip for my wife and I which made it a fabulous experience. The hotel is going through renovations but we knew this going in, and therefore it did not affect our stay. Of course it would have been nice to have a bar on site, but there are no shortages of those in New Orleans! The location is perfect - not on busy Bourbon St, but close to where you can walk anywhere in the French Quarter. Once renovations are complete this will hotel will only get better! Oh, and great courtyard and pool area.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE. FALSE PROMISES ABOUND!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gnocchiman
Reviews.Content: At check-in, the staff assured us that the construction would not affect our stay. But oh, by the way, there's no restaurant or bar here. "Uhhh, well it's still our vacation. Let's just go with it honey." The next morning we woke up to the sound of angle grinders and jackhammers...directly beneath our room!!! We paid full rate for this stay, booked weeks in advance and they put us in a room directly on top of the noise?!? We saw several people check in after us, so I know it wasn't the last room available either. Called hotel staff, and they said they might be able to move us to another room, later that day. Maybe. Gee thanks. We also ordered room service. "It'll be there in 35 minutes or less." 50 minutes later...nothing. We eventually left after waiting for 1 1/2 hours to get to an appointment, but NEVER saw our breakfast. The beds are also not the famous mattresses that you find at every other W hotel. No pillowtop, and very uncomfortable. When we called down to ask for an extra pillow the second night, we were told that none were available unless they ordered some from another hotel. To the staff's credit, they eventually brought pillows 2 hours later, but what hotel doesn't have extra pillows on site? The staff we spoke to did seem to be trying their best. I place the blame on whoever is running this hotel for running a pathetic overall operation. Improvements are necessary, I get it. But you should still have some respect for your paying guests. My opinion of W hotels has forever changed.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AT ALL COSTS !!!”
Reviews.Author: PEIGOLFER
Reviews.Content: The ONLY good thing is the location ! The rooms are outdated, thread bare, scarred paint & WAY OVER PRICED !!! TERRIBLE SERVICE - They can't get anything right: ESPECIALLY THE BILL !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, friendly staff but not a "W" feel”
Reviews.Author: Wyvn
Reviews.Content: A convenient quiet location in the French quarter. A few blocks will get you to Burbon street, Jackson square or the Aquarium/Insectarium. On the plus side the courtyard seating with the flaming water fountain and the heated pool are the highlight of the hotel. There was only a booze cart there on the weekend (not far to walk to get some booze to go), not sure if they would have food service once the restaurant is finished in the courtyard. The hotel parking rate is equivalent to others in the area. The lobby area is oddly off to the side but everyone was polite and as a gold member felt taken care of. On the negative side of the hotel is the room itself, nothing special (the Four Points Sheraton in Memphis was slightly better) and my whole family disliked the beds. We even checked out a night early because of it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: travelbecomesher
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W recently during a business trip and had a fantastic time. The courtyard is beautiful and the grounds are kept very clean. I was upgraded to a bigger room with a hot tub on the patio which was just wonderful. The staff at the W are friendly and very helpful. The only slight issue would be the remodeling that is going on, but that doesnt ruin the experience at all. The location is a perfect spot to get to everything you want to do in the French Quarter. Also, they are remodeling the restaurant but they still have room service and it is truly amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Kurlykbay
Reviews.Content: They are under major renovation and our room was right above a construction site. No bar, no restaurant, we waited over an hour for a breakfast that never came, were woken up at 8 am with hammers and saws, tv not working, no extra pillows. This place is a mess.

Reviews.Title: “Great service & location, remodel is disruptive”
Reviews.Author: Joel M
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location and the great service you expect at a W. The front desk staff, valet team, and everyone you encounter are cheerful & anxious to help. Daniel, the driver for the Acura experience was especially great! They are doing a major remodel right now (March 2012) and that causes a few problems. They do not have any deluxe rooms available on the courtyard. The bar & restaurant are closed (the free bar they offer in the afternoon closes at 5pm, so it was hard to catch it open). The construction noise is everywhere during the day, though they don't seem to start until 8:00 or 8:30. Not the place you'd want to be to sleep one off until noon.

Reviews.Title: “trip to NoLa.”
Reviews.Author: albert p
Reviews.Content: Very close to french quarter. We walked it every time. Nickii E at front desk helpful. Concierges desk suggested dinner reservations, and walking tour of garden district including ride on trolley. Surprised hotel did not have complimentary internet thru out. (free for 1/2 hour in lobby, or pay in the room) We took taxi from airport to hotel, (fixed fee $33.00 each way) did not have to worry about parking. They took care of luggage from checkout time to when we were leaving for airport. Close to wonderful eating. (grits and shrimp for breakfast) They even change the rugs in the elevators from "good afternoon" to "good evening" daily.

Reviews.Title: “I Didn't Want to Leave!”
Reviews.Author: foxegurl266
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at other W hotels, so I knew to expect modern and funky decor, but like many other reviewers mentioned, it was the service and the attention to details that really impressed me about the French Quarter W location. The valets were very friendly (parking is $34 per day) and the staff was great, too. They always smiled and greeted me whenever I saw them. I especially liked Halbert who remembered my name whenever he saw me; an unexpected, but appreciated gesture. As I mentioned above, this hotel really pays attention to the details. Candles are displayed at night and removed by morning, the carpet in the elevator rotates to say, "Good morning, afternoon, and evening" according to the time of day, complimentary water was replaced in my room daily, I received a complimentary bottle of wine upon my arrival, and I actually saw someone cleaning the windowsills and even on top of the emergency exit signs. One of my favorite parts of my stay was the bathroom. It was HUGE! My husband visited me for the bathroom and he said you could fit a bed in the bathroom and still have room to spare. The bathroom featured a large, glass shower (No hitting your elbows on the shower walls. There was plenty of room!), pleasant smelling shampoo, conditioner, bar soap, body lotion (Thick stuff. Very nice), and face scrub. After a shower in the large shower with excellent water pressure, you could dry off in one of two available robes. And getting ready was more fun with your own marble-top vanity in the bathroom with a chair in an area separate from the sink (which made it nice for more than one person to be in the bathroom at a time). There is a minibar, snacks, Fuji water, and wine (with wine glasses and opener) in the room, along with a few other essentials in the room such as an umbrella, intimacy kit, first aid kit, and disposable camera (all for purchase). I had plenty of room for my luggage and clothes in a tall wardrobe with three storage drawers. My second favorite thing about the room was the neat windows. There were shutter style and you could open them all the way so you can lean out the window and see the streets of the French Quarter. While the restaurant was under construction (you can still have breakfast and lunch brought to your room for a fee), there is plenty to eat nearby. So much so that it's overwhelming! There is a concierge who is happy to make reservations and arrange for an Acura to take you on a complimentary journey through the city. I recommend this hotel and if you're torn between this W or the other W in New Orleans, I'd go for the French Quarter location.

Reviews.Title: “World's friendliest staff!”
Reviews.Author: Fresser48
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was the friendliest and most helpful of any hotel we've ever stayed in. Since there is currently construction going on at this W, it is difficult to give a fair rating. As SPG members we expected a better room. The only available room was small and there wasn't even a comfortable chair in it. But at least it was at the rear of the total away from the construction noise and jackhammers. A stay at this W will probably be better after the construction is completed and, hopefully, the rooms are upgraded a bit. The extremely friendly and accommodating staff and great location in the French Quarter are reason enough for us to return to the W on our next visit (after renovations are completed).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ashjanbar
Reviews.Content: I went to the W hotel for Mardi Gras and had an awesome time with my friends, the beds were really comfortable, and the staff was great from the bellman, front desk agent to the restaurant. The staff was really helpful at giving directions and giving us the heads up on all of the best places to go eat and visit. I had called before arrival to ask about the traffic and the agent on the phone was also friendly despite all of the Mardi Gras chaos going on at the hotel. The only complaint I have was the guest next to us but noisy guest are expected during Mardi Gras. I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Southern hospitality at its finest!”
Reviews.Author: Chippercjm
Reviews.Content: We came out to New Orleans to celebrate my boyfriends Birthday. We have never been, but realized right away that the W hotel was the epitome of southern charm and hospitality! Unfortunately during our stay, the hotel was undergoing construction, but this enabled us to not go lax and instead fully see the NoLa sights and culture! We recommend the W for its character and funky flair, and fully suggest staying there even if only for the hospitality and accommodations from the concierge and staff, especially Daniel who kindly greeted us every morning and whom also drove us to the Ritz for our final few nights.

Reviews.Title: “W French Quarter - Definitely Exceeds Expectations”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynStuart
Reviews.Content: I used to think we (babyboomers) weren't hip enough for the uber-hip W hotels. At least in NYC and elsewhere, they seem to have garnered the reputation of catering to the super-hip - the music and modeling industry. (And that's OK, too...hey, somebody's gotta serve them!) But we were more than pleasantly surprised by our recent experience at the W French Quarter in New Orleans. It more than exceeded our expectations. And most of that can be credited to the super and superb service of their concierge, Staci, who worked with me both prior to our arrival there and during our stay. I don't know if it's Southern hospitality or the training W affords them, but the entire staff - including the young drivers of the Acura available to us during our stay, Quentin and Daniel, exuded friendliness and the quintessence of good customer service. And we enjoyed coming back to the heated pool and lovely courtyard every (sunny) afternoon. The staff couldn't have been more gracious and the whole "experience" more perfect. Location was great for us, too. I would've sprung for TWO wastebaskets if I were the hotel, one in the actual room and one in the bathroom, but, Hey, nobody's perfect. Right?

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: DNiemeyer
Reviews.Content: Our family recently stayed here for 4 nights during the kids' spring break. Although we wished there wasn't construction and that we could have visted the restaurant and bar, it was never a problem. The room we stayed in was excellent. The kids LOVED the pool. It was heated and they loved being in it at night. Every staff member we encountered was friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay here again. The location can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Halbert at the front desk...”
Reviews.Author: houstonlsugirl
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times. While we wished that the construction would have been completed before we arrived, it really didn't cause any issues for us. THe location of the hotel is very ideal if you plan on spending time int he FQ. We had a great room and every staff member we encountered was so gracious. We thought Halbert was especially wonderful and made our stay very relaxing! THank you Halbert for all of your help...

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in FQ”
Reviews.Author: Kathy I
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights 03/04/12 - 03/10/12 and had a great time. We used SPG points and had a "Wonderful" room. The room was very nice, bed comfortable, nice products and large bathroom.I loved the large vanity table in the bathroom. The location was great,we were able to walk all over the FQ from the Hotel. The employee's were all very friendly and professional. We did get a ride in the W Acura to the WW 2 museum by a very nice young man named Daniel. The construction was only loud on 2 afternoons (on and off) and one time the water was off in the Hotel for several hours but we had gone for the day by then. Overall I would recommend this Hotel highly and when the renovation is done it will be even better.

Reviews.Title: “Judy, a guest at your hotel”
Reviews.Author: Judy C
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the W was very pleasant. I would like to comment on the concierge, Travis Frye. I had to handle some important paperwork concerning the selling of my home in New Jersey, while staying at the W....and he assisted completely with me. Not only did he help me with obtaining the papers I needed, but he helped by directing me to the UPS facility to ovrnight the papers. My compliments to your staff.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was friendly - Good Location - Room was OK”
Reviews.Author: Nancy A
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly upon our arrival, specially the Valet staff. The location was good in relation to our business at hand. I was not impressed with the room. Overall, not as impressed as I have been by other W's (Buckhead and Vierques)...

Reviews.Title: “W in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: John N
Reviews.Content: Location was superb, staff very friendly but also very attentive and helpful. Rooms were very clean and modern, beds very comfortable. Windows open, air was excellent. Pool was warm and inviting, although too hot for real swimming. A few quibbles: pricey for what you get, no gym.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: 1manWOLFpack_12
Reviews.Content: Title says it all. W French Quarter should not be confused with W located off Canal St. The Hotel is currently undergoing renovations right now. Upon arrival my co-worker and I were welcomed with all smiles and professional front desk crew. Due to the construction I received an upgrade with my own private balcony looking over the pool and courtyard. The room was very spacious for a hotel in the Quarter. Upon check in the front desk provided me with a complimentary gift of Francis Coppola Merlot Wine (hey is New Orleans) of course you expect alcohol. The hallway leading to the rooms can be a little intimidating by being rather dark and with different color mood lighting but this is typical of a W hotel. The Hotel is located in a perfect spot of everything in the Quarter and especially Bourbon St. Your only 2 blocks away which is perfect when your shuffling or crawling back to your room from a FUN night on Bourbon St. 2 blocks from Canal St. and a short 10 min walk from the riverfront. The bed is very comfortable and plush for a much needed recovery. WARNING!!! Due to construction there is A LOT of noise during the day but not before 9AM and not after 4PM but this is New Orleans, just like NYC you don't stay in your room that much anyway. There is NO Gym or fitness center...however the hotel allows you access to the other W Hotel at the river walk...a quick and nice warm up jog that takes only 5min to run there. Once you get there the Fitness Center is amazing for a Hotel. No Business Center as well here.

Reviews.Title: “Undergoing renovations-noisy in the early morning, stay away”
Reviews.Author: p3mikey
Reviews.Content: The hotel will no doubt be very nice, once the renovations are complete. Stayed here on a two night business trip and was warned in an email from the hotel about a week prior to the trip that the hotel bar and restaurant were closed while the hotel was undergoing renovation. What they didn't tell me was the renovations start at 7am and the dumpsters are replaced by a big truck sometime between 6 am and 6:30 am. I had a room on the third floor and was woken up both mornings either by the dump trucks or the construction noise. As I type this, there is a sander/grinder being used on the balcony/exterior of the hotel right outside my room. Stay away from the hotel until the renovations are complete.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa H
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the W New Orleans French Quarter. We had a very unfortunate experience with our room being located close to construction taking place in the hotel. The staff at the hotel was extremely attentive and did their very best to make things right for us. I can't say enough about the concierge Halbert. Truly a stand-out in service. Recommend verifying up front if construction is still taking place and if so doing what you can to ensure you are not going to be affected by it. Don't expect a fancy W - this hotel is older and going through remodel - but do expect excellent service. Some of the nicest people we met in NOLA - a place where everyone is friendly and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent personnel”
Reviews.Author: Ashly M
Reviews.Content: Each employee we encountered was polite, helpful, kind and genuinely enjoyable to visit with. The hotel itself had flair and ambiance, but for me, the experience was in the staff. Daniel, in particular, always had time to entertain questions, give great recommendations and never hesitated to accommodate our every need. Thank you all, great work.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Mardis Gras Stay- Thank You!”
Reviews.Author: aryno
Reviews.Content: I booked 4 rooms here for Mardis Gras weekend, and I was holding my breath that my guests would be well taken care of and enjoy the hotel and location. Well, the hotel itself, and the staff hit it out of the park. Staci was in contact with me two weeks before setting up airboat tours and dinner reservations, and confirming everything as well as my room preferences. She went above and beyond before our stay and then during our stay as well. Valerie in reservations at the hotel helped me confirm an upgrade with points at the last minute and she just "made it happen". It would have been easy to say, it's just not possible, but she kept at it. All of the gentleman who work the valet and generally just help a girl out with directions and bags and dinner suggestions and getting a cab and keeping our kids entertained- wow, thank you. The property is authentic, it's real New Orleans. That means that the walls are a little thin and you can hear people in the courtyard, but it reallly was not an issue for us, even during the height of mardis gras. If you are used to hearing crickets at night then bring some earplugs or pick some up for a buck at the walgreens around the corner. The pool is heated and it's fantastic to swim in the evening and they have great cabanas and lounge chairs around the pool. Not having a restaurant is NOT a problem. My favorites for a quick bite: Something else cafe (and they have an egg white omelette with sweet potato hash), camelia grill, or just pop across the street to fleur de lis for a breakfast sandwich. My family really enjoyed sitting around the fountain at night under the candle lit trees. Thanks so much for a great stay- we have one more day and then it's back home! But, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but disappointed with the service.”
Reviews.Author: TravelPrincessMA
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stated at the W New Orleans while visiting in November 2011. We booked our stay using combined Starwood points so we had to make two reservations for the length of our stay. I called the night before we arrived to confirm the details and to request a courtyard facing room. The woman who answered was very friendly and told me that we would be able to remain in the same room for the duration of our stay, even though we had 2 different reservations. She also told me that there was a courtyard facing room available and that she would make sure we had one upon our arrival. At check in, it was as if I had never called. We had to reconfirm that we could stay in the same room for our stay and there was not a courtyard room available. So basically, I was lied to by the woman the night before. Additionally, the restaurant was closed for reservations so there was no where to get food or drinks. The hotel gave you a free bottle of water but this definitely did not make up for the lack of the onsite facility. Despite these details, the hotel was great. The location is ideal, the rooms were nice sized and the pool/courtyard area were great. The hotel did make up for their mishaps in the beginning by allowing us a really late check out on our last day.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Excellent Client Service”
Reviews.Author: ExUSA
Reviews.Content: I enjoy the trendy appeal of the W Hotel chain, and once this property is done with their renovation, I imagine it will have the same charm. Unfortunately right now they are undergoing significant changes and there is no restaurant, spa, or bar for guests. However, the rooms are clean and spacious, and the beds/pillows are comfortable. It's also ideally situated in the French Quarter. What made this experience stand out was the client service. The staff are extremely friendly (and were very apologetic for the current state of the hotel). Three employees in particular stood out-- Steven, Daniel and Sian (in reception) who very very friendly and extremely helpful, but every staff member was cheerful and pleasant to be around. I would definitely go back to this hotel again, but would wait until the renovations were over.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: Becky P
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here! This hotel is one of the worst hotel we have ever stayed at!!!! We had problem after problem after problem after problem our entire stay! We would rate this hotel 0 stars if possible!!!! Staying here was a nightmare! Here is a list of everything that was wrong with this hotel: 1. Room was not ready when we checked in...we were told to walk around the French Quarter until the room was ready and was promised a call when ready which we never received. Walking around for an hour would not have been a problem if it was not pouring rain! The hotel offered an umbrella for our use but apparently they were out of stock after they offered us an umbrella. 2. Room keys were not available when our room was finally ready and was told we would receive a call in our room when ready! We never received a call, we wasted 2 hours waiting in our room! 3. Extremely loud music was blasting in the courtyard from 9am - 10pm daily despite numerous complaints from multiple guests that they were unable to relax. The music was so loud you could hear it in the halls and rooms. Finally after complaining 5 times over a period of 2 days the music was turned down to a tolerable level. 4. Acura car service was not available as they informed us the car was in the shop for repairs. The hotel seriously only has one car?!? We made reservations weeks in advance for the car service! We were told it would be back Sunday or Monday, we called to check the status both days but the car was still in the shop. BS! 5. The cable/picture quality was extremely poor and movie channels were not available. The hotel sent someone to check it out, he came in tightened the cable and left. He called us about 10 minutes later to see if it was working but it wasn't and instructed us to unplug and plug back in and fiddle with the cables...ummm isn't that your job?!?!?! By the time he came back up to try again it was way too late in the night to even bother with it. 6. Day 3 of our stay there wasn't any hot water in our room! We went down to the front desk to complain along with a list of several things that were broken or disgusting in our room to be fixed while we were out. The girl at the front desk promised to have all our issues addressed and fixed asap. Only 2 of the items from our list were addressed and the rest were ignored! 7. Walls are paper thin...you can hear everything inside and outside the hotel! 8. Hotel staff is unresponsive and sometimes rude when complaining about something wrong with the hotel. 90% of complaints were not addressed! 9. The cleaning staff does a very poor job cleaning rooms and straightening up. Our room was covered in dust for days! 10. The last day of our stay there was heavy construction being done to the restaurant, it was intolerable! The construction workers started jack hammering around 10am! We called at 1:30pm to ask how long this was going to be going on and to complain about the noise & the jack hammering shaking our room the girl at the front desk was extremely rude! She stated with a nasty attitude "You think that's bad???? Try sitting at the front desk! Construction was also extremely annoying when taking a dip in the tiny pool. Seriously what luxury hotel does major construction during tourist season?!?!? 11. As we were packing up on our last night we noticed that one of our bags of gifts we had purchased was missing from our room! We immediately contacted the front desk with concern and anger! We received a call back from the front desk a few minutes later that they were trying to contact a supervisor to get this issue resolved. We had to rush out of our room to try to replace the gifts but the stores were closed! We wasted an hour running around the French Quarter at 12am - 1am in the morning! We went back to the front desk and were told that the cleaning staff must have thrown the bag out by mistake and would try to resolve the issue. Why would the cleaning staff shift through our large stack of purchases and just throw one bag out?!?! The hotel did not offer to cover the loss but rewarded us some Starwood Points...we don't care about points!!! We want our stuff back! We spent hours picking out perfect gifts for friends and coworkers! When we checked out at 6am our issue had yet to be resolved we were told to check out the gift shops in the airport to replace the missing gifts.
