We have yet to receive a call from the hotel supervisor regarding this issue and it's been over 12 hours!!!!! We will be following up everyday until this issue has been resolved and all Starwood Points have been returned from our stay. Thank god we did not pay for this stay but used Starwood Points. You would think the hotel would treat long time Starwood Members with a little more respect and try to insure their stay is pleasant and relaxing. Pros: Doormen and Valet staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Hotel is in a great location and the courtyard is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Better the second time around!”
Reviews.Author: sginmd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here about 2 years ago and my initial impression was that I didn't particularly love it. We booked another stay on points through SPG and I was pleasantly surprised this time around. We were upgraded to a larger room which I think was the difference for me in liking the property this time. Last time we had a smaller room and were staying for 5 days and there was no storage. The larger room and bathroom were great and I would definitely return to the W French Quarter for that reason. The location is great. Staff were very friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: avidda1979
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at the W in the french quarter. The rooms have a welcoming feel to them only made better by the staff. As an SPG gold member I have an expectation of the starwood hotel line and the W exceeded my expectations. My room upgrade was courtyard access room with complementary internet access. I would like to thank Halbert and the staff at the hotel for making my stay memorable. This will be my top choice hotel for any future stay in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great service.”
Reviews.Author: CleveGal1
Reviews.Content: First, the positives: this hotel is in a great location within the French Quarter. It is close enough to be a short walk to Royal or Bourbon Street in one direction and maybe a 10 minute walk from the French Market district. The courtyard is nicely done and a great place to relax while staying. When staying in the French Quarter, you can expect that rooms will be smaller than usual and this held true. But they have worked well with the space they have. The hotel is undergoing renovations right now, so there is no restaurant on site, but in a city known for its food, this wasn't an issue. The service, however, left something to be desired. We arrived at the hotel at 1 pm, before standard check in. At the time we learned that the Internet was down at the hotel, so they could not check us in. It took probably 15 minutes for them to tell us that. When they finally told us, we checked our bags and left our phone number so they could call us when the room was ready and set out to explore. We got back a few hours later to discover that the room was ready, but no one contacted us. We had to be escorted up to the room because the Internet was still down and they could not provide us with keys. Eventually we had to go back down to the lobby to request keys. Their system was up and running again, but no one notified us. I completely understand technical issues which are outside of their control, but I would expect it to be handled much differently when staying at a W hotel. There were numerous other little things which simply don't fit with what one expects while staying at a W hotel. Sunday morning we had no hot water for about 90 minutes. The concierge told us the construction at the hotel stopped on the weekends. Not quite. It was quite loud while we were in our room. Sunday we left the room before noon and returned around 4 pm to find that it had not been serviced. Overall, a great location within the French Quarter. And some of the service was great - the valet remembered us from the first moment and was very helpful! But most of it was lacking. As I mentioned, they are under construction now, so perhaps it will improve in the future. But the service needs to come up to the level I expect from the brand.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have arrived at a worst time”
Reviews.Author: BatmanMarlborough
Reviews.Content: Could not have arrived at a worst time as major renovations started only a couple of days before. First thing to see on a very late arrival at 1.30am was the area in front coned off and a giant skip with the news that the bar and restaurant were closed including for breakfast. Woken at 8am with pneumatic drills in what can only be described as a way under par room. My wife was just a teeny bit annoyed and went in search of the manager! Here is where it got better. The manageress just knew what she obviously thought twenty paces out and to her credit did whatever she could. She changed our rooms to something much better and away a bit from the noise and credited our account with $200. She did all she could but should never have been put in this position in the first place. Still however our stay was somewhat spoiled as you just could not stay in the hotel except in your room outside of working hours and there was no public rooms or even a bar available and the super courtyard area was unusable during the day due to the noise. The room was much better however it was still very, very tired and even the duvet smelled and was dirty! Next day they even closed the street in front with a giant crane and three articulated lorries to lift in new aircon onto the roof. The pneumatics then got worse as they moved the compressors into the courtyard and left the doors all open to the work areas. The noise was just..... On the plus side the young guys looking after the entrance and garage in particular Daniel could not have been more helpful. So stay here when completed but definitely not until is my recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Might not be what you expect”
Reviews.Author: Simon G
Reviews.Content: Backs up my experience that the boutique-sized W locations are of a different breed than the larger W's. This small hotel is tucked away in the French Quarter and makes a great first impression. But the front desk staff has been lacking in my two visits, rooms are a bit run-down, restaurant is underwhelming. The central patio is appealing but is easily taken over - whether or not that's a good thing is all about who gets there first. I'll stay here again on weekdays, but on weekends I'll go further off the beaten path - or to the larger W a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “terrible manager and security personal”
Reviews.Author: sam c
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel was perfect but everthing else was terrible. The maid service did not show up at timely, the management was completely useless (the security personal loceked the pool earlier than what we were told, when I confronted the front desk, she was initally suprised that it was locked. When I asked the manager to honor their word and open the pool, she mumbled that it was company policy that she can not override, later called the security personal responsible for the pool, he was exteremely rude and told me he will not unlock to pool even the manager asks him).

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, poor facilities”
Reviews.Author: schav
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for a weekend getaway for 3 nights. I would almost rate this Poor, but the friendly, helpful staff and sleek interiors bring it up a star. The Good: * The staff was great, extra courteous and friendly * The staff was helpful in pointing out places to eat and visit, reserving taxis, making room adjustments * They had the Acura Experience: they will drop you off anywhere in an MDX within 5 miles for free * Great location, nice courtyard * The citrus water in the lobby/desk area is refreshing The Bad: * The rooms are not soundproofed very well. The first one was not even near the elevators but the repeated humming noises kept us up until we changed rooms; the second (the one they temporarily switched us to) could not keep the courtyard partier sounds out; the final room we switched to was extremely loud: some party kids were in and out slamming their doors next door, while a couple next door was having an extra long sex session that sounded like they were in our room! * the bathroom sink hot water handle didn't close all the way in the 2nd room and so water leaked * the showers look sleek, but are poorly designed (impossible to turn on the shower from outside the stall w/o getting soaked) * the cordless phone was broken in our 2nd room I am pretty laid back and never really complain given that all I mainly care about is that the hotel can provide a good night's sleep and is clean. It was unfortunate that at this sleek looking W, it was mainly just the latter, not the former. You could tell this W looked like someone took an old Nawlins hotel/building and just put on some sleek decorating and lounge music w/o changing a lot of the interior. Maybe the Downtown W is a little better?

Reviews.Title: “Excellence”
Reviews.Author: zakhoke
Reviews.Content: The staff at this location personify excellence! The staff at this W location was warm in their welcoming my wife and I and very and accommodating to our needs. We were upgraded to a larger room, given a bottle of red wine during check in and although we would have liked to experience the bar/restaurant at the hotel, the staff offered up a plethora of alternatives around the town and the hotel. Thanks to Daniel, Staci, the gentleman who helped me get flowers delivered to my room for my wife's Birthday and every single one of the members of this location's staff for consistently going above and beyond the call of duty to ensure our comfort and happiness during our stay...it was absolutely amazingly perfect! THANK YOU TEAM W HOTEL FRENCH QUARTER!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Rubis4
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, great location just minutes from Bourbon street but still very quiet. Rooms are ok but pay extra and get the ones with a small terrace its worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Ravi G
Reviews.Content: I am newly SPG Platinum and benefits did not disappoint at this hotel. Emailed ahead for an upgrade and James (manager) and Shahidah happily upgraded us to a suite. When we arrived, we found a gift in the room as well. We knew our way around New Orleans and did not have an opportunity to talk with the W Insider, Staci, but her emails to us showed that she is enthusiastic and willing to help. The only drawback was thin walls, but I was able to sleep fine with ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location... very nice despite summer reconstruction”
Reviews.Author: DaveNYC_001
Reviews.Content: Writing this review a bit late, as my wife and I visited late last summer (August 2011). First off, I was indeed initially concerned because I learned of the lack of of room service / on-site dining after having booked (I am not sure of the situation 6 months later). That being said... There were several small local restaurants just across the street which we loved. Why pay $$$ for the same hotel fair when you could pay $ for local faves and a 7 AM Bloody Mary (with free refills). We arrived at 8 AM, not expecting to check in, but the front desk staff accommodated us by booking us into the highly modernized model room. We loved it! On-site pool is very quiet - In fact, we felt we were swimming in private for hours every afternoon. And the location could not be beat. In the heart of the French Quarter, just steps away from Jackson Square, NOLA, the riverfront, Canal Street, Decatur Street, Bourbon Street (but far enough away not to be disturbed by the late-night din). For anywhere we couldn't walk, the hotel provided a free car ride, which saved us many $$ on taxi rides. A tiny, but very appreciated detail - the turntable and old-timey jazz records that we found in our room. What a nice little touch. I found the entire staff very friendly, and helpful in providing us invaluable local advice. If we do return to New Orleans, I have no doubt that we'd check into this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: OceanportNJ
Reviews.Content: Do you want to feel like they do not listen to a word you are saying? Feel like being shuffled around to three rooms but still getting the same issue? Well then come to the W French Quarter! I booked my room and used starpoints to upgrade to a "spectacular" room with only one request...please be away from noise (elevator, construction, etc). We got in late, 3:30am from our delayed flight and asked to be in a quiet room, away from construction. The reply I got, "there is NO construction anywhere". Woke up at 7am to loud tile cutting and hammering right outside our window. OK, no problem, little mistake, asked to be moved and they agreed. Next up, a room right next to an elevators that makes a noise like a chain saw every 2-3 minutes. Ok, no problem, asked to be moved again, so they moved us over one room....still elevator noise. I don't know how this is not a common complaint. So now, I am unfortunately stuck here for business but had my wife join me and now we have the joy of no sleep and a staff that doesn't seem to understand that all I wanted was a semi-quiet room. One in which I felt I deserved from using my starwood points. I am NOT the type to complain, so I will deal with what I have for a few days. BUT next time I will stay elsewhere. On a positive note, the location is great and the court yard is nice. But beware, unless they tuck you away in a small standard room, you will have trouble sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Anne M
Reviews.Content: I read the comments and was skeptical about staying here, nevertheless, because of location we did. This hotel is VERY NICE and the pictures do not do it justice! The room was very clean and was beautiful. I was worried about noise - we were pretty far from the elevators and heard NO noise at night! The only reason I did not rate this hotel excellent - no restaurant - which did not bother us - we were in the FRENCH QUARTER - who wants to eat at a hotel...nevertheless, I'm sure that bothers others. This is a great location two blocks from Bourbon St....two blocks from Jackson Square...

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: After reserving the W I was excited at the prospect of staying at a 4+ star resort in the French Qtr of New Orleans. Upon arrival I noticed that the reception area was very small. When we got to our room it was small (understandable due to it being in the city) but more importantly it was worn down. The bathroom has one small sink(we are accustomed to having double sinks) and the refrigerator was very old. Although on the whole service was fine, on 2 occasions we had to wait 5-10 minutes before we got an answer on the phone from the receptionist. Also, since there is no restaurant or bar currently, one would expect some type of bar/food service in the nicest part of the hotel which is the courtyard. Without assurances from the manager that some of these areas will be rectified I may have to change my current reservations for the upcoming jazzfest (our group is currently reserving 4 rooms in May)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beautiful courtyard”
Reviews.Author: careerdagger
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fabulous location in the French Quarter, just a few blocks away from the action on Bourbon but far enough that you don't hear the noise. It is a peaceful retreat. The room was very spacious and clean. The courtyard was beautiful and the pool was amazing. It was kept very warm so that I was able to swim when the temp was in the 50's. The staff was very helpful, called us cabs when needed, and we even took advantage of the complimentary Acura ride. Only negative was they put out Fiji water throughout the room and bathroom, making us think it was complimentary...it was not.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: HappyMusafir
Reviews.Content: Minutes away from anywhere you would want to go in the French Quarter, and their complimentary shuttle service is also really helpful. The have a gorgeous courtyard and we spent a wonderful evening hanging out in the courtyard sipping on wine. However, they don't have a gym and the rooms are kinda small, both probably due to the location. But again the location is probably their biggest asset.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Joye B
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best places we have ever stayed in. The employees were fantastic.K.C., Tony D. Krystal Bell and Paris Hurst were there for every need. Ever person that we came in contact with always had a smile and were eager to help. I can not wait to go back. If you are planning a trip, this is the place to stay!!!! It is beautiful!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Adam G
Reviews.Content: We came for 3 nights in mid-December 2011 and had a great time. The hotel was undergoing rennovations, but we didn't hear, see anything and were not bothered in any way by construction. The staff from the front desk to the members of the valet area were extremely knowledgeable about the city and places to eat, see, and how to get to them. The bed was quite comfortable and the room was spacious. Bathroom was clean and shower is large with good water pressure. The hotel's location is great for walking around the French Quarter, the CBD and Warehouse District, and a pretty easy street car ride to the Garden District. I would come back to this hotel without a question.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday fun at a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GPersh
Reviews.Content: Recently went to a holiday get together at Whiskey Blue, the bar at the W, and had an amazing time! It has this hip, cool vibe and the special cocktails were delicious! I highly recommend for out-of-towners and locals to try it! Not to mention at the end of the night I was only a few steps away from my cozy room. I keep coming back because I love the feeling of a modern hotel in such a historic location!

Reviews.Title: “No gym, no room service = no stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveller94115
Reviews.Content: I was booked to stay at this hotel recently. When I arrived and asked about ordering dinner, they told me they didn't have in-room dining for dinner because the hotel was being renovated. They also don't have a gym. I left and went to another hotel immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: KCL222
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business and frequently stay at W properties. I found this W to be below W standards. While the staff was terrific, the room left a lot to be desired. I thought it was very dirty. The bathroom mirror and picture on the wall had what looked to be splashes from water or someone brushing their teeth. Usually the W's are immaculate! We were in a courtyard side suite which was a little noisy. We could hear everything going in the courtyard--people's conversations and late night commotion. The courtyard was beatiful though. On the upside, the location was great! You can't beat that.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in heart of French quarter.”
Reviews.Author: NathanandKellyVO
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in an awesome location. Reminded me of some of the upscale boutique hotels in NYC. Staff was very helpful and the courtyard was a great place to hang out. We had an incredible balcony room with plenty of space and privacy.

Reviews.Title: “A wannabe that doesn't be”
Reviews.Author: TiredMum2
Reviews.Content: OK, the good stuff first. Staff very helpful and friendly. Sadly that's it for the good stuff. After booking I failed to get an email confirming the booking, but did eventually get an email about what was happening in the French Quarter that weekend. And another. Finally got a third email saying that due to refurbishment there was no hotel, or even breakfast except via room service. Got to the room late and tired, as I was going to bed I noticed that the carpet was wet... Next morning not only was the carpet still wet, but it also smelled of vomit.... Went straight to the front desk (a temporary welcome desk) where, to be fair, the staff were as appalled as I was and arranged to have the carpet shampooed, which it duly was. 24 hours later the carpet was dry, but I thought there was still a faint smell. Yuk! Other things: Shower often took minutes to get warm and occasionally didn't heat at all; you could get coffee downstairs in the temporary welcome desk from six am - on Sunday morning I waited 35 minutes for the coffee to appear, being told "it will be here soon" every five or ten minutes; finally and most annoyingly I paid $16.95 to watch the new Harry Potter VII pt2 movie - it was poor quality, jumping AND they cut off the last five minutes - possibly the most important bit. They do have all sorts of add-ons and trendy things - a bottle of red wine, two glasses and a corkscrew attached to the wall. An iPod player and charger by the bed. BUT there was no desk in my room, just a small round table - how can you work at that? The walls are thin, the doors are incredibly noisy, my room had two doors to adjoining rooms to make it into a suite - these doors were even thinner, you could hear complete conversations. The lack of any dining area or foyer to sit in made it more like a poor man's B&B rather that a real hotel. Perhaps it may be better after the refurb they are doing, but I wouldn't stay here ever again.

Reviews.Title: “We switched to another hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldnreview
Reviews.Content: We planned this trip for our anniversary and we very excited about staying at the W in the French Quarter. My husband & I typically love W Hotels and have stayed in many. We arrived around lunch time. Our room was not ready yet. We happily stored our bags and went for lunch and a walk around to see the city. When we returned it was check in time. We were informed that someone with a higher Starwoods status than us had requested a late check out and our room would not be ready before 5pm. In fact those guests were checking out at 5 so we may have to wait until 6 or so. We had made early dinner reservations at a place that friends had recommended so we really wanted to shower & change after our day of travel. We asked if there was another room that would be ready early. They eventually offered us a room to change in with two doubles and then wanted us to switch out of it to our originally reserved room when it became available. We reluctantly agreed for lack of a better option. When we got to our temporary room we were displeased by the level of cleanliness. More shocking was the rodent trap on the floor near a small hole in the wall. This was unacceptable. Although we were not planning to sleep in this room, my husband & I both felt very uncomfortable knowing there was a rodent issue in this hotel. We found another hotel not far up the street and asked a manager if we could be refunded if we decided not to stay here. The manager was very nice and apologetic. She (Staci) did the best she could considering the situation she was handed. She even offered us a bottle of Champagne to take with us. When we returned home we noticed there had been no refund for the nights we did not stay. After three phone calls with American Express and three weeks the credit was finally issued. I work in the hotel industry. I would never inform a guest that another guest more important than them is causing them an inconvenience. We were given this information in a matter of fact manner and informed that this was standard policy. All kinds of things happen in the hotel business. Finding a rodent trap has to be one of the worst! We RARELY complain. We just wanted a special getaway in a very cool city with great food and a clean room. We ended up having an amazing time. Switching hotels was the right move for us.

Reviews.Title: “Slooooooooow service!”
Reviews.Author: YeahMon_11
Reviews.Content: I arrived around 10 pm on a Wednesday night. I pulled in and waiting for the valet, where they have a sign that says something to the effect of, "we got you...we'll be right with you." So, I waited.....for 17 minutes! There was nowhere for me to park myself, and the gate was closed to their parking garage, so my only choice was to wait. I finally called the front desk and they apologized and said that someone would be right out. Well, about 10 minutes later, a very nice girl came out to help me and said that she didn't know where the valet was, but she would wait with my car. Who knows how long the poor thing had to wait! The next morning, I was running behind, so I ordered an omelette from room service. They said that it would be in my room within 25 minutes. Well, 50 minutes later, I called to check on it and they apologized and said it would be right up. It was....and it was cold. But, I was hungry, so I ate it. It was a very nice presentation with lots of extras included; brunch potatoes, toast, etc. So, that was a nice touch. The room was very clean and very well stocked. The staff was super polite and definitely wanted to be helpful. I think for a weekend trip with friends, I would definitely stay there again. The ambiance outside and the laid back atmosphere was fun. But, on a business trip, traveling solo, I really would have hoped for speedier service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Jenna08
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic. We really liked the hotel. Request a room on the 4th or 5th floors - tends to be quieter Beds were really comfortable, bathrooms are bright and modern. Clearly a new hotel. Not too much sound proofing from room to room but not worse than any other hotel. Location really makes it. super close to the heart of the French Quarter but two blocks from the craziness.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: EssexBoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. Got upgraded to spectacular King Bed on arrival and very happy with it. Nice size well appointed bit dark but fairly quiet at night. Hotel in a great location for the French Quarter and felt safe. No restaurant when we stayed but didnt need it. Front desk staff not very knowledgeable about the area or even directions to the airport. Standard answer for everything was we'll google it !! W "insider" Stacey was helpful. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “W French Quarter is an Oasis!”
Reviews.Author: mtlfamily4
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the heart of the french quarter...staff was amazing, resto and bar are under reno so not available at all...this however was not a big deal as several resto"s and bar's are all over the place! Great rooms, clean and well apointed!

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: MODERNNYC
Reviews.Content: Like others, I was dubious of the reviews here. Much of the commentary is true: the property is old, some of the rooms and common areas deserve some attention and the rooms are small. I checked in and as a Starwood Gold was upgraded to a Spectacular room. Unfortunately no king Spectaculars were available and I was placed in a double which was useless as I was traveling alone. (Sidenote: the difference between the Wonderful and Spectacular rooms is that the latter has a balcony. Not so spectacular). The walls could use some paint, the bathroom similarly could use a makeover and the furniture was chipped, dented and generally not the sort of aesthetic you expect paying W rates. I asked to be moved and on my third (of four) nights was upgraded again to a Mega room. The second room was much better. There was actually space to place my luggage on the floor, I didn't hear verbatim conversations form my neighbors, my shower got warm instead of just luke warm when turned to maximum hotness, and the room was in better shape. That said, the property is apparently undergoing renovation (true: the restaurant is closed, but alas, no big deal given proximity to other options). Despite the shortcomings, the W French Quarter is still the best choice in the Quarter. The property feels like a boutique property, some of the usual annoying qualities of the W chain are absent (think over the hill Fratboys and the gals that love them drinking Appletinis in the lobby) and the staff is rather excellent. I liked the fact that the hotel had charm and isn't an over the top frilly option like the other small hotels that dominate the quarter. The courtyard is very nice and the location is second to none. I think you have to be careful on what room you end up in (it may be the property is two different buildings combined...my first room had very thin walls, my second room felt better insulated). At any rate, it is not the best W I ever encountered in terms of room quality when it comes to the small details, but the positives clearly outweigh the negatives. Lastly, FOR THE LOVE OF GOD, will someone at the W please realize that having so much crap in the room in terms of signage (really, this is a trashcan? Thank God there is a sticky note!), knick knacks (the toy Acura reminding me I could have a ride someone is not necessary), and just general clutter everywhere is the antithesis of why people go to a W. I don't want to feel like I am living in a Target. I always ask that all this stuff be removed form the room, and usually the staff notes that others do too. Hopefully corporate takes a note and keeps an actual surface free.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: jorellie
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel. I was a little leary about making my reservation because I read some mixed reviews, but I found this hotel to be clean, conviently located and the staff friendly and helpful! Their restaurant was being renovated but there was room service available. But honestly, with so many great restaurants in the area, not being able to eat at the hotel was not a big deal. It's a little pricy and more "boutique-like" as opposed to other W Hotels, but it was cozy and charming. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “not a typical W”
Reviews.Author: BforBoy
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of the W chain but this is not my favorite one. I went there when everything was under renovation and there was not even a restaurant!! My room rate was quite high ($400/night) and my platinum membership also did not get me an upgrade as I was told there were only a few suites there! The amenities in the room weren't great. The safe was not working and I had to get someone to fix it. There was no gym and I'd have to go to the other W for my work out. The location was great. The staff were so-so. I don't think I would go back to this hotel next time I am in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay & Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: Joanizzy
Reviews.Content: We have traveled to and visited NOLA (French Quarter) for 20+ years. We have favorite places to stay and visit. We tried the W again this past weekend during my husband's birthday trip. The front staff (Stacy-W Insider) was amazing. She sent a presonalized note for my husband's birthday as well as champagne. Everyone from security, to bell staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome. Rooms are sized nicely for the french quarter and ammenities top notch. Baths could use a little freshening, more due to the type of tile which is difficult to present as very clean. We'll definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Place to Stay in the Big Easy!!”
Reviews.Author: KrissyT
Reviews.Content: All we can say (again) is a big WOW! This was our sixth straight year coming down to New Orleans for the Voodoo Music Festival over Halloween weekend. We stay nowhere else but this wonderful hotel! The location is perfect, the courtyard is beautiful, but what makes this property extra special is its excellent staff - it is always so nice to see familiar faces each year upon our return. Although Bacco's restaurant closed and the W currently does not have in-house dining or a bar, they will bring you anything that you need. We can't wait to see the new restaurant/bar area when we return next October.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location, Kind Staff”
Reviews.Author: VAGUIDO
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W French Quarter, New Orleans during Halloween 2011. This weekend was a great time to visit NOLA, and the W was the perfect compliment to a fun-filled weekend. Initially, the news of restaurant and lounge renovations disturbed me at check-in (take note - the restaurant and lounge/bar is CLOSED), but the charm and character the of the hotel (and the city) - instantly made me forget my frustration. Some reviews said the hotel fixtures/rooms are outdated, but I do not agree. The rooms were every bit as "W" as the other 8 W Hotels I visited. The double room was HUGE, and it was always sparkling clean. There is a small heated pool in the courtyard that was PERFECT to use this time of year. I rarely enjoy a pool in October - but this one was a real treat. I highly suggest you take a plunge. The hotel staff was efficient and extremely courteous. I loved talking and interacting with the bell hops, valets, front desk, and housekeeping. I really enjoyed how the housekeeper stopped me to tell me that she was "scared" by my plastic snakes (part of the Halloween costume)! It made a connection that kept us all smiling the rest of the stay. During the stay, I also enjoyed two weddings from my window at the hotel. Yes, the courtyard was closed briefly , but the sound of string instruments drifting in the room filled me with joy. Ladies - this hotel is very quaint. If you are from NOLA or love NOLA - put this venue on your short-list. For the "roadies" on here..SPG platinum member, and I did not receive an upgrade (which was fine based on the conditions I stated above). Also, I knew the hotel was sold-out, so I set this expectation before I arrived. I cannot wait to get back!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a ton of charecter”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller88888
Reviews.Content: The courtyard was beautiful, the room was great, but the amenities (hair dryer, iron, clock) weren't in great condition or didn't really work. I called the operator more than 6 times and no one answered. Had a wonderful stay otherwise, the hotels close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “W stands for winner”
Reviews.Author: James B
Reviews.Content: We had a most splendid time during our recent visit to NOLA. The W staff could not have been more considerate and helpful from check-in to the valet to check-out. This was my third trip to the W in the Quarter. As a native New Orleanian with family galore in the city, I know I have a variety of places to stay. But the W staff makes it irresistable. Thank you for attending to our needs and making the visits special.

Reviews.Title: “Not my first preference....”
Reviews.Author: Kimnola
Reviews.Content: Maybe it was just the nights i stayed there... but i could hear everything on the streets (including car alarms and people partying at all hours). It is centrally located within walking distance to all of the FQ and CBD activities. I would prefer the W on Poydras. Still a great location but quiter with a great bar!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: mflan46
Reviews.Content: This is a very convenient location to both the convention center and the french quarter. I booked my room through American Express Luxury Collection, and was upgraded to an enormous room, and had vouchers for meals as well. The lounge is a great place to relax, and the rooms were very comfortable. I stayed here almost 2 years ago and felt the hotel was a little run down, however on this most recent visit, it was much improved, with 4 star quality throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Convient Location”
Reviews.Author: josephfmessinaDOTcom
Reviews.Content: The W New Orleans-French Quarter is located in a convient location to explore the French Quarter. Bourbon Street is located a few blocks away and is within walking distance. As far as the rooms, your standard W Rooms which are on the 'smallish' side. Currently, the hotels restaurant is undergoing a renovation so the only meals available are via room service for breakfast and dinner. Located across the street for breakfast is Cafe Fleur de lis which is great and highly recomanded. PS An unexpected mini-bar charge was on my bill, which the front desk removed at check-out. Not sure if the house cleaning staff got my personal drinks confused with the W mini bar drinks, as I also had a unexpected mini-bar charge at the W New Orleans during the same trip. A coincide of 'extra-charges'?

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Time at the "W"”
Reviews.Author: Jessica C
Reviews.Content: Our stay in New orleans was a wonderful experience, the staff at the hotel were so helpful to share lots of information about where to go, what to do etc etc etc. The locations is perfect and within walking distance of everything. The rooms are nice and cozy but when you go on vacation you dont expect to stay in the room all day long right!!! they may not have a restaurant but they make up for it in many ways. The W has such charm and with that said i would come to stay again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Simple”
Reviews.Author: Pfat
Reviews.Content: I would stay again in this hotel. It has a good location for sightseeing, antique shopping, and enjoying the surrounding party. It is clean and simple. Once you are in the French Quarter, the lack of restaurant or bar in the hotel becomes unimportant. Service was very good/excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious stay at the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: aruba67416
Reviews.Content: Our stay in New Orleans was a complete delight and staying at this hotel made it all work perfectly well. Yes, there is no restaurant and the bar is open with limited hours. However, the hotel's location in the heart of the French Quarter made this an unforgettable experience. We had an excellent room with a spacious balcony on the second floor, overlooking a beautiful courtyard with a pool. Within a 5 to 10 minute walk, we could access many of the best French quarter restaurants, Bourbon Street, and French Market area. A five minute cab ride gets you to Frenchman street, offering an unforgettable jazz music experience.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great, but they don't answer their phone.”
Reviews.Author: wangwoman
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel was fine. It had a fabulous location, close enough to walk, but far enough so that it isn't noisy. The rooms are a bit small, but the decor was slick. Our chief complain was that they didn't answer their phone. This occurred before we even got to the hotel, when I called to ask a question about whether we would need to rent a car. (The answer is you don't. And the hotel has a shuttle during the day within a 6 mile radius.) I must have called 5 times before someone answered. This happened several times during our stay at the hotel, too. When we did get service, it was great. Unfortunately, the service wasn't good enough for us to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is amazing”
Reviews.Author: FNLDenver
Reviews.Content: The lobby entry and courtyard of this hotel are just ambience overload. Totally gorgeous and makes you feel like you're in a European chateau or something. Would loved to have had more time to hang in the beautiful courtyard. The staff was always very helpful - especially those at the valet stand who were always ready to provide directions and restaurant recommendations. The location was perfect. We could easily walk anywhere we wanted to go, or easily get to a trolley. The immediate neighborhood is very charming. Only a few blocks from Cafe du Monde! The room was fine - what I would expect from a W. Nice, simple, clean. The only bummer was that the front desk screwed up on the billing, even though we were really explicit about what credit card to use and made two stops at the front desk to make sure everything was in order. Definitely go over to Johnny's for breakfast - we had the most amazing fried chicken, gravy and biscuit breakfast ever!!

Reviews.Title: “Swanky stay, perfect location - W delivers!”
Reviews.Author: brashsassy
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 days at the W French Quarter and loved every minute. Every detail is covered, from the courtyards piped in music to the dim lit hallways with rich paint colors. You feel like enclosed in a wonderful little boutique hotel yet all of the hustle and bustle is within walking distance. The property feels very secure with bellman always in the front drive with a view of the elevators which you need a room key to access. My suite was spacious, clean and relaxing - however I could hear the elevator all night long. Was not happy to find out the restaurant was closed, but it did force me to get out and about and try new restaurants in the area. Highly reccomend the property to anyone that wants a high end feel, but the privacy of a small property.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter Elite Boutique”
Reviews.Author: Adam A
Reviews.Content: As Platinum guest with Starwood and Diamond with Hilton year after year for many years and being all over the country in fine hotels, it doesnâ€™t get much better than the W French Quarter. From the gentelman who greet you at the cab or the valet to Greg at the front desk who sets the tone for intrigue and relaxation, everthing just becomes a little bit lighter, easier and refreshing at the W Frecnch Quarter. I have stayed at this property at least 4 times in the past two years and it is always a memorable experience. My favorite hotel in New Orleans hands down and one of my absolute favorite in the country regardless of brand, location, amenities etc. On Chartres, just moments away from the square or Bourbon or the business distict you feel a world away from it all but only steps to get to where you want to be. You simply wont have a better hotel experience anywhere else as proven when you return from your time spent out exploring and make your way to the outdoor sanctuary complete with candles, couches, benches, trees, pool and all sorts of cozy nooks. I can't get back there soon enough and if you have never been, it's time to treat yourself.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is GREAT”
Reviews.Author: Rich2809
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights. A great hotel. I love W's. I think that the W is pretty much the perfect hotel for New Orleans. Close to the French Quarter and all the great bars and restaurants. Nit the best place for business but fantastic for a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter Charm”
Reviews.Author: 456c
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed twice, before and after a cruise, at W Hotel in the French Quarter of New Orleans. Overall, I found it to be an excellent hotel with a lovely interior courtyard and pool. It is conveniently located in the French Quarter and within walking distance of most of the sights. The website stated that the hotel was undergoing renovations but I found no disturbance from this situation. The hotel bar and restaurant are closed and are being renovated currently and will be reopening later this year. There are numerous restaurants and bars nearby plus they offered a shuttle service to their sister hotel, the W New Orleans on Poydras Street. I would recommend requesting an interior courtyard room as the street side rooms can be noisy with the street traffic, blaring music, and emergency sirens especially on a Saturday night. I would definitely stay at this location in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great courtyard and amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Darius D
Reviews.Content: located in the middle of the Quarter yet far enough to escape if you must. Boutique hotel with large guest rooms (great shower and large bathroom), amazing courtyard with pool, bar and areas to relax and read a book if you like. I can't wait for their new restaurant to open for when I return.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: KEEPTAHOEBLUE_NICE
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Easter weekend 2011 with some out of town friends who haven't been to New Orleans in 15 years. I knew going in that the hotel was under renewal. I emailed the hotel prior to our arrival and informed them about my guests. The hotel was very accommodating, welcoming, and offered us an amazing suite upgrade as I am a loyal SPG member. I love the courtyard, fountain, and pool. I walk in each time I'm in the area. I have stayed here at least five times. Each time has been a good experience. It will be nice to have a larger lobby area and on-site restaurant. It would also be nice to have a workout facility. We were allowed to see a sample of the new room design. It was amazing! My only complaint is the extremely high price for parking (like $40 a night). The location is wonderful. It would be nice to have an on-site concierge since the hotel is in the heart of the FQ. Emeril's NOLA, Brennan's, and K-Paul's are all just about a block away. The Acura Experience is a good thing. The rates can be a little much in my opinion esp. with the Ritz, Roosevelt, and Royal Sonesta close by with good rates. I will continue staying at this property, especially as the remodel becomes complete. Let's get a great restaurant in there by a chef that folks will love.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room, great location, fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: Marc K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to New Orleans for our 1st Anniversary. This was our 1st trip to New Orleans but it won't be the last. The W French Quarter is situated in the middle of everything so all attractions were in walking distance. The rooms were comfortable and reasonably sized but for a 5-star hotel lacked amenities (no on-site restaurant or gym due to renovations and no shower caps in the bathroom). We were also surprised by the amount of young, rowdy guests. We were unfortunate to have a group of college-age boys in the room next door who were loud, obnoxious and inconsiderate. The W's staff however were fantastic: from Mark, the bellman, who greeted us warmly when we arrived and advised us on the best place for gumbo when we said we were hungry, to Ashley at reception and Stacey, the manager, who were extremely professional and personable and helped us in more ways than I can recount to ensure that we had a great weekend. Before we left they invited us to view the remodeled sample room which was more to our taste. We hope this as well as the other renovations will be complete before our next visit so that the property can match the quality of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint old hotel with modern upgrades”
Reviews.Author: ThreeGee
Reviews.Content: Nice, quiet place to stay with a beautiful courtyard. Only complaint is the front desk staff could care less about service. The valet were friendlier and offered tips on where to go, so it made up for the lack of service in other areas. I plan to stay here next time I travel to New Orleans for work.

Reviews.Title: “Worst W I've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: Rafazi
Reviews.Content: Service was terrible, nobody informed mecat booking that the hotel was under construction! No restaurant or food! Front desk personal were really bad! Slow, uninterested! Not very helpful just sort of two speeds slow and stop! As a gold member well on my way to the next level I was under appreciated for my commitment to SPG! No free water in the room, no upgrades or willingness to try!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with friendly staff. Good location”
Reviews.Author: Maria_Ture
Reviews.Content: I got a suite instead of the double room i had reserved and the suite was nice. My collegue got a non smoking room that smelled alot from smoke so she had to change room. The hotel was located perfectly: close to the french quarter but still in a calm area. Opposite of the hotel was a cafeteria where you caneat breakfast. The staff was friendly and helped us when we needed help. I could return here.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter Fail”
Reviews.Author: DCDonna
Reviews.Content: Worldwide Wonderful? Not quite. More like French Quarter Fail. This hotel falls far short of the W standard. We can't quibble with the marvelous location or the attentive, on-top-of-it bellmen and valets. After that, it's a litany of problems. Let's start with the classic W Living Room: It's the size of a postage stamp. In a hotel that does not offer free WiFi in the rooms, the living room's free WiFi is a key perk when you don't want to shell out $15 for a 10-minute check of email. Well, there's pretty much nowhere to sit down. Think you might want a drink? Forget about it. The restaurant has closed so there's no bar service during the week. If you want to sit out in the lovely courtyard, one of the few things this hotel has going for it, it's BYOB during the week. By the way, the hotel fails to mention this if you make reservations through Starwood Preferred. You'll only find notice of this if you dig deep into the fine print of the hotel's website. The hotel should make this plain up front. So what does this really mean? It means if you want some coffee and muffin for breakfast, be prepared to shell out nearly $30. The hotel still offers room service, yet has not waived the 19% service fee despite not offering the option of a full-service restaurant or even a coffee bar. As compensation, the hotel offers guests on arrival the choice between a bottle of $2 Fiji water or a half-bottle of supermarket wine. As for our particular stay, we had reserved a room with a courtyard view. If you consider a sliver of a window in a narrow alcove looking onto a roof a room with a view, then you're in for a treat. For the hotel to place us, _Gold Preferred members_ in this horrible room in New Orleans in August, with a barely half-full hotel, it's really unforgivable. We did ask for another room. The woman at reception rightly tried to move us to a patio room, which would have been an upgrade. She said it would be ready at 4 p.m. It was not. We were finally moved to another room with a decent window and pleasant view. The room itself is shabby with scratched furniture and soiled carpeting. The bathroom had mildew in the shower and cracked marble on the vanities. My advice to loyal Starwood folks: Choose the W on Poydras or the Sheraton on Canal. You'll be far happier.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot in the Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: kdlewis985
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the W on Poydras, but decided to try this one out for a change and absolutely loved it! The W French Quarter has the feel of a boutique hotel. The entrance is so unique with the glass globe lighting and the courtyard is beautiful. We stayed in the carriage house, which was lovely. It had two balconies, one overlooking the main courtyard and pool, and the other overlooking a smaller courtyard. The room itself was very spacious, clean and nicely decorated. The location of the hotel is great if youâ€™re looking to spend some time in the French Quarter. Itâ€™s a short walk to the Cathedral, Jax Brewery, etc. The staff at the W were amazing... very friendly and helpful. Overall, we had a wonderful stay and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who travels to New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “First Time & The Best Time”
Reviews.Author: Marisol C
Reviews.Content: Last minute trip...Decided on the W...perfect location. The lobby and courtyard are a must see. Greg Banks was fanstantic, with detailed information on where to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - average property”
Reviews.Author: ScottJK
Reviews.Content: Two disclaimers; our stay was a gift; we stayed in suite that overlooked the pool and the courtyard. We do not really have any idea what the average room was like or not like. First, you would be hard pressed to beat the location. The entire French Quarter is walkable from this property. Even if your definition of walkable means only a few blocks, this is still an eminently well positioned hotel. Second, if your stay in New Orleans is likely to focus on the night life, then again, this is a great property. The pool and courtyard were set up to be pool and party friendly. Lots of places to lounge, small private cabanas, music, and the like. Third, if you accept that a rennovation is in process, you'll be okay. We didn't see the rennovation from where we were, and we certainly didn't hear it. However, our room was definitely tired. The furniture was clean, but definitely worn. Not all of the lighting worked ideally - for example, two different types of light bulbs over the mirror, neither appropriate or bright enough. There was no room service, fair enough we were forewarned - but then there was no in-room coffee service to compensate. It meant putting on some sort of publically acceptable attire and a walk to the lobby. In a day and and age when even Motel 6 has in-room coffee service, this seemed a trifle beneath the W brand. Knowing that a rennovation was in progress leads me to believe that these conditions will change as the rennovation progresses...still, be aware. Fourth, if your version of night-life doesn't involve dance music, then be aware that the music will be blaring in the courtyard until the pool closes at 10-10:30pm. While the hotel was remarkably quiet when the music was off, the solid bass beats emanating from the robust pool speaker system will prove more than capable of suppressing anything, like a TV or your own music, in the room. In sum - great location, average property. When the rennovation is over, it will no doubt meet all of the normal W brand standards. Be aware that, like the French Quarter around it, this is designed to be a brash and lively property. If you want to leave your party at the street when you return to the hotel, this may not be the property for you.

Reviews.Title: “Standard W experience.... Welcome desk staff EXCELS!”
Reviews.Author: MIAcubby
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this property and i found it to be your standard W experience. From the looks of things this seems to be one of the first W hotels and its about time for a remodel. The court years is great and i like the fact that this is a small hotel, only 98 rooms i believe. I would defiantly recommend this hotel to anyone going to New Orleans... Thank you W New orleans -French Quarter for another awesome stay.HUGE KUDOS goes to DESHAWN SPADY at the front desk. She has an awesome smile and knows how to make a customer smile. She is a huge asset to the W brand and to Starwood. She is true professional and the fact that she loves her jobs shows. She should defiantly be elevated to a higher position or even better a training position with in your organization. I have stayed at 7 different W properties in the last year and she really impressed me over everyone else. She is a true asset to W Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: JM1212
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel. The courtyard is amazing, they light it up every night with candles, etc. Our wonderful room was great! We loved it too. Service was also great. We will be going back!

Reviews.Title: “The W in french quarter wasn't up to par....but I recommend booking the one on Poydras St.”
Reviews.Author: Tylene M
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I usually stay at W hotels everywhere we go. All the W hotels are wonderful, always clean, modern furniture, great rooms, and amazing service. However, this was the first W that we've stayed at that we were not satisfied. It is a little bit of an older building because it is in the french quarter and more boutique-ish so it was very small and old. I understand they were undergoing renovations for their lounge/bar area so there wasn't a place to lounge and drink like all the other W hotels. The staff were still really friendly and helpful though. We didn't originally book the W hotel on Poydras St. because online it states its in the business district and we wanted to be within walking distance of the french quarter, little did we know its only a few more blocks further. Not even a 10 minute walk to get into the french quarter area, so the staff was EXTREMELY kind in letting us switch to the other W hotel and it just really made the rest of our trip pleasurable. I highly recommend you book the W hotel on Poydras. Its directly across the street from Harrah's casino and close to the aquarium. This W was definitely up to par with what you would expect. We also had a staff by the name of Paul R. that was really kind and went above and beyond in helping us with luggage, recommending places to eat, and even driving us to certain places. If you get a chance to stay at either W ask for Paul R. :)

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: stephwd98
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to New Orleans, but my husband's first and our first stay at the W. We could not have asked for a nicer experience. We felt that it was a perfect location, extremely convenient to all parts of the quarter. The staff was very helpful and friendly, the room was always clean and comfortable. Our only regret was that we were there before the restaurant was finished, and it is sure to be delicious! I guess we'll just have to plan another stay very soon.

Reviews.Title: “nasty hotel”
Reviews.Author: linda w
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stay at the W New Orleans - French Quarter on august 8,2011 the rooms was nasty the hallway never vac and the hotel never had anything everytime we ask for something the housekeepers say we don't have it .I think that hotel needs to be close down and this one lady was very nasty we ask her for something and she had a nasty attiuide it was not a housekeeper the lady had on a white shirt and dark pants we stay in room 221.I will never stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: dcist78
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at this hotel. It couldn't be in a better location and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful--some of the best I've ever seen. The room was clean and stylish, and the courtyard outdoor lounge/pool area was very nicely set up. I was a little nervous about staying here given some of the recent negative reviews, but other than the fact that there is currently no restaurant I didn't see any signs of construction/renovation around the hotel. And of course, why would you need a restaurant given the location? I thought the property was in very good shape, actually-- the only caveat to that is the bathroom door in my room didn't close well. (I was staying by myself so it didn't really matter, but I see how this would be a problem if I hadn't been traveling alone.) The room I was in was very quiet, which was great. Overall this hotel seemed sleeker and more upscale than the other W in town. This hotel is also smaller and quieter than the other one, which I view as a good thing given how crazy the neighborhood gets-- it's a nice break. I had a great stay and will definitely be back when I'm next in town.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite French Quarter Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Professorgreen
Reviews.Content: Our favorite hotel for a night in the Quarter. Pretty courtyard, attractive bar. Helpful bell captain and staff. Right in the Quarter, so walking is easy from here.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: arlene075
Reviews.Content: All the staff at the hotel were very kind and helpful, especially Paul R. in the garage area, and Mark Woods. In the hotel lobby at front desk Temika and Shawn (female) were very nice. In housekeeping, 5th floor, housekeeper's name started with the letter "A," but I can't remember; perhaps Adriana, or Ariana - she was exceptional. Hope all theforegoing are recognized for outstanding service. My name is Arlene Ashley, and I shared a room with my sister Deb Mogil and brother-in-law Blaine Mogil from San Diego, California. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Whatever, Whenever?....REALLY? What a joke!”
Reviews.Author: SRRJLR
Reviews.Content: This property does NOT live up to the Starwood standard. I was extremely disappointed starting 2 days after I made my reservation. There is a vague, practically hidden notice on the website indicating that the hotel is under renovation. Even with all the research we did, we never saw it until we received our automated "welcome" email that mentioned renovations in the last sentence. Again, vague...no details about what was occurring. After contacting the hotel it turns out that there would be no bar, restaurant or room service available...REALLY!? A relaxing weekend in bed with my husband and NO room service...lovely. After 3 attempts to have SOME of my Starpoints refunded since this is NO LONGER a top tier Starwood property, I finally had a hotel representative agree to refund a portion of the points. (Note, I've been home for a week now...still not points refund.) This is all prior to my arrival. We get all that behind us, arrive to check in. Our room was not ready until after 4PM....so much for a 3PM check-in. Oh, did I mention the attitude that the ladies at the front had? Not attitude in a good way...attitude in a BAD way. On the positive side, they have a car service where the nice men who valet will drive you to local venues. We used it one night for a 6PM reservation. TWO days later, when I tried to reserve it again, the not so friendly ladies at the front desk informed me that the car service was not available after 5PM...HUH? I just used it two days prior. Sorry...it's not available after 5....Whatever, whenever...YEAH...WHATEVER!!! These are just the highlights. Hated this property and disliked the staff in the front desk area. Valet guys were great though...

Reviews.Title: “Paul is the best! he made our trip!”
Reviews.Author: angweb
Reviews.Content: Paul 'the do everything guy' at the W in French Quarter was amazing. This was our 1st time in New Orleans and Paul went out of his way to drive us several times in the Acura to different locations, he was also the best tour guide, taking us to different parts of the city that we wouldn't have found on our own. This W is right in the middle of town and an easy walk to most places. The only disappointment was that the hotel restaurant was closed for renovations, so there is only room serving in the AM for breakfast, which ended up being a good thing considering we loved the local food.

Reviews.Title: “W is tired”
Reviews.Author: Bartcock
Reviews.Content: Generally I find Starwood properties to be of a high caliber and more interesting than other hotel chains and I particularly like the W brand. After staying at the W in New Orleans French Quarter, I feel it needs a pretty significant bit of maintenance and improvement. Many pieces of furniture were coming off their hinges, was significantly nicked and scratched, the mini-bar/refrigerator was barely keeping the beverages cool, and the property lacked key amenities that I look for like a fitness center and bar/restaurant. I had to walk several blocks to the other W hotel to work out. No big deal but still not very convenient (particularly in the rain). No restaurant service was available at the time we were there. Reception merely served water and coffee. No wine in the evenings and no functioning service or amenities at all in the evenings (which you would expect in the French Quarter in New Orleans).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel And Great Staff all the way!!! Try It!!!”
Reviews.Author: Charlies1600
Reviews.Content: Ok folks I read the reviews before we got to this hotel. I was a little worried about a few things. Some of you spoke about how small the rooms were. Well I had never been to New Orleans. But the southern hospitality was there all the way. This hotel is awesome!!! The staff is the best I have ever found in all my years of traveling. Lot of hotel give you this FAKE smile and welcome crap but these people mean it. They are down to earth people who work hard every day to go out of their way to make sure your HAPPY!!! Staci & Christie who work the front office are great folks. Our reservation was for 3 days and we wanted to add two more days on to it. I spoke to Staci and she got it worked out for us to stay and enjoy New Orleans longer. Paul who is one of the welcome ambassadors was terrific!! He made us feel welcome and always got our car when we needed it. He is really a down to earth guy who works hard in making sure the customer is happy. We had a room with a balcony with a table and two chairs. It was great to have cause we smoke lol. We could go out side and enjoy the quarter any time we wanted. The room was just right. Its a normal side room. Besides you there to see the sights or there to take care of business. Your not there to hang out in your room all day and night lol. I mean really folks?? Now the bathroom could be a little bigger. It did have a small airplane sink in it lol. They do need ro remodel the bathroom. The shower how ever was great. You will not find a great hotel with this kind of staff any where else then at the W French Quarter!! Trust me on this one. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Very niceee hotel but front desk staff is RUDE!!!”
Reviews.Author: toyia12
Reviews.Content: 6 of my friends flew in from Houston...ready to enjoy our vacay and we have to deal with the rudest front desk staff...then our rooms weren't ready...we had to ask for the manager....thanks to Stacy we were able to checkin....love the rooms...pool is extremely small....overall good place and location....horrible front desk staff

Reviews.Title: “Wwwwwwonderful”
Reviews.Author: Larry-n-Lorie
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Thursday evening July 14, 2011 and were warmly greeted by Paul Reed, the "should be" Bellman/Porter trainer for anyone in the hospitality profession. Paul exudes enthusiasm, knowledge of the area, and a willingness to share his inside information about the French Quarter. In a word, he is an Ambassador of goodwill for both the "W" hotel and the French Quarter. We stayed in one of the four "Carriage House" rooms in the courtyard area with a nice view of the pool and outside lounge area. This "W" is currently placing the finishing touches on a restaurant and bar which will definitely add to its amenities. Our room was spotlessly clean, well appointed, and very comfortable. Because of the older French doors leading to the small balcony; courtyard/pool noises tend to bleed into the room which can be annoying if there are late night partiers. Loved the room and it's location though and would accept the trade off any time. It's been 5 years since I've stayed at a W, the last one being the W Lakeshore in Chicago which I wrote a review about. At that time the Chicago W was #57 and I predicted they'd slip further toward triple digits. They've subsequently become #81 The W - French Quarter is currently ranked #65 in New Orleans but with staff members like Paul Reed they are bound to improve that. The staff was always courteous, attended to and rectified any problem quickly, and provided the whatever/whenever experience. They even provided a small refrigerator in my room for cold storage of some supplies I had delivered. Although we didn't have the opportunity to use the complimentary Acura MDX transit service to anywhere within 6 miles of the hotel between 8AM and 5 PM; I can certainly see how that might be very helpful. If they offered pick up service for late night club hopping it would be even nicer (hint). Overall, I'd recommend this facility for anyone visiting the French Quarter that desires a place convenient to Bourbon Street, The Market, Steamboat, Jazz and Blues Clubs, and other attractions. Thanks for a great stay. You've restored my faith in the W brand after a five year hiatus.

Reviews.Title: “MOST AMAZING SERVICE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JuneBug143
Reviews.Content: I had the most AMAZING time at this location!!! The staff was truly FABULOUS!!! The best customer service I have received in a long time. The manager really went out of her way to make my WISH come true. REMARKABLE!!!! Thank you so much Ms. Angela and staff! See you next July 4th weekend!!! ~eva~

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with a friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: bstuchin
Reviews.Content: I had a group of 10 people stay at the W last weekend. The staff at the W was attentive and friendly and my entire group had a fantastic time. The hotel itself is already very nice and will no doubt be even better once the renovation is complete and the restaurant opens. Also - for anyone who requires concierge services while at the W, Staci Worthman is great. Staci helped me plan an itinerary that featured several very unusual and creative activities throughout the weekend that made our trip to New Orleans completely unforgettable. Over the course of several weeks, we planned nearly a dozen different individual activities. In all cases, she went above and beyond what I'd typically expect from a concierge to make sure that every detail was handled flawlessly. Her efforts leading up to my stay at the hotel ensured that what would otherwise have been an overwhelming amount of logistics was instead a pleasure to organize and enabled me to have a great time once I got to New Orleans. Thanks so much Staci!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service...Nice room”
Reviews.Author: travchargia
Reviews.Content: The room was small but comfortable. The theme "whenever whatever" is not true at all. I would call for a simple question and either there would be no answer or I would be put on hold for 10 minutes for them to give me an answer. I called to ask about a certain bank being in the area and they informed me I would need to go to the Garden District even though there was one on the next block. I called to ask about nearby restaurants and was given answers by someone who apparently does not know the city at all. I was overcharged on my bill then tried reaching the accounting department which they did not return my call. The manager, Brian was nice and helpful but unfortunately the other people they have working the front desk have no knowledge of customer service or the area. The restaurant was closed so we were not able to try that. Upon arrival (5 pm) the bar was closed, not really sure when it is open because we never had a drink there. The location is great, near great restaurants. Oh yes the front desk suggested we go to dinner at a restaurant and we get there and it is closed for the entire month of July. The manager Stacey was also very nice. Brian and Stacey are probably the only two people who should be working the "whenever whatever" phones. The valets were very nice. Lovely pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: bemidjigreen
Reviews.Content: The. W is beautiful and the rooms are comfortable and quiet. The only Downside is the typical overpriced minibar seen in W's, no nearby restaurants (their's will open soon) and no coffee maker in the room. There are nicer hotels in the area but for a quiet out of the fray experience, this is the place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Will be perfect once they finish with the restaurant...”
Reviews.Author: Fyghter
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a welcome respite to the bustling craziness of the French Quarter and is located on a block with great shopping and very close to some of the best food. The rooms are not huge but they are comfortable with great amenities. We stayed there to attend Essence Festival and the staff is very knowledgeable and helpful. I would definitely recommend staying here for any visit to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Will be great hotel after renovation”
Reviews.Author: Hinkdoggy
Reviews.Content: had the chance to stay in may. Excellent locatipn, walking distance to everything in vieux carre area. Darrin h. Was awesome, a great help finding restaurants and getting directions. Only drawback was the renovations. Lobby, restaurant closed. Rooms were kind of small too. Would come back tho after it is complete.

Reviews.Title: “Thank Goodness for Mr. PAUL REED”
Reviews.Author: lani224
Reviews.Content: If it weren't for Paul, my stay would have been a complete disaster. First, we had very loud neighbors, which we ended up switching rooms because of. Second, the concierge sent us on a wild goose chase for a bar we were looking for, and when it came to restaurant suggestions, they were sending us to either the most expensive or the most touristy spots. THANK GOODNESS FOR PAUL REED who hooked it up in the Whatever/Whenever Acura MDX, taking us to exactly what we were looking for when it came to New Orleans food. He was so kind and generous, I really felt like he truly cared about our experience. I can honestly say he was the sole reason why I am giving this a 5 star "Excellent" rating, otherwise it would have dropped 2 stars to "Average" Thank you, Paul! You are a blessing!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great service”
Reviews.Author: shazMelbourneFlorida
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this small, well appointed hotel. The rooms were small but very clean and nicely decorated. The hotel staff was beyond helpful and friendly and made our 2 night stay extremely enjoyable. We would choose this hotel again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Welcome Ambassador”
Reviews.Author: hytx814
Reviews.Content: Mr. Kendrell Leggins is the best welcome ambassador. I am very thankful to his thoughtful service. I will never forget his kindness. I highly recommend this hotel even though I did not like the city! If you are looking for a neat hotel with great service in New Orleans, this is where you want to stay!

Reviews.Title: “W French Quarter: Wonderful Stay and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: GPersh
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the W French Quarter because my daughter was unknowingly getting engaged that weekend. Our future son-in-law had asked us to come to New Orleans to be part of the surprise. My husband and I stayed at the W French Quarter and we absolutely loved it! Not only is the hotel centrally located, but the service and room were also excellent. Our room was in the courtyard overlooking the pool and Staci at the front desk was so helpful and gave us great restaurant recommendations. If you are going to New Orleans, I highly recommend you stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great - go when it's not busy.”
Reviews.Author: AlxStevens0
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W FQ over Memorial Day Weekend for my birthday, had a good stay that could have been better. One thing to think about in deciding whether to stay here is that it's basically a boutique property (less than 100 rooms) in the heart of the Quarter, not a traditional W. That has pros and cons - the location is great. You can walk anywhere in the Quarter quickly and easily but you're a little ways from the madness of Bourbon. The building is quaint - especially the courtyard. It's a great place, especially for early risers, to sit and have coffee in the morning or an early drink before dinner (though you'll have to walk next door to get a drink). However, there aren't a ton of upgrades available, the non-upgrade rooms are VERY small, and there aren't a ton of facilities (currently no restaurant in the hotel and only a part-day temporary bar). The pool is also TINY with a total of 5 lounge chairs, 2 chairs and a single cabana. For our stay we knew the hotel was sold out and a Platinum upgrade was highly unlikely, which was fine. We arrived early and were pre-registered into a room and promised a call when ready, which never came. When we checked back and were put into our room. It was small - I mean NYC small - with NO view at all - literally the backside of another building. When I mentioned this they did tell me that as a Plat I shouldn't have been put into this room and they offered 5k points in apology. There were a number of other small issues that were similar - a pre-arranged gift for another friend in the hotel wasn't delivered, after having a bottle of room service champagne explode all over the room the promised cleaning crew never arrived, there were long waits in the lobby to see anyone at checkout, etc. I was also very disappointed that of the 3 emails I sent to the hotel (two pre-arrival with questions, one post-departure in response to the "How'd we do?" email) only one was even acknowledged. Through all of this the staff was pleasant and tried their best to help, though sometimes ineffectively. All of that said it is a nice property (which will only be nicer after the renovation) and it is in a great location. I'd happily stay there again, as long as it wasn't sold out. <cross-posted to TripAdvisor and FlyerTalk>

Reviews.Title: “Not the W standard”
Reviews.Author: BigL0uie
Reviews.Content: Choose your room carefully. 213 is next to the elevator shaft. The noise never ended. The told us we could not move since the were full. Later the same night, our neighbor's radio alarm clock went off at 4am and was blaring country music? We called the front desk and they said the room was vacant and they would send someone to turn it off???? At 745am, the radio finally turned off. Yes, 3.75 hours later. As a side note; I hate being lied to. Rooms are plain and lack any luxury or style. Overall it is in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Room was disappointing”
Reviews.Author: BellePrincess
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location, within walking distance of most everything. Quiet, no street noise. Really nice decor in courtyard and lobby. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms very clean. Windows in room open. Cons: Courtyard pool area showing signs of age, very frayed & shabby. Rooms are very bland in decor (almost ugly) and a bit worn. Not sure if our room was unique in that it was wheelchair accessible which meant pole in (small) closet was about 3' off the ground and nearly useless. The bottom part of most clothes ended up laying on the floor and on top of the safe that was also in the closet. Not one drawer available and no desk space.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay at this W”
Reviews.Author: gzz
Reviews.Content: I was just recently at the W in the French Quarter New Orleans, and I couldnt be more disappointed with my visit. I am a frequent Starwood guests and have stayed in many W hotels worldwide. This W is far from luxury. I understand the hotel is undergoing some construction but that does not explain the problems. Our first night we woke up to engineer pounding on the room next to us, only to wake up with bug bites on my body that I for sure didn't have when going to bed. I would go one but the best thing I can say is dont stay at this W, stay at the other W just outside the quarter. I have stayed there a couple time and it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: clairerhiannon
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for a 3 night trip and were initially thrilled to be staying at a W Hotel however we felt let down by the standard. We were greeted by staff who were all very friendly but the valet service was extortionate, $40 a day plus VAT when there are other carparks available nearby for $15 and when we got to our (small) room it was only kitted out for one person, even though we told them there would be 2 in the room - this meant only one robe, one set of towels, there was no remote control in the room nor any coffee making facilities. All these things I had to go and ask for at reception. These should be automatically there! Also we had to pay for internet access, at the prices we paid per night that shouldnt be the case. Another thing we were not at all happy with was that there was no restaurant/bar - we should have been informed about this before.
