We were travelling with a heavily pregnant friend and this wasnt ideal as we then had to leave the hotel to get snacks instead of room service/by the pool. The only good thing about this was that guests were bringing their own drinks into the pool/seating area instead of paying the hotel's inflated prices. Always a silver lining... Its a lovely looking hotel, in a great position in the french quarter however if I came back to New Orleans I wouldnt stay here again as I think you can get better value for money elsewhere. There wasnt really a 'community' feel about the place either as the lobby was set elsewhere on the other side of the hotel and you do not have to walk through it to get to your rooms so it felt like we were coming and going without anyone realising... The good thing about the room we stayed in was that the beds were incredibly comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “W hasn't disappointed me yet ..”
Reviews.Author: robert_dfw
Reviews.Content: This property is quite unique and you'll feel like you're staying at a botique hotel. I would describe it was understated chic. If you're not careful while walking down Chartres Street you might walk right past it save the rather small "W" hanging in front. It's extremely quiet despite its location in the French Quarter. The staff is warm and accommodating and just what you expect from a W property. During my stay the onsite restaurant was closed for renovation but you're in the French Quarter so great food is just steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sk8drew201
Reviews.Content: My experience at W Hotel French Quarter was amazing. The hotel is one of the coolest W hotels I have stayed at thus far. It is a bit smaller but has the most personality. The rooms are very decorative and the courtyard really makes the hotel. Location is among the best, about a block or two from Bourbon street. The service is really top notch at this hotel and cannot recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Boutique Feel”
Reviews.Author: Renery
Reviews.Content: This hotel feels like a small boutique hotel. It has a cozy, intimate feel that I haven't found in other W Hotels. The decor is typical W -- very sophisticated and well done in shades of gray with a tinge of purple. My daughter decided to celebrate her 40th birthday with family & friends in New Orleans during Jazz Fest 2011. She recommended the W, since I'm an SPG member. I booked two rooms, and three other couples booked there as well. Initially, my daughter wasn't happy because she was near the construction that other people have noted in these reviews. They moved her twice, and on the third try she was happy that she had a quiet (but smaller) room. Our room on the 4th floor, facing the courtyard was quiet until the day we checked out & they began sanding the wall below our window. Can't complain too much because it didn't start til 10:00. The manager, Brian, is professional and helpful. If you have any problems, he's the go-to person. I had left a photo album in a taxi coming from the airport & the receipt didn't have the name of the taxi company. The desk helped me by looking up all the taxi companies that had white vans. I got my album back the next day. The room was very comfortable & well maintained, except that we had to ask for service on Mother's Day. They must have been short staffed. The beds, linens & pillows were 'Heavenly'! We had one problem which was only partially resolved. There were 6 of us going on a tour & we were running late. We asked the valet to hail a van for us, and he offered to take us in the hotel's van. When he drove up in it, an arrogant-acting man jumped in the back seat & said 'sorry, ladies... he's taking me.' Brian said there was no reservation on the books for the van & that he would talk to the valet & find out what happened, but he never got back to me. He did give us a bottle of wine though, which was something. But I will never forget how rude that jerk was who jumped into our van, leaving us to search for our own transportation. On another positive note, the location is fantastic! Courtyard is very beautiful & comfortable. When I opened the window in the mornings, you could hear music coming from all directions. I loved it! That's what New Orleans is all about. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service - Perfect Location - 5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: NinoTwins
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend in New Orleans. This was our fifth trip to the city, and the W French Quarter was by far our favorite! We will definitely return next year! The location was great. Two blocks off Bourbon gets you close enough to all the action, but far enough away that you're not bothered by all the noise. The hotel, although just starting a huge renovation, was still in fantastic condition, and the work being done was hardly noticeable. The pool and courtyard area were fantastic. From lounging during the day, to relaxing in a cabana at night before heading out, the setting is perfect. To say the staff were responsive, is a true understatement. Although we had some initial issues due to central reservations (not the hotel's fault), the manager, Brian, quickly resolved the problem. He even upgraded us to a room with a balcony for the minor inconvenience. Throughout our stay, he and his staff were fantastic. Although they were never intrusive, or 'in the way', they were always there when needed, and seemed to be intuitive to our needs. They even arranged, at the very last minute, a cabana complete with champagne and a dinner reservation at one of the local hot spots. All during a very busy Jazz Fest weekend. I would highly recommend the W French Quarter to anyone traveling to New Orleans. Don't let the renovation comments steer you somewhere else. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay at an amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: floridakarnsas
Reviews.Content: From the moment we pulled under the porte-cochere we were caught up in the W's romantic and posh atmosphere. The beauty of the hotel, coupled with the inviting staff made an unforgettable stay. We travel to New Orleans frequently and have stayed at many hotels, meeting many people. No one has impressed us as much as this hotel and its staff. The staff is knowledgable, hospitable, and gracious. Though the hotel is undergoing renovations, it was not noticeable and did not hinder our stay at all. In fact, when we requested room service, since the hotel restaurant is being renovated, the front desk sent up menus from local restaurants who deliver to their hotel and a member of the staff personally delivered the meal up to the room; which actually made for a better experience than typical hotel room service because it gave a wider variety of restaurants and menus to choose from. Our experience this weekend has created two loyal guests. The W is now our preferred hotel in New Orleans, hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel & Staff- that exceeded expectations!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTravelgirl23
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at the W French Quarter for the Easter weekend! For those of you who are worried about the current renovations â€“ they went out of the way to make the least impact on guests â€“ I emailed ahead of my stay to request a room that was quiet and we had a room that was not renovated but it was perfect and everything you would expect from a W Hotel â€“ We faced the courtyard and had no trouble sleeping! The restaurant is closed but they were ready with lots of nearby suggestions and offer coffee in the morning! The hotel is really beautiful and charming â€“ it has that boutique feel that you lose in the bigger hotels. The location could not be better. Staci at the front desk was amazing and went the extra mile our entire stay but I got the feeling she is like that all the time! What really makes this W Hotel special is the staff â€“ everyone was friendly and the staff go out of their way to make sure you feel welcomed and your needs are met! Cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “I have never had such service”
Reviews.Author: lsdean
Reviews.Content: This is the first hotel I have ever stayed at with such service. All the staff were exceptional and were at the ready to meet our request. The restaurant and a portion of the hotel were under renovation but the night manager would come out to the courtyard ever night with a bottle of wine to pour......now that is service!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and with a little patience, this place will be back on top again”
Reviews.Author: GlendaleCA
Reviews.Content: There are some fantastic staff people here all around. Special compliments to Christine T. and Richard. It's great to have someone like Christine, who is so well-travelled on your staff. She knows what guests are looking for. While I was not upgraded to the room I would have liked to have been, I realized that may have been because of the FQ Festival and the large conference I was attending. Also, the renovations may have some rooms closed. This has always been one of my favorite hotels and I hadn't stayed in a few years. I was a bit worried. Yes, the rooms really need an overhaul and the restaurant is closed, but this quaint little W is working its way back to full capacity. The staff also are very honest about the changes. A little birdie told me that it might have been better to close the place down for a short amount of time to do the renos. And I agree, however you will be treated well. I wonder what they could do to pacify people in the meantime, whether that means offering some sort of a discount or welcome back in the future to spread goodwill. I think it might increase business. Anyhow, if you choose to stay before the renovations are over, and I think you will be just fine, try and ask for even #'d rooms. These have good views and balconies. Bathrooms are big but have a lot of wasted space. Too bad they don't have tubs. There is plenty of room for one. Beds of course are super comfy. Props to Manager Brian for, once again, being super honest and sharing the renovation details with interested guests. This hotel is in a great location, has excellent service (some W staffs try to act nearly snobby like they own the place- not the case here), a great courtyard, and will soon have the best rooms in the FQ.

Reviews.Title: “stand-out service doesn't quite make up for a dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michelle0609
Reviews.Content: Got in after midnight and was told by, Yessenia, the very sweet woman working the front desk that the hotel was undergoing renovations and we got the last unbooked, un-in-the-middle-of-renovations room in the whole place. We got up to our room -- tired, ready to go to bed -- and lo and behold, it *was* in the middle of being renovated. Everything covered in plastic, no sheets on the bed -- couldn't stay there. Went back to Yessenia, the awesome front desk agent, who apologized profusely and proceeded to find us our real room. We left to get some food, only because it was taking a while for her to track down which room (again, the only un-being-renovated, unoccupied one left in the hotel) was actually ours. Came back an hour later, the rock star Yessenia has found our room, sent our bags up, and comped us the night. Now we're talking! But then, as I'm settling in, reading for a few minutes before turning off the light... I see it. A mouse. A MOUSE! For real? At the W? At the prices they charge? At this point, I'm exhausted and freaking out. Yessenia is very apologetic, and will move us promptly in the morning, but can't do anything at the moment. Fine. I talk myself down and try and get some rest. Housekeeping wakes us up the next day by entering our room (fine, understandable, we forgot to put out the do-not-disturb sign), but as we're scrambling to cover up and asking her to leave, the woman is just standing there, repeatedly demanding to know if we have a late check out. Finally, many minutes later, the husband has to literally say, "Please leave the room NOW, we need to get dressed, and you're making us uncomfortable." Housekeeping fail number one. Then they move us to the new room, and what's the first thing my eyes fall on when I enter? A dirty q-tip, yellow with ear-wax. Just left there, hanging out in the overpriced snack tray/mini-bar area. Housekeeping fail number two. SIGH. The rest of the stay was uneventful (though we did overhear the front desk clerk recommend a lunch spot to a couple that, when we walked by the same restaurant moments later, we saw was closed). And they did send up a bottle of wine to apologize for the mouse incident. But still. For the prices you pay at a place like this, the quality was laughable. Only the stand-out, rock-star service by Yessenia (who, even on our last morning, came to the rescue again, fixing a phantom charge on our final bill) kept our stay at the W French Quarter from being a total disaster.

Reviews.Title: “bachelor party here and it fit the bill”
Reviews.Author: nfrasercolumbia
Reviews.Content: i go to new orleans all the time for business and for fun. i like the W and will stay here sometimes when i find good rates. the hotel is everything a W is supposed to be. hip, trendy, stylish and pretty comfortable. the rooms are small but the service is very good. good location to harrahs casino and to the french quarter. i usually stay at the double tree right next to harrahs as it is easiest for gambling and I am Hilton hotel member but this is my second favorite place for fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, ideal position, wonderful service, good price”
Reviews.Author: moby44
Reviews.Content: The hotel has had some bad reviews of late. We were very pleased throughout our stay of 3 nights. The room had been recently decorated and faced the main street with a large balcony - there was no noise from the street. The room was well serviced. Reception was very helpful especially when we had to change our flights at short notice. The hotel position is excellent for the French Quarter. The amount we paid was extremely reasonable for the amenities and service. Thank you for a delightful stay.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT stay at a wonderful hotel in April '11 -- Construction not an issue”
Reviews.Author: kmf54
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried due to the hot-and-cold reviews this hotel received, but we found that most of the terrible reviews were not true-- they did offer room service (at least for breakfast) despite their restaurant being closed due to renovations (I can't believe some people would give a hotel 1 star largely due to the fact that the restaurant is under construction -- the hotel was up front and apologetic for this and offered a good list of nearby alternatives--what more can you ask for?). The staff was excellent and the other guests were abnormally friendly too -- when we walked into the courtyard after checking in guests by the pool poured us cups of champagne. Later that night we were sitting in the courtyard on the lovely little outdoor lounge areas they have set up and a different guest offered us glasses of wine. I think that the overall mood of the place was elevated by its charming feel, its great location (close to the action but on a quiet street) and the quality of the rooms (I admit our suite had already been renovated, but I think at this point maybe all of the rooms have already been completed? Guy-who-responds-to-all-the-reviews, you can correct me here if I'm wrong). I'm still at the hotel -- currently using the wifi in the room and there's free wifi in the courtyard. We have the window open and there's some music floating in from the street. Lovely! The one thing that does seem weird (that I wrote about our stay two nights ago at the other W New Orleans) is that there's no coffee/tea maker in-room. But based on another review I read it seems like we could call down and get free coffee/tea room service. Not that big of a deal to me!

Reviews.Title: “The Worst W Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: joaqulop
Reviews.Content: For those that are familiar with the W Hotel experience, be sure to stay clear of the W French Quarter as you will be very disappointed. I stayed there for 5 awful nights this past month as part of a business event. Although nicely located in the French Quarter, this hotel actually feels older than the FQ. It was poorly staffed, offered little to no services (no spa, room service or lounge) - I even spotted a live mouse running on my floor. If you are in New Orleans and want to stay in the Quarter, steer clear of this place!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: miracle31
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here the week after Mardi Gras; booked the room based on great experience with the W in Chicago City Center location, but then read the negative reviews on the French Quarter location and started to worry. It was definitely not needed. I read several reviews which complained about the construction, but I have to admit that I barely even saw any construction going on, nor heard much of anything other than a very rare pound of a hammer (Although, I should add that our room was in the "Carriage House", a little removed from the main building). The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, the room was updated but retained some historic french quarter charm and really blended the two nicely. The room was spacious and had everything we needed. Location was fantastic - checked the car in when we arrived and never saw it again until we were leaving - everything was within walking distance. On the downside, a hotel bar & restaurant was very much needed (a temporary situation, according to a letter from the manager waiting in our room). Another (and odder note) was the comforter in the hotel room - the fabric was a wierd velvet that didn't breathe well at all; it took a little tinkering the first night to find the right temperature setting in the room to get totally comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Location is their best asset”
Reviews.Author: snoels
Reviews.Content: Came for Mardi Gras and was happy to be in the Quarter- location is the key benefit of this hotel. Room was an odd shape so a bit of wasted space. Clean with good maid service but a few small items like the bathroom door sticking and one drawer not opening made it just average for what should be a more refined boutique hotel. Nice courtyard with SMALL pool. Typical expensive parking on site and wifi for $15 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings on the W New Orleans French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: SuperDave15
Reviews.Content: To start I am a SPG Platinum member who travels globally so I have stayed in a ton of hotels within the Starwood chain. I recently stayed at the W New Orleans French Quarter. Upon checking into my room I went to have a shower an the ceiling was falling in due to a water leak. The next morning I was moved to another room so they could repair the ceiling. About 4 hours after my move I noticed I had left something in my room I went back to my old room and there was already someone in the room! No way they could have repaired the ceiling in that time. I was moved to a new room. In the new room the shower head sprayed on the ceiling every time you moved it. The bathroom door also stopped working and when I tried to force it open the door handle broke off. Later I went to unplug my laptop from the wall and the entire wall plug came out. This hotel does have room service but not bar or restaurant. A letter in the room states they are looking for a new partner to open a restaurant. Another thing to note is that the walls are quite thin and you hear everything. While the hotel location isn't bad (3 blocks from Bourbon Street) there isn't much right around the hotel other than some small stores and art galleries. Would I stay here again - no. The Sheraton or other W hotel are much closer to restaurants, casino, convention centre etc. and are still ony 3 blocks from Bourbon Street. While the management did try to apologize by providing me with some Starwood points unfortunately they are stuck with a hotel that is outclassed by many others in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great time, no need to worry”
Reviews.Author: 28970Niffy5
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews I was panicked that my stay was going to be a disaster. Instead, I had an incredible time in New Orleans and thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the W French Quarter. I requested a room in the back of the hotel away from construction and overlooking the patio. It was mostly quiet and although I did occasionally hear some construction it was mostly ambient white noise and not disturbing. The staff was accommodating and we took several trips in the Acura experience, a free perk I suggest everyone use. We also enjoyed our time in the courtyard area, which got a lot of sun during the day and was very romantic at night. The room was not big, but it was comfortable and we had a great night's sleep. Above everything the location is perfect and since you are in New Orleans, you are not spending a ton of time at your hotel anyway! Would definitely stay there again and recommend it to others. I had a great experience and although many others might disagree our stay was wonderful (and no I don't work for W or Starwood!)

Reviews.Title: “Not a good time to stay at the W French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Travels4workand4fun
Reviews.Content: Currently no on-site restaurant, no bar, and very limited room service. Construction/renovation work is ongoing, and can be quite intrusive/loud in the courtyard and was going on during the weekend as early as 10 a.m. on my recent visit. Service is very uneven (some very good, but some lackluster) and not up to W standards, especially if you're Platinum. If you're looking for a full service hotel, check out the other nearby W or other Starwood properties or look elsewhere in the French Quarter. Hopefully they'll be back up to their usual standards by the fall, because this has otherwise been a wonderful property in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: bhlindsey
Reviews.Content: this property has a charming setting w/courtyard and from the street looks fabulous. and the service was great. but the room was shabby, dirty, and when we complained and got moved to a newly renovated room the paint fumes were overwhelming, bedskirt was shabby, furniture had been painted rather than replaced, there were paint smears on the glass of the picture frames on the wall and the mirror in the bathroom. And--the carpet was faded and frayed between the bedroom and the bathroom. The price was the same at the Ritz in the FQ, so we probably could have had a nicer room for the same amount of money. Will not be going back. BTW--have stayed at W New Orleans and it is no better.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, deceptive, noisy and cramped”
Reviews.Author: Gcarlylt
Reviews.Content: We had reserved a king room with a roll-away bed. We asked upon check-in for an upgraded room and were informed that they don't have roll-aways, (but would give us an air mattress) and all the upgraded rooms were being renovated. When we got up to the room, the room was so small, there was no place for the air mattress (or our luggage for that matter). We rearranged the furniture to at least be able to put the air mattress flat on the floor. That meant we didn't have the headboard for half of the bed and we had to scoot on the bed around the sides of the bed because there was no floor space to walk on. The desk clerk promised to comp the parking and "a little something extra". Our final bill reflected neither. I have to agree with all the other reviewers about the noise. Not only the street noise, which sounded like you were not inside at all, but there was music and a party going on in a nearby room that kept us up all night the first night. How anyone sleeps in that hotel without earplugs is a mystery to me. It is true that there are few amenities-no restaurant, vending machines, coffee makers, a fitness room or closets (there is a wardrobe that proved to be inaccessible). If I didn't know any better, I would think that the W is the low end of the Starwood properties. Please don't waste your money here if you are interested in being comfortable and actually sleeping in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, not well maintained”
Reviews.Author: ktattai
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I went to New Orleans for News Years in celebration of NYE and a wedding. We thought the W New Orleans would be the ideal location. Upon check in, I was surprised at how small the lobby was, which isn't a biggie, there was cool set up and great decore. However there was spilled coffee on the floor, the complimentary beverage area was a mess with liquid and dirty cups everywhere. The lobby was empty with me and my fiance and 3 employees. I didn't understand how they didn't see the mess. After check in to my room, I couldn't lay my finger on what made the room feel "not so clean". It was driving me crazy so I took notice at the details. Scuff marks on walls, old soiled marketing materials/menus on desk. Random stains on furniture pieces. On the second night I had a Bachelorette party to attend at 7:30pm. At 6:00pm I got up to take a shower and no hot water. The hot water didn't begiin working until 7:10pm. Luckily the manager listended to my complaints and comped my parking. I wouldn't stay here again unless I see a 180 in reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Whatever, Whenever: Be Forwarned the W Hotel French Quarter is not REALLY Open during renovation”
Reviews.Author: KCTraveller5171
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked into the W in the Quarter expecting a relaxed upscale experience. What we were treated to was a hotel that was kind of open, but not really. There is a warning that shows up on the splash page for the hotel that says: Hotel Renewal. When you click there it opens up the following statement: From December 22, 2010 through May 5, 2011, we will undergo a multi-million dollar renewal. The renewal will be executed in multiple stages and includes the restaurant, deck to our courtyard staircase, hotel exterior and all guest room balconies and windows. During this period, we will tailor our schedule to create minimal inconvenience. What they fail to mention is that there is no restaurant, there is no bar, there is no room service, except for breakfast from a little place up the street, and the rooms are in very bad need of renovation. The carpet is stained and the woodwork is very beat up. In addition there was a cold snap and the outside temp was quite chilly so their HVAC would not work to keep the rooms cool except by opening the windows. This of course allowed the noise from those who had experienced their first Hurricane at Pat O'Briens to serenade us at 4am hence no sleep! Acura Service: Although discussed prior to check in that we would use for dining, it is not available after 5pm. The Restaurant is no longer there. They have no bar. The "living room" is the check in lobby and all of 8ft by 12ft, yes very cozy! The first night we were there, we got no sleep due to the noise with the window open to stay cool. They offered to move us to the 4th floor from the 3rd but it was even noisier due to construction on the 5th floor. They acted surprise. Everything, including having coffee available in the "living room" seemed like a real effort. They ran out of coffee and it took 30 minutes to get more made. The best came on Saturday morning when we were getting ready to go to the airport. The water to the hotel was shut off!!!! According to Angel , the manager, it was an area wide shut off caused by New Orleans ....but the Sewage and Water Board of New Orleans said just the oposite and suggested the hotel was having an issue with their system. We gave up and left. To her credit Angel credited us back for one nights stay but this hotel should not really be open or be considered a distant equal to their lesser brand of Aloft. "Whatever, Whenever" is what they said everytime you called the front desk and it's cute but how about we get the basics down before we get cute! This was a trip for which I planned and saved for as a special treat to my wife for her birthday and the W French Quarter let us down.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I would have read your reviews...”
Reviews.Author: TXYorkieMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to New Orleans a couple of times a year for long weekends. We normally stay at the W New Orleans, primarily to get out of the Quarter and the rif-raf. However, we decided to give the W French Quarter a try (especially since their price was higher, I thought they might have more to offer). Wrong! As other's have commented, they have NO amenities (unless you count a pool in January!). Their "restuarant" that they still have listed on their website is closed, which also means their Bar is closed. They have no gym. They offered to take us to the W New Orleans to use the gym their in their "Acura Experience", but refused to pick us up afterwards. Were we supposed to walk back in sweaty gym clothes in January? Oh, and the construction... it started at 7:40AM on Saturday morning. When I called the front desk, the person who answered the phone denied that the workers were even there. Well, someone was sawing sheet rock and it wasn't my husband.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: Monroe1988
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a W Hotel and it was disappointing. The location was good and staff was very helpful. However, this hotel is currently undergoing renovation and the amenities were very limited. The quality of the room was below expectations - although the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was large, the noise level was high (even for the French Quarter). The closet space was inadequate and charge for internet access seemed excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but few amenities”
Reviews.Author: m1977
Reviews.Content: Like many other reviewers have said, the location in the French Quarter is the best thing about this hotel; it is so convenient for walking around everywhere. Pros: 1. Location - can walk everywhere. 2. Very quiet rooms - mine faced the courtyard side and I couldn't hear any street noise or construction. 3. Helpful desk staff - booked me on some day tours and printed off info for me. Cons: 1. Being incorrectly charged for minibar items I never consumed (why does this only ever happen to me at W hotels?) - they fixed it quickly but these mistakes are just annoying. 2. No amenities. You can use the gym at the other W property but a bit of a hassle to get there. The "business centre" consists of one computer in the small lobby, I think it was $6.95 for 15 mins. Wifi in the rooms cost $14.95 per day. 3. Hallway/room smells - there is a strong odor of cleaning solution in the halls and rooms. I didn't find it unbearable but it's certainly not pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, great trip to New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: theflyleaf
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. Despite other reviews we had no problems - rooms were nicely decorated, clean but small. As there is no real lobby, had limited contact with front desk staff but valet staff always at desk and very helpful with directions, suggestions for places to go etc. Courtyard beautiful, nice place to sit with a drink. Windows are very thin - noise from street noticeable. Two tips - a few doors down from W on same street is The Chart Room bar - great pub, seemed to be some regulars, bar staff very friendly and helpful, hooked us up with staff from pizza place at other end of the street who fed us after closing on the Sunday night, when most restaurants are closed (we didn't expect this). Location perfect - short walk to Bourbon Street, the rest of the quarter, and out to Canal for the streetcar. Not sure I would pay full price for the W (we used points). Front desk staff billed us anyway despite using points and did take a week for the manager to reverse the charges. But in general a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Don't WASTE your money. Horrible staff and hotel! Don't know what this is even a W.”
Reviews.Author: Shaheen9
Reviews.Content: We were greeted with a a tray of leftover food in the hall that was probablly here since morning at 3 PM. It was still there by the way at midnight when we came back to our room. The staff were very unhelp when you asked questions. It was just enough to give a simple response. Our water supply was cut off for 4 hours since they were doing construction throughout our stay. I asked the front desk and the guy told me yeah they are aware and thats it! Then we asked to driven to some store by magazine street to do the Acura promtion get rides to places and we were told that that it only goes 1 mile radius. So I asked to get a ride to at least the main W hotel so that I could use the gym and was told it is not available. Well what is the point of that? When I proceeded to checkout they attempted to charge me $509 for each night when I had a pre-paid two months ago in advacne rooms for around $200 a night. Thank goodness that I split our week with this hotel and the Hotel Monteleone. We loved that hotel. Very nice rooms, gym, and not to mention the service. If you want to stay in French Quarter don't do it here! Much better options available.

Reviews.Title: “The W stands for What a let down! Does not represent W well!”
Reviews.Author: cyberness
Reviews.Content: So I accompanied by s/o for business and we also took a few extra days and here is my fair points to make both good and bad. Great first impression of the room; stylish and modern wall were thin enough to hear talking and sexual sounds that were not loud; this is not a party hotel, mostly couples which I like we were only notified of exisiting renovations and construction after we received the email confirmation> we actually called and ask various questions> i would think they would want to be honest and transparent and have told us then Another couple also confirmed they were not told of this issue One day on the trip we slept in some; went out for breakfast to return to take showers before we headed out for the day. There was not water at all> luckily we got by with bottled water we had bought into our room. As we return to our room later that day, someone had put a letter to warn us after the fact of the water cut off. It did arrive that evening to warn us of no water the next morning> again, shouldnt they want to be honest and transparent upfront. When we had issues there was never anyone sitting at the front desk: always had to wait for somene to show at valet parking. My questions to the owner would start...Why do you entrust a beautiful hotel to teenagers? Do you have any adult supervision at this facility? I would never throw my multi-billon dollar business to a child, why do you? One last thing is that they charged us 14.00 for the honor bar; We only used 2 diet drinks as we bought in a case of water, drinks, liquors etc. etc Our last day we also recieved no service and they also brag about their tolietries but they only provided enough for one We are usually picky about cleanliness but the lack of customer service and lack of honesty would discourage me from recommending this to a friend or associate. The sad part is that this hotel has the potential to be one of the best in NOLA but poor custumer service, lack of visable employees and dishonesty it really brings that nice decor, location and romantic rooms to the bottom.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: JAVJAV
Reviews.Content: This W was pretty disappointing. I liked the idea of it. It's in an older building in the French Quarter. I though it would have more of an authentic feeling than a mega hotel. In the end, I'd prefer the mega hotel that was done right. The room was pretty small. The carpet was ugly and had stains on it. The bathroom was nice, but had only a shower stall, no tub. The bed was pretty comfy. The duvet cover looked like it might not have been washed between guests. There were really no amenities other than the Acura car service from 8-5 which was nice. The wi-fi didn't work in the rooms. We were on the fourth floor facing the street and you could hear every word people on the street said. The courtyard area looked nice, but was under construction. Overall, it wasn't bad, but it definitely was not worth $180 something a night. I'd also like to say that I think it's pretty obnoxious that management responds to negative reviews with the same exact response each time. Way to address the issues guys. Your copy and paste skills will not bring me back.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, hotel needs updating”
Reviews.Author: 337Regal
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the W after returning from cruise with NCL. Had stayed the previous week at the Sheriton on Canal Street and found it too big and noisy. The staff at the W were very friendly and helpful with hints on where to eat and arranging some tours. The hotel is in the process of renovation which it greatly needs to include insulated windows. We did not spend much time in room, so made no difference whether or not we had a courtyard room (although it did make a difference when garbage truck rumbles through at 4 in the morning). Coffee in lobby in morning very good.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful respite!”
Reviews.Author: lisasherryinterieurs
Reviews.Content: Just returned from New Orleans staying at the W in the french quarter. The staff is adorable, hip, friendly and attentive. The hotel is intimate and very well appointed. Our room had a terrace overlooking the gorgeous pool/courtyard that was beautiful as well, perfect for coffee and email in the morning! Once you enter the hotel you feel like you have walked into your own private compound.

Reviews.Title: “Total disappointment”
Reviews.Author: lalaprice
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying at the W. This hotel was dirty and run down. I didn't want to walk on the gross carpet. The front desk staff was immature, giggly and annoying. This hotel is a joke - don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel for the money - "unpet friendly" and unclean!”
Reviews.Author: shaffer56062
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our first trip to New Orleans for the 2010 Thanksgiving break. The hotel location is wonderful (the one good thing I have to say about our experience with this hotel) but that is where the good stops. The hotel was not clean and way over priced for the quality of the room. They say they are pet friendly and you get a welcome package for your pet when you check in... Well there is not a blade of grass within 3 blocks of the hotel and our pet package showed up 3 days after we were there after we kept asking for just a dog bowl for water for 3 days (my dog had to drink out of a cup from the bathroom for days. The room and bathroom was not clean and we would leave everyday for hours (4-5 hours a day) and come back to an unmade bed and no room service until we had to go to the desk EVERYDAY and ask. There are no vending machines for sodas/water in the hotel and they said they had coffee in the morning in their lobby, but guess what, no cream or sugar! I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and would never go back! And when we checked out our hotel parking was $180 for 4 days!

Reviews.Title: “I have a love/hate relationship with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: M_in_Cali
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, and some wonderful touches that make it a special french quarter hotel. A lot of hotels in the quarter have quirks and issues, and you just sort of sift through them and decide what works for you and what price you want to pay. I have stayed here two different times. What I love about this hotel are the location, the courtyard, the pool, the decor of the check-in room, and the quality of the service when someone is available. The rooms are a decent size, as are the bathrooms, and the bed very comfortable. I also love Bacco, the restaurant next door that also provides room service. I love the small size and intimate feel. I hate the street noise if you face the street. I hate how thin the walls are (could hear a complete conversation in normal tones in the room next door). I hate the HVAC (the hallways are frigid, and it is tough to hit the right temp in the room). I hate that there is this big bathroom but only a shower, and that both rooms I have been in had a shower that leaks. I hate that the bathroom door is a barn-door-style frosted glass slider, which offers an illusion of privacy, but not actual privacy (visually you are OK with the way the room is laid out, but acoustically is a different story). I hate that there is a wonderful, but small staff, and sometimes you can't find someone to help you with something for 5-10 min. I hate that they constantly close the courtyard for events, which can make your quiet courtyard-overlooking room as loud as a street room. I hate that they can never manage to provide the water you are supposed to get as a platinum member. There's also a lot of deferred maintenance in the carpeting, paint, etc. If the rates were a bit cheaper, I would suggest this hotel more enthusiastically. As it is, it is a lovely place to stay, but you should investigate some other choices as well. I've decided that I'm over semi-private bathroom here, and I'll probably try someplace else on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “The W chain in general is tired, this is a great example.”
Reviews.Author: jmg2326
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to sleep, you might enjoy. Our room faced the street and was very noisy. They closed "living room" both Friday and Saturday nights. Keep in mind this is the ONLY public space. We had to leave our own hotel to have a drink before dinner or just relax. The management of this hotel is not on top of the basics. It appears that throwing grey paint on an old hotel is the extent of the W brand. This is the third bad W experience we've had this year and will be our last.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: girlzjustwanahavefun
Reviews.Content: I have just recently returned from a great stay at the W in the French Quarter. I was staying there with a wedding party this past weekend and I was highly impressed with the hotel and the service. The rooms were a tad small, but they were adequately furnished and very comfy. All of the girls at the desk were a delight. But one young lady in particular was fabulous. Brandy was our favorite part of the entire stay. She was not only helpful with directing us to fun things to do in the city, but was able to make us giggle everytime we came in contact. Infact all of their staff was great. As far as location it doesn't get any better. Your in the heart of all the action but far enough away that you can get a good nights sleep. We will most definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel - W for WOW!”
Reviews.Author: bfernandez
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. From the minute we arrived, we were greeted by a very cordial valet. Who assisted us with our bags arriving to our room. Then we checked in-was a breeze. They even upgraded us because rooms were available. We got a wonderful view with a beautiful room. Very romantic and luxurious. The lobby is beautiful, wonderful site for pictures. They have some lovely oversized chairs, and a library, with some game tables as well. The lounge experience was nice, good bartender. I have to say the overall aura of the hotel is amazing. Because of my stay here, now I am forced to search for a W hotel everywhere I travel!

Reviews.Title: “Wait until the rooms are renovatedc”
Reviews.Author: litotra
Reviews.Content: The location & courtyard/pool are very nice. The room was in need of serious renovation. The desk chair was so stained it was disgusting & we wouldn't sit on it. We had a room with a window on Conti which is not a busy street in the Quarter, but we were kept awake by the noise on a Sat night & both mornings trash trash trucks at 7:00 AM. The windows were pathetic for any hotel in the Quarter. The furniture was very worn, bed covering stained etc. Had to have breakfast in the very small room. On the plus side this hotel has a very friendly staff, lovely courtyard & good location. All that said, we would not stay here again. 3rd trip to NO in the last year. Stayed at the Roosevelt, Ritz & W French Quarter. So far the Ritz wins. Next trip may try the other W hotel. This is definately not as nice as other W hotels. The rooms are pretty beat up but this is not uncommon in the French Quarter. If you want to stay here highly recommend you upgrade from the standard room to one the faces the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Pefect location in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: EdwardTylicki
Reviews.Content: The location in the French Quarter is perfect. The courtyard and SMALL pool is nice after wandering the steamy streets of the quarter. The room was nice, albeit this is one of the oldest W hotels and things are looking a little frayed in the room. Highly recommend the W-French Quarter for a few days in New Orleans. Don't miss Stanley (breakfast) and Stella (dinner) a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Probably Best Hotel in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: girlluxe
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over New Year's for 2 nights. It is hard to imagine a better hotel in the French Quarter. The rooms were typical for a W - very nice and comfortable. The location was exactly what I wanted -- not on Bourbon Street, but nearby and close to the French Quarter attractions, restaurants and shops. It was chilly for the courtyard, but they had firepits going. The only negative was that it was busy, so we had to wait a while for the valet/bellman to get our luggage and also at the front desk, but not unreasonably long. The front desk staff was very helpful with directions and recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Service”
Reviews.Author: Pace205
Reviews.Content: I have a new favorite hotel to stay at when traveling to New Orleans on business. The staff there is wonderful! Pleasant, helpful, and professional - - from the valets to the desk staff to the maid service. I've got my next trip scheduled alread for the first week in September, and I'll be there in future trips as well (if they have any vacancy at all).

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional location, decor and service.”
Reviews.Author: viaggio3333
Reviews.Content: The W team went above and beyond to accomodate every request. The service was prompt and congenial. I will definately stay here on subsequent returns. The 9pm room service cut off was the only downer.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at stay - W French Quarter New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: caribtravelerMs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a really nice stay at the W French Quarter New Orleans this past weekend. All of the personnel were great. Volker at the front desk was helpful there and every time he saw us. Once even turning our car around to help us get out of the drive. Jarrad was a great bellman and parking attendant. Stacie W insider was absolutely fabulous; helping every time we had any question or problem. In addition housekeeping and all staff were extremely helpful and friendly; from delivering a coffee pot to keeping our room very clean to asking us if we got our phone charger as we walked out of the room. Thanks again to Stacie, Volker and Jarrad. You were great. Can't wait for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “20 TH ANNIVERSARY SPENT HERE AND GREAT MEMORIES !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cajungypsy2
Reviews.Content: The W is the place to go in the Big Easy. the service,rooms,bldg,grounds ,food & everything was great. Check out thier whatever/whenever service,It is exceptional, If you do ask for Staci, She is great at her job,along with all of the staff .The costs were well worth it and comparable to the going rate,you just get alot more @ the W, Everyone there went out of their way to make our stay pleasant,and we took home some great memories,I would tell anyone to stay ther and will be back again. thanks,to Staci and the entire staff for everything Hope to see you all again soon. Cajun & Gypsy

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tess49_10
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for a quick getaway. It was the first time we have stayed at this hotel and it was wonderful from a quick check in to a fantastic room! It is 2 blocks off of Bourbon Street, so convenient to everything, but quiet and nice. After dinner we went back to the bar and ordered a bottle of wine and sat out in the courtyard which is wonderful! Can not wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “My first stay in a W hotel. It will be the last.”
Reviews.Author: e2cpilot
Reviews.Content: The exterior walls are so thin that you can hear every emergency vehicle with a siren. It turns out there are a lot on a Saturday night. Additionally, the party crowd on the floor below us screamed at the top of their lungs until 4AM, yet the hotel staff did nothing to quite them. After a sleepless night and on the way to work in the morning, I waited over 15 minutes for the valet to retrieve my car. After tax, you are paying more than $38 per night to park your rental car. That would be more than the daily cost of the rental car. Is it just me, or shouldn't the service be second to none for the supposed reputation of a W hotel; let alone the cost to park a rental car in their valet only garage? Additionally, when the car finally arrived, the valet just walked away and didn't offer to load my bag. I was the only person waiting for a car at 6:30AM. As far as furnishings go, everything was very nice. The amenities appeared to be high quality. However, everything is showing its age already. They need to reinvest in upkeep and maintenance. Frankly I can pay the W's rates anywhere and get first class treatment. Why should I pay it to them to get two star service? I would be a fool to do it again, so I will not. They should be embarrassed by their lack of service. Instead, their potential customers get to read about it here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Memorable Stay!”
Reviews.Author: jw00d
Reviews.Content: This review is a few months late, but this hotel is well-deserving of it. Myself and 5 of my girlfriends stayed at the W New Orleans - French Quarter as we were in New Orleans to celebrate my 25th birthday. I'm a big planner so I had reached out to one of the group coordinators early on to plan activities during our stay. Cassandra Wilson works for the W New Orleans (downtown location), but she was such a great help in planning and accommodating 6 women. Brandon Braud (works at the W New Orleans as well) also helped us with recommendations for restaurants and places to party while down there, and he was awesome! Upon check-in, we were wowed by the ambience of the entire hotel (the courtyard was breathtaking). We stayed in two rooms that were connected to eachother with a cute view of Chartres St. We even had two complimentary bottles of champagne waiting for us in the room to help kick-off the birthday festivities! We didn't dine at the French Quarter location, but we had cocktails at one of the bar's in the W New Orleans location and "indulged" at the Whiskey Blue Lounge one night. The staff was overly accommodating and we felt like celebrities the entire weekend. It was our first time in New Orleans and the staff helped to make it a memorable stay. Also, I found that the hotel was very quiet to be in the French Quarter--that was a plus. I will be staying at the W New Orleans - French Quarter during my next visit to N'awlins! Thank you Cassandra and Brandon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - would definitly return!!!”
Reviews.Author: traveler46482
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel 3 nights with 2 brothers and their spouses. Loved the hotel, the location and the staff. We tried the restaurant at the W New Orleans, ZOE, and it was excellent. We had a Mega room on the first level right off the court yard right near the pool ( the water was too cold to swim in) and it was beautiful and relaxing. The bar service out there was a night touch. I can not wait to return to New Orleans and this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not sure I'd stay again....”
Reviews.Author: sginmd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for six nights for jazz fest in April. The W is in a great location in the quarter. The room was clean and somewhat spacious. The bathroom had limited counter space. Although the room was nice, there was no dresser or space to put all our clothes. There is not a typical W bar as most other W's have. There is a restaurant attached to the hotel - not sure if there is a bar there. We booked this with Starwood points. I would not stay here for the regular rate that the W Frech Quarter advertises. All in all, its a nice W but doesn't have the feel of other W's we've stayed in...and quite frankly I don't think its worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favor and don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: irishupfl
Reviews.Content: While on the surface this hotel looks nice, but the second you walk into the room you will realize this property is not up to W standards. Our room, 309 had a musty, mold smell and the air felt moist. Clearly this room had issues and should not have been used by guests. The guest bar refrigerator didn't work, food was half opened and left for new guests to find. The service was poor and when I needed a dress pressed they said, "we think we can send to the Ritz Carlton to have it done." Are you kidding me? The FQ location is convenient but I wish I had stayed at the W just a half mile away. I will never stay here again, and you should save yourself the hassle and $50 bucks a night and stay at the other W.

Reviews.Title: “i love the w's... but not this one”
Reviews.Author: wickedced
Reviews.Content: "W" usually stands for WOW... but in the French Quarter - it stands for "WTF." This is by far the smallest W in the world and you would think that intimate feel would mean a greater sense of personal service and attention given the W brand standards. You would be wrong. Yes, the Whatever/Whenever phone was operating and we got good service there, but other than that - it was like a service ghost town. I'm an SPG Platinum and have stayed in over 15 W hotels. This one competes with the W Silicon Valley for the bottom of the barrell. Also, the room furnishings are all beat to hell. We had room 220 - and, while it was nice to have a balcony - there wasn't a piece of furniture that was not very noticably nicked up or peeling. Yes, the FQ location is good - but do yourself a favor - walk the extra 5 blocks to the W New Orleans that sites just outside the Quarter. It's spot on the W standard. You will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations - Best spot in the French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: Kezmo7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived in New Orleans for our 1-year anniversary. I had been multiple times but this was the first visit here for my wife. From start to finish, the staff at the hotel went out of their way to make our stay memorable...fantastic room in the Carriage House, cake delivery to our room on the day of our anniversary, and always offering to make our stay more enjoyable. Volker, Kaitlin and the entire team need to be commended. We will absolutely be back, and suggest anyone looking for a romantic getaway, party with a bunch of friends or just a weekend visit should consider this property.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great modern version of a New Orleans courtyard style hotel.”
Reviews.Author: udora
Reviews.Content: We loved the room- comfy and looked out over the upper courtyard. We had all the luxuries we could want. The Courtyard was amazing- half Southbeach and half New Orleans traditional. The staff was friendly and accomodating. We loved the location in the French Quarter and we wished we had eaten at Bacco restaurant in the hotel but we were only there two nights!

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: LongTravelers
Reviews.Content: We travelled with 2 other couples and all had a great time. This hotel was perfect! The courtyard was a great place to hangout or meet before dinner. The staff could not have been nicer or more helpful from check-in to check-out. The location is perfect and puts you in the middle of everything (great places to eat and shop and fun bars to listen to music)! I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Hip...but Ultimately a Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: OnTheSquare77
Reviews.Content: W French Quarter has a very convenient location on Chartres Street. Close to the action, but fortunately not on Bourbon Street. Rooms are large, but not particularly luxurious. For example, spacious bath has a large shower, but no tub, even though there was clearly adequate room. Bedroom has King bed, but miniscule desk and no sitting area. There is room for either the bigger desk or a sitting area. Unless you enjoy waking up every half hour during the night, don't opt for a street facing room. The most important fact to know is that you MUST GET A ROOM FACING THE COURTYARD. The windows at the W French Quarter are terrible. The noise level in the room is almost identical to that found on the street. THIS HOTEL MUST UPGRADE THE STREET SIDE WINDOWS TO KEEP OUT THE SOUND OF LATE NIGHT BOURBON STREET, EARLY MORNING TRASH TRUCKS AND STREET SWEEPERS. The W French Quarter's vibe is, alas, only skin deep. The Hotel lacks any real personality or special qualities. It is only a "Hip Holiday Inn." Much could have been done, but it is selling itself on a good location and a brand built on the performance of other properties. One highlight is the Bacco restaurant, which is part of the hotel. A nice bar, though awfully small. A very nice restaurant...one of Ralph Brennan's best. I would only opt for this property if I got a deal. Paying over $150/night here is paying for services not received.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: shoutlouder
Reviews.Content: The location of the W French Quarter really can't be beat. It is just two blocks from Bourbon Street, and right across the street from some great coffee shops and the legendary Laura's Candies. It would be difficult to find a more perfect spot to stay in, especially since it was our first time to the city. The young staff is super friendly and really were trained right. They all went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable, and even when we had an issue with the Acura service, they were quick to remedy it. (By the way, they provide free Acura service within a 1 mile radius. Not very helpful when 1 mile is walkable, but in certain cases it's a nice option) We were always met with a smile and pleasant attitude from everyone. It should be noted that this is not the typical W hotel you may have stayed at in other big cities. It's trendy but VERY small and not very well laid out. The welcome desk is a tiny little area in the front of the hotel on Chartres. It is your check-in/consierge/computer station in one. It's a bit of an odd cramped setup, but really pretty inside. The elevators to the rooms are across the driveway. Also note: the walls in the rooms are PAPER THIN. It sure is noisy in there! Bring earplugs if you're a light sleeper, and I would recommend requesting a courtyard view room instead of a street view like we had. Lots of noise in the morning and at night from outside. The rooms were nice though with comfy beds and large bathrooms. They have a beautiful courtyard with a nice (but very tiny) pool. On the weekends we enjoyed poolside service from servers in their Bacco restaurant, however we did not see anybody serving outside on the weekdays. I think it would have been helpful if they had a small bar outside in the courtyard where you can grab a drink without having to exit and go into the restaurant. All in all we really enjoyed our stay here. The perfect location and friendly staff more than made up for any annoyances we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff did their best, old hotel needs internal upgrading”
Reviews.Author: Kerry1G
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent in center of French Quarter with Bourbon Street just a short walk and close proximity to the riverfront area. Bed was very comfortable and room was quiet. The courtyard area looked quite appealing but weather was too cold to use it when we were there in early March. Small pool with very noisy air conditioning unit behind the wall. Despite getting an automatic SPG card upgrade, unfortunately the hotel was not up to the standard we would usually expect from a W hotel. Staff agreed with us that it was overdue for a refit - several areas like the bathrooms were looking quite worn - basin leaked, shower recess/screen was looking quite tired, chair in room was frayed. Our room was quite small and was due repainting - very odd bathroom layout, a long dark charcoal-grey tiled, narrow corridor with the shower at the end (no bath) and one small s/s basin on a tiny stand with no room for our toiletries bags, with another separate dresser and mirror nearer the door. We were disappointed that there were no coffee/tea facilities in room - coffee was apparently available in the tiny hotel foyer - we tried a couple of times but the urn container was empty by 10.30am. Hotel had free internet wi-fi in the tiny foyer area but it got really crowded and noisy at times with people checking in and out - it would be preferable to have free internet in rooms, or another quieter room dedicated to use as a business/internet access area.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in French Quarter.”
Reviews.Author: minsam
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this property for three nights and really enjoyed ourselves. I have stayed at other W properties and must say that this property has a distinctively different feel than other Ws, including the W on Poydras street in New Orleans. This is not meant as a bad comment, just an observation, but hey, you're in New Orleans! We had one of the upper floor rooms in the Carriage house that had both front and back balconies which we utilized fully. The room, as well as its bathroom and changing area were spacious. Noise levels were very acceptable, and we enjoyed the pool. It is located in the thick of things in the French Quarter so I believe that is all that needs to be said about that. The check in and maid service staff were friendly, helpful and attentive. I would stay here again. I would recommend this property without reservation to friends looking for a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: drivemecrazy
Reviews.Content: sounds like faint praise, but this is a mixed review. Not sure you can beta the location. I traveled with a friend, and she & I were given a nice, large comfortable room overlooking the courtyard when we expressed a bit of concern about noise. The location is great - with wonderful restaurants within a block or 2. There were all the things you need - hair dryer, soaps, a mini-fridge, nice tv, wifi. However, although the staff was always friendly and helpful, the desk person/concierge was just a kid who really seemed ill-equipped to give sophisticated suggestions on restaurant choices. And although they assured us (as 2 women alone) that the elevators up to the rooms are locked and require a room key to get access to our floor, we came and went 3 times without it being locked, and - worst of all - we were awakened at about 2 AM by someone trying to get into our room! Thank heavens my friend had flipped over the added bolt. So, in conclusion - I'd probably stay here agine, but I'd be careful about the lock and make sure I had better references for restaurant and activities advice.

Reviews.Title: “wow, an excellent find”
Reviews.Author: enjoythenow
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a lovely courtyard to relax in after your day in the French Quarter before you head out to explore the night life. The hotel is blocks from Jackson Square and a block from the antiques stores on Royal Street so you can conveniently walk everywhere but just far enough off the main path to ensure a quiet street with no unwanted, over partying groups stumbling around after a night on Bourbon Street. The rooms were lovely. The beds were incredibly comfortable. The bathroom with the Bliss spa products was luxurious. Incredible water pressure for your shower! Helpful friendly staff throughout the hotel. An excellent Brennen's restaurant on site. As well as being just a block and a half from the original Brennan's restaurant where you can enjoy a delicious New Orleans breakfast. All in all a fun yet relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with pets!”
Reviews.Author: SierraStar
Reviews.Content: I usually stay over at Harrah's because I get comped rooms, but since I was going to bring my cat with me, I stayed at the W over Christmas '09. This hotel is extremely trendy, so much so that the week-end we were there, Lady Gaga & her dancers stayed there. After being out late on B. Street, I never knew what to expect when I walked into the lobby & often wondered if there would be a bigger freak show going on in there than out in the FQ. If not for the fact I could bring my cat, this hotel would not be on the top of my list because I just didn't like how hard it seemed to try to be trendy & over the top. Playing "Rudolph" on the white curtains in the lobby? Okaaayy, not cool, just stupid. The doors that magically open by themselves...cheesy. The room was very small for two adults & one large cat, luckily the Plantation Shutters opened completely & my cat hung out on the window sill most of the trip. BUT, this was not the smallest room I've stayed in, that dubious distiction goes to the Sheraton. We did have to call to have our shower fixed & they responded very quickly. The hot water valve in our shower was broken, it took the guy a few tries to get it right, but he eventually did. All in all, I think if you can't find a room someplace else, then it's a good choice because even though it's small & too trendy for it's own good, the hotel is fine. There are no huge issues with it being dirty, or filled with bugs, it's just a hotel that's trying to be more than it is.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL STAY EVER”
Reviews.Author: Chitamani
Reviews.Content: This hotel was horrible. The mold smell hits you in the face as you enter the rooms. The duvet cover on the bed had stains of every kind on it and looked as if it had never been washed since the place opened. The T.V. didn't work. There were no hairdryers in the rooms. The rooms were dirty and noisy. The furniture had stains as if someone spilled drinks and then just left it. I think the worst of all was the indifference of the staff. They could care less. We could not even get coffee sent to the room. When we called the "room service" line on the phone I was told "not to call that line it was the line to the kitchen". The manager could not be found. This might explain the reason the staff is so terrible. Do not stay at the W in the French Quarter. Thank You for reading this.

Reviews.Title: “A terribly over-rated hotel with poor service”
Reviews.Author: vrtyreng33
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W French Quarter for a week in March while attending a business meeting/conference. I read some descriptions (not traveler reviews) which made the hotel sound very nice, elegant, in a good location, with great service. I was very disappointed. My room was small, poorly maintained, poorly furnished. Maid service didn't come every day. Room is loud due to street noise. The hotel advertises this "whatever whenever" service that you can call 24/7 for anything you want. I called it 4 times, and they didn't even answer the phone 3 of the 4 times. They say they have a fitness center, but they don't- it is at the other W hotel about a mile or so away and so you have to go there to use the gym (and over there the gym is small with very few machines). They say they have a heated pool, but it is not heated- it is freezing, not swimmable. The front desk staff is not very knowledgeable about anything, I stopped asking them questions after awhile. There was a problem with my room charges and the front desk attendant said they would fix it and let me know- they didn't fix and didn't call me. The Bacco restaurant and bar were very good. Overall though, the hotel itself was a huge disappointment and not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: dawoz
Reviews.Content: Location, location location! Located in the 300 block of Chartres, you are really in the heart of the French Quarter. A 2 minute walk to Bourbon Street, it is by FAR the best New Orleans location for any of the Starwood Properties. I have stayed here 4-5 times in the past 3 years. The rooms are on the smaller side of any "W" I have ever stayed in. Although the location is not as good, the "W" on Poydras has much nicer rooms. Not only are the rooms on the small side, the walls tend to be a bit thin.... and several rooms I have stayed in are close to a rather noisy elevator. The staff is hit or miss. Two years ago, I needed to send something via fed ex. Despite assurances it would go out that day, the front desk didn't get my package to fed ex for two days... resulting in stress and a big headache for me. As a Starwood Platinum, I have been told I've been upgraded, but never to a suite. In fact, I don't know if the hotel even has suites. If your a Starwood Junkie like me, I would book the W French Quarter if you can get a good rate. If not, the Sheraton on Canal has nicer rooms, is usually cheaper.. but the location is not as desirable. The Weston is also a nice choice too... but again, nowhere near as great of a location as the W French Quarter!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobertBon
Reviews.Content: Went for a company retreat- very posh and well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Water Pressure”
Reviews.Author: mardigrass
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and situated in a trendy side of town. The rooms are very nice and spacious but the water pressure in the shower was terrible. The flow rate was comparable to that which can be achieved with a straw. Needless to say it took a very long time to take a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, nice, overall pretty good”
Reviews.Author: gotigersgo1
Reviews.Content: My family - parents, sister, grandmother, aunt and cousin - traveled to New Orleans during the week between Christmas and New Years 2009. During the first part of our week we stayed at the W French Quarter. The location was perfect. A short walk to Bourbon, right in the French Quarter, right off Canal. The Garden District and Magazine Street are all walkable. The rooms were nice - a little dark, as all W's are. The inroom ipod player, and all the other W amenities (CDs, robes, etc.) were nice. The bathroom was large, clean, and well -stocked. The beds were comfortable. The rooms were right on the street, and it was loud at night, which is one of my only complaints. The service was a little slow and lacking, but it didn't really create any problems for us. It would have been nice to have a breakfast restaurant there. I would recommend this hotel for young travelers - groups of friends and couples. Also, when it's warm, i imagine the pool in the lobby courtyard is really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff had trouble getting their act together and room was small but ok.”
Reviews.Author: kshudsgold
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? First, my husband was mugged and beaten up in the French Quarter. So you really have to be careful in this town - even in the "safe" areas. The hospital staff sent him bleeding up to his room. I'm totally baffled why they didn't call for medical help when he came into the registration area bleeding and confused. After taking a taxi to the ER and getting him stitched up, we returned to the hotel. We were told by the hospital to get Tylenol, but didn't have any on hand. I figured the hotel would have some that we could buy, but alas, no. They suggested we go to Walgreens which should open in a couple of hours. Suffice it to say, they sent us back to our room with no pain meds. But, let's go beyond that for a moment. The Pringles can was already opened when we got there. (On a positive note, I let the hotel know staff know and they gave us a free can.) The sink smelled funny, and we never really figured out why. The room was very small and had a pole in the middle of the room. The sheets didn't fit the bed well, so the bottom sheet kept coming off while we were sleeping and so we had to deal with the exposed mattress. The day after he was mugged, my husband needed to rest and so we asked the housekeeper to come back later in the afternoon. I called the hotel staff at 2PM and let them know we'd be gone for several hours and could they clean up the room while we were away. When we got back, they hadn't cleaned the room. We were told to call when we left again for dinner, but when we did we were told the housekeepers had left for the day. Somehow they did, however, manage to clean up the room while we were gone. There were some good points - nice soaps, modern and trendy furnishings, good location (if you want to be in the FQ).

Reviews.Title: “A nice gettaway”
Reviews.Author: DirkDoogler
Reviews.Content: I had to go to New Orleans for just a day for work. My wife and I did npot celebrate our anniversary last September, so I asked her to come along and we would make an evening of it. After a stop off at my New Orleans office I rang the W in the French Quarter. From the people on the phone, to the valet, to the housekeeping crew; everyone was so friendly and genuine in their friendliness. Between that and the location, the evening was wonderful. We were sad to leave for home the next morning, but I will stay there any time I return to NOLA (space permitting of course).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: ladyess
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful property. The staff was helpful in making recommendations for dining and directions. Our room was clean, chic, comfortable. The pool area was relaxing. Overall a great value for this city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice on the surface, but needs some work”
Reviews.Author: Leslie K
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W French Quarter for two nights in January. The hotel is polished on the surface, but is undoubtedly due for a remodel. You can tell that the rooms are getting to be quite worn. It's just the little things -- like missing sections of baseboard on the floor, bad paint jobs, a cracked tile or two and missing buttons on the duvet. It just doesn't look like the quality hotel it's supposed to be. The director of engineering for the W - FQ and the W - NO told us that a remodel will be happening in 2010. Glad to hear it. I had an outer room with two windows -- so like many of the reviews state here, it was LOUD. The sound of the cars and trucks was more like crossing the street vs. being four floors up. They also have a recycling truck or something that comes to collect the glass at about 1am. Lovely. Luckily, I am a hard sleeper and the noise didn't affect me in the evenings. If you are a light sleeper, request a courtyard room. I did like that the windows opened; that was a nice old New Orleans essence that was appreciated. The amenities at the hotel were nice - very comfortable beds, rides available in the hotel's Acura, extremely close to Jackson Square and other destinations in the French Quarter. I had a very large bathroom and plenty of room to store my belongings. Would stay here again with a courtyard room.

Reviews.Title: “W French Quarter- Don't Stay here if you plan on Sleeping!!”
Reviews.Author: lbj918
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the W French Quarter for the second time this past weekend, for 4 nights. It's in a great location, and has some nice amenities like the courtyard and whatever/whenever service. However, the inability to sleep at night and lack of customer service regarding this put a bit of a damper on our experience there. The first night, Christmas Eve, we had a king room on the street side. It was a quiet night in New Orleans, but we would wake up literally every time someone walked by. We asked the next morning to move to a room on the courtyard side which they accommodated. Our new room seemed fine at first, until the middle of the night when the people next to us got in from a night out. Our room had an adjoining door, and it literally felt like they were right there in the room with us. They were slamming the doors and loud all night. We asked reception to move in the morning, but they did not have any available rooms. They told us those people were moving out and new people were moving in, so we were hopeful these new people would be on the quieter side. We couldn't of been more wrong. The new people had these loud Southern voices and were partying and singing the entire night. It was supposed to be a non-smoking floor, but these people were smoking and we had to sleep with pillows over our heads. We called security and they offered to put us up at the sister W, at our additional expense. We decided just to stick it out. We asked in the morning to switch rooms for our final night. They agreed and said to pack up our stuff in the room and they would move it while we were out for the day. When we returned at night, our stuff had not been moved. The girl who helped us in the morning had left and did not put a note on our account. The new guy there said he couldn't do anything for us and they were completely full for the night and could not move us. The loud people kept us up again for our last night. Overall, if you are here to party and don't care much about sleeping, this may be a good place to stay. It's also nice to relax in the courtyard if the weather is nice. But, I do not recommend and would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - Depending On Room”
Reviews.Author: brand_trvlr
Reviews.Content: Other reviewers have mentioned this, but this hotel can go from aWful to Wonderful VERY quickly depending on the room you're in (and vice versa of course). Checked in late Friday evening as a Starwood Platinum member, and the only room they had was a handicap room facing the street. While the hotel common areas are beautiful, the room was noisy, not well equipped, and shower didn't work (room 424). The next morning we asked to get a new room and given the Platinum status they upgraded us to the suite in the Carriage House (straight back from the entrance by the pool) which was AMAZING. Huge room, wonderfully furnished, and with a private patio and large jacuzi (I mean a real jacuzi that could seat six people, not a jacuzi tub). It's amazing how this changed our entire experience, but it's a shame the hotel is in such a great location in the French Quarter because it wouldn't have been so bad just to stay in the hotel all day. In all, this hotel can be great but just be forewarned that the experience can be vastly different depending on the room you get - not just the difference of an upgrade, but rather the difference between a BAD experience and a good or GREAT one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice details both decor and amenities”
Reviews.Author: destinationwedphotog
Reviews.Content: Every aspect of the W Hotel was just about flawless. Upon arrival the reception & valet staff were friendly, and it seemed natural and real, as opposed to them just doing their job. The reception area is small, well-decorated and serves its purpose well. We had a large room on the second floor which had a private patio set off the back, overlooking the French Quarter.
