The room included a large flat screen tv, modern decor, a well-stocked snack bar, and a gumball machine. The bathroom was clean and stocked with Bliss products. There was a public courtyard area within the hotel grounds, which was a great spot to relax for a few moments, though I probably wouldn't hang out there for too long. On the downside, the complimentary car service was unavailable due to the Acura they used was in repair. One night they forgot to take our room service breakfast request, so a call was needed to remind them, and the meals were brought promptly. The following morning, breakfast came without a reminder.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: msfrancine
Reviews.Content: Supposed to have stayed 2 nights. Stayed one night. Shower didn't work, they called us at 11 PM to see if we wanted it fixed there and then, (we were asleep). Three weeks later, and I am still fighting to get a partial refund for the night we didn't stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel with Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: mickshrimpton
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a four day stay at the W French Quarter and had a wonderful stay. The hotel is in a quiet section of the French Quarter (earlier reviews seem to suggest a lot of noise and that it's right on Bourbon Street). The staff were all extremely pleasant and helpful. The courtyard area is fantastic for relaxing, day or night. My room, while not large or fancy was comfortable and clean with a nice flatscreen, ample tiled bathroom with large walk-in shower and nice bedding. The room had one very small window but I didn't really care. Had this been a pleasure trip, I would have no negative comments at all. Since I was here for a conference, my only comments are that this hotel is a much longer walk to the convention center than I was initially led to believe when I made the reservation. Also, no free wifi and a $6.95 charge for in-room internet. Also, the elevators were the slowest I've ever been on which was frustrating at times when I was trying to get to the meetings. There is some interesting aroma-therapy going on here as well. I didn't mind it but it was kind of funny that the place smelled like tropical scents the whole time. But all and all, a great stay where the staff goes above and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: crazycajunmedic
Reviews.Content: I read about this hotel on Trip Advisor, and was not surprised by the small rooms out there. However, the Whatever/Whenever service this hotel offered more than made up for it. The entire staff was amazing, but Malik and Leanne were completely awesome. They helped with anything that was needed. When we walked into our room, there were flower pettles and a bottle of champaigne waiting for us. We were given a tour of the room, and saw the amazing view of the courtyard - which, by the way, is the perfect place to hang out after a long day of sightseeing or drinking. The rooms were well decorated, and everything was nice, esp. the bed! The hotel is located literally in the middle of everything. We were able to walk to the Aquarium, Cafe du Monde, Bourbon Street, and everything else we wanted to visit, except the zoo, but we drove there after we checked out. All in all, this was a great hotel and worth the price. We were offered a stay at the casino, but might have to convience them to stay at the W!

Reviews.Title: “Can be Wonderful - if you get a good room”
Reviews.Author: 6starfan
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel twice now and can definitely say the experience can be wonderful or miserable depending on what kind of room you get. Firstly, this is an old boutique hotel with mostly good rooms and some bad rooms. Unless you are planning on partying the entire night DO NOT get a room that faces the street! The nighttime noise is horrible and starts with the screaming, yelling and merriment of the French Quarter party patrons. This is followed by the roaring of garbage trucks, beeping of delivery trucks backing up, horns honking etc. Secondly, do not get a room next to the elevator, the mechanical noise, while not as bad as the street facing room, is still substantial and in the morning hours, it moves non-stop so don't plan on getting any sleep. Now for some good news: We have stayed in a Wonderful room facing the courtyard and it was delightful. Quiet, spacious and extremely enjoyable. The service and support staff are fantastic. This is about the best location in the French Quarter, close to Jackson Square, Canal Street and Bourbon Street. You can walk to everything and can reach the streetcars easily for public transportation

Reviews.Title: “"W" also stands for Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: Nonnie2564
Reviews.Content: I had a truly remarkable stay at the "W" in the French Quarter on Chartres. The hotel stands alone in terms of design/decor in that it is eclectic in style but also warm and inviting. The rooms are very comfortable and ample in terms of space. Also, the rooms are very quiet (in terms of outside noise) to be in such a vibrant section of the Quarter. Everyone on staff was extremely accommodating and helpful. I will definitely stay there on my next journey to New Orleans. Wouldn't look anywhere else. Try out the courtyard for bloody mary's or mojitos! Perrrfect.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and Worn, But Friendly Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HealthITConslt
Reviews.Content: I will start off with full disclosure - I booked this room using *wood points about 4 months in advance. We were coming to NOLA for VoodooFest and wanted to stay somewhere in the French Quarter to be close to the Halloween action. For 30,000 points for 3 nights, it was a bargain. However, then there was an additional $90 in valet parking fees, which was somewhat steep. I am Platinum with *wood and realized that the W hotels operate on a different upgrade system than the rest of the company. When checking in, we were given a Superior room on the 3rd floor. When we walked in, the room smelled a bit off, but we couldn't place it. The room was small, and overlooked a rooftop. Not exactly a scenic view. There was also a nice family of spiders inhabiting the windowsill on the room side. We brushed them off, and decided it wasn't a big deal. Upon further inspection, I discovered that not only did we have an ajoining room, we had the middle room of 3 adjoining rooms. I have a note in my *wood profile that says no adjoining rooms due to an unfortunate incident at the Westin City Center, D.C. However, the hotel was booked, and there was no other room I could have moved to. The walls are extremely thin. We heard the good, bad, and ugly each night at the hotel. People let doors slam all night long, and I was treated to 3 horrible nights of sleep. However, it was also Halloween weekend so I was willing to let it slide a bit. Our neighbors liked to listen to music at night/early AM and we could not only hear the notes, we could hear every, single word. There was a lot of slamming noises, etc. so I finally took a Benadryl and put in ear plugs to sleep. Not what I would expect to need to do at a hotel. I've been in my share of noisy hotels, but never to this level. The one redeeming quality of the W is the valet staff. All of the guys were extremely friendly and helpful. The one downside was the fact that upon arrival, we were told that there would be a shuttle to the City Park for $4 a person. The next morning when we tried to catch this shuttle, we were informed the guy that runs it wasn't at work yet. Later that day, we were told there was no shuttle, so we'd have to take the $20 cab ride. Fine, but just be up front about it. All in all, I would not stay here again. As a side note, on the final day in the room, I discovered mold growing in the carpet under the desk in the corner. This would explain all the itching and congestion I had all weekend, as I'm pretty seriously allergic to mold. I have a decent tolerance for hotels, but uncleanliness isn't forgiveable. The location of the hotel is fantastic, but the W on Poydras isn't much further and from the looks of it, appeared to be better kept.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Digs”
Reviews.Author: Beaurex212
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property, centrally located in French Quarter. Pool scene is quite nice - good place to relax with a drink after a long day of sightseeing. Room was comfortable - loved the plush bedding.

Reviews.Title: “One of N.O.'s Best”
Reviews.Author: NOLA_YNWA
Reviews.Content: I live in New Orleans, but frequently my wife and I will spend a night in a local hotel as a mini-vacation. I've stayed in many local hotels, but the W French Quarter is absolutely my favorite. The location is superb - right in the middle of the French Quarter, but still in a quiet spot. The rooms are always excellent and so is the staff. The hotel has a beautiful courtyard and pool. The attached restaurant, Bacco, used to be one of the best in town, but unfortunately seems to have gone down in quality recently. No matter, though, the hotel is within walking distance of some of the best food in the world.

Reviews.Title: “One of my Favorite Cities”
Reviews.Author: Cruisin_Diva1981
Reviews.Content: Visited the NOLA this past summer. We had an excellent time. Stayed in the French Quarter at the W hotel and that was beautiful! We also enjoyed one of the best restaurants New Orkeans has to offer, NOLA. The restaurant was excellent! But overall, although we had rain, New Orleans was a really nice town to visit. I would go back and may visit for the 2011 Mardi Gras.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: LittleG1818
Reviews.Content: You know what you're getting when you book at a W Hotel, and this one did not disappoint! Immaculate service, posh rooms, and location-appropriate, yet hip decor. How is it that every employee of the W is not only completely gracious, friendly, and well-mannered, but also good looking? The pool was a little small but who needs to do laps on vacation? The location was perfect - just one block off of Bourbon St., so you are ridiculously close to the action yet don't have to sleep on top of it. A business traveler would probably be better off at the W New Orleans, but for the party group, I would recommend this hotel over any other.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the Fench Quarter”
Reviews.Author: cadence8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights in late June, early July. The room was very nice, overlooked an interior courtyard (which I recommend to avoid street noise, though the pool can be noisy during the day). Flat screen tv, huge bathroom. The service was the typical W "anytime, anything," service, but as hard as the staff tried to help (and they did) it didn't quite make it. Arranged transportation was a surprise when you showed up (though they did help), front desk was a bit clueless at times (though friendly and seemingly tried to help). The location is unbeatable, away from the chaos of Bourbon Street, but close to excellent restaurants. This was my second stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of my greatest New Orleans experiences!”
Reviews.Author: TimeTraveler1970
Reviews.Content: The W French Quarter was such a great experience I can not wait to go back, and is in an excellent location for all of the great times New Orleans has to offer. Everyone went above and beyond to make our short trip a great one, especially the young ladies at the front desk and the valet drivers out front. Usually it is the small things that make the biggest differences. Things ranging from remembering our names, friendly conversation (even though I know they were busy) personally getting me a Diet Coke from their break room to arranging a cab to the airport when we missed our shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the W”
Reviews.Author: travelheart41
Reviews.Content: W is a good location although the kids didn't enjoy walking the French Quarter. Nice perk here is they offer FREE DVD movie library. Check out movies at the desk for FREE, watch in your room on the available player and turn back in the next day or buy the movie from them. Kids loved it, we watched 2 movies, good variety of movies, new and old titles available. Much nicer than paying $13 per movie pay per view. Thanks W! Did not like paying additional $28.00 per day to park- BOO

Reviews.Title: “Never felt more welcomed and taken care of!!!”
Reviews.Author: callie680
Reviews.Content: Whenever I can stay at a W - I do. True to usual form, this one was Wonderful! Its beautiful, charming, and in a perfect location! Bottom line though is the staff is ahhhhmazing! From the valet, to the cleaning ladies, to the people at the front desk. I've never stayed anywhere that even comes close to this level of such genuine, friendly and helpful staff members! Me and my friend were blown away and after every encounter with them found ourselves talking about our great the experience was for 5 min after!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Awesome Staff”
Reviews.Author: luckygirl82
Reviews.Content: This W was great! Just steps from Bourbon Street, perfect location. Staff was very helpful and courteous. Rooms were clean and in W style. Beautiful courtyard. Valet Parking was heaven sent in that crazy city. Park and walk where ever you like.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MrsCongeniality
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay sooo much. We want to say the staff was wonderful...especially the "Wizard" . We give this Hotel an 11 on a 1 - 10 scale.

Reviews.Title: “Sexy Oasis”
Reviews.Author: JeanSju
Reviews.Content: Great staff, super friendly check-in, bell boys who remembered you, clean rooms. great location. Our room opened onto the sundeck and then down the stairs to the pool, lots of beautiful people everywhere. Bacco's Restaurant is excellent, gourmet without the attitude and a wonderful bartender. An oasis in the middle of the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Our best stay in New Orleans; great staff”
Reviews.Author: beluga11
Reviews.Content: This trip was business and leisure. We called while on the way about late check in for our room and the room we booked for an associate. Volker treated us like old friends and handled everything with ease and efficiency. Ryan welcomed us when we pulled in and we instantly felt like we had finally arrived at our home away from home in New Orleans. Look for smiling Jasmine in the morning at the juice bar; she makes the sun shine even when it's raining. Our very relaxing room overlooked the beautiful courtyard; loved the terrace. Really friendly staff always willing to help. Great location for shopping and sighseeing. Try the restaurant downstairs; the lobster ravoli is excellent. This hotel has the best staff in New Orleans. A perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “W...for worse than the other W”
Reviews.Author: dksa9
Reviews.Content: Where shall I start...if you want to stay at a W thinking it's gonna be like all the others, think again. This hotel is a simple boutique hotel...that's it. It's not your typical cool W hotel. The rooms are simple and small as well as the pool. When we went, it was family central. The pool area was constantly unkempt...like they didn't give a damn about tha area. The valet costs $34 a night...find a meter or parking lot and walk. I was HUGELY disappointed in this property. The outlets did not work in our room, there was no ipod docking station and it was insanely loud with the elavators being close by. They even charge you for the gumballs that are in the gumball machines in each room....crazy. We were given free drink passes beacuse of the mess at check in...however, they failed to let me know that the bar closes at 10pm...REALLY?? 10? in New Orleans...brutal. Anyway...I wouldn't ever stay at this hotel again...if you are looking for somewhere cool and hip to stay, stay far far away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Always the best service!”
Reviews.Author: Cindyk5555
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel and we found that from the moment we got out of our cab the service and attitude were so welcoming. Our front desk person, Brandi, was a delight. Funny and sweet. Everyone made it a point to make sure we had what we needed. is it even necessary to say that the rooms and the BEDS are the best. The W hotels rock!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service in an Intimate Setting”
Reviews.Author: AAK335
Reviews.Content: The W New Orleans-French Quarter offers a small boutique hotel, with great service. It is a small site, with little added features ( no gym or hot tub for all rooms), but what it does has makes up for it. In the heart of the arts district and French Quarter, the richness of New Orleans finest district is at your finger tips. Staff at W New Orleans-French Quarter is outstanding, meeting all your needs in the blink of an eye, while doing it with a smile. Also, the restaurant on site, Bacco, is amazing. Their signature dish, the Lobster Ravioli, makes your mouth water. And, once again, service was superb! The outside courtyard is perfect for lounging, having a drink poolside, or just taking a breather before hitting the New Orleans nightlife. Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: rosevilleCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time at your lovely hotel. The front desk was so--so helpful. We needed our boys to be on the same floor as we were, and she quickly upgraded us to a better floor with the rooms directly across from each other. I had a fabulous birthday dinner at Baccos Restaurant. The service was exemplary. After dinner our oldest son, my husband and I enjoyed a cocktail in the cabanas by the pool while our other two sons swam in the beautiful pool. The outside courtyard was amazing. Oh, and the rooms, they were amazing. The best!!! We can't wait to come back. You made our first trip to New Orleans memorable. Thank you again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hosts....uncomfortable, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: ggirlAlabama
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the W was so sweet and accommodating! They could not have been better to us! We were on our honeymoon, so we loved being accommodated and taken care of. The beds were terribly uncomfortable! My husband and my backs were killing us by the end of our weeks stay. Our sheets were not changed during the entire week even though we requested it. The hot water in our shower took approximately 8-10 minutes to heat up. That was annoying. The best part of our stay was definitely the people at the hotel! They would be my only reason for reccommending the W New Orleans - French Quarter!

Reviews.Title: “It would have been better without the elevator noise in the room”
Reviews.Author: drc225
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights whilst attending a conference in mid July. Hotel is a reasonable walk (1.25 miles - but seems longer in the heat) to the convention center but a great location for the nightlife. Paid Â£100 (~$165) per night via hotels.com which seemed like a deal. Quite impressed - my memories of the W hotel NY (?) were not favorable as I recall not having enough room to swing a cat. Largish, spacious room. Nice bathroon, comfortable beds, well stocked and expensive mini-bar but no coffee. Internet was an expensive ~$15 per 24 hours and I didn't use it as was fully connected at the conference. No ability to sign up via a roaming account as far as I could tell. Lovely courtyard, tiny pool. No gym - but you have use of the gym in the other W hotel about 10 mins walk away. Nice gym there, plenty of kit (3 X-trainers, four joggers, bikes and weight type kit) all good and well maintained. One of the nicer gyms I've seen recently. .Just ask reception at the other hotel for a key â€“ itâ€™s a pain if there is a check-out line. The only problem was my room which had this 'noise'. At first thought it was the aircon but have concluded it was the elevator. The evelator was at least a corridor away but, clearly, somehow connected through the aircon ducting. It was a very annoying, virbating, random (or presumably when people use the elevator in certain conditions) loud hum which woke me up constantly. I did briefly discuss moving room with the front desk but, on the basis the hotel was very busy and moving was a hassle and I'd probably end up with a crap room somewhere, I decided against it. Reception didn't seem surprised when I mentioned the noise and I wondered if it was a 'known issue' with the room. Definitely detracted from the experience. The room issue is the only detraction and I'd be really happy to return to the hotel again in a different room. When I checked out by phone and reception asked if â€˜everything was OKâ€™, I mentioned the noise and they cancelled my bar bill (a whole $6 â€“ Iâ€™d had a beer whilst reading in the courtyard). Nice gesture. Because of this gesture and because my colleague didn't have room issues, I'm giving it the 4 stars it deserves but, based on my experience alone, it would be less than that.

Reviews.Title: “Wow- What a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: washednready
Reviews.Content: There were six in our group- 3 adults and 3 high-schoolers. We were in New Orleans with 37,000 other youth as part of a national church youth gathering. We were greeted warmly by the valets, who immediately helped us get our luggage out of the van while I went to check in. The desk staff was pleasant and always helpful. Check-in was a breeze. Our rooms were perfect! Quaint, New Orleans charm. Nice amenities- Flat screen t.v., dvd player in the room, safe in the room. The bathroom had a beautiful walk-in shower. The outdoor courtyard was AMAZING at night! Gas-lit lamps, a "fire fountain," small cabana-like spaces for cozy gatherings. The pool, although small, was a nice ending to a hot day. Except for the phenomenal staff, and the hotel's whimsy, the best thing about the W- French Quarter is its location!! It is located in the heart of the French Quarter, only a couple of blocks from Bourbon St., Jackson Square, and N. Peters. The Vieux Carre is at your doorstep. The only major downside to the hotel was the cost of parking- $44 a night! That was a little steep just to park the car. Also, wireless internet was $15 a night, which is a little more expensive than other hotels. Overall, I would highly recommend the W- French Quarter for anyone wanting a great hotel, wonderful staff and excellent location!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: dive448
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to make a long weekend getaway to NO from Dallas. After our one night stay at the Omni French Quarter (no hot water, small room but great location) we moved the 2 blocks to the W. What a great move! Everyone on the staff was genuinely super friendly. I travel for business over 200 days a year and I can honestly say I have never been so impressed with hotel staff and I mean everyone. The location in the French Quarter is about as good as it gets. Close to everything - Bourbon Street, the Casinos, and the River. The room was large and very nicely appointed. Certainly up to W standards at the high end. Our room had a nice balcony although not much of a view and had a large walk-in shower. Our only complaint was the walls were a little thin and we could hear noise in the hall and next door. We will certainly stay there every time we go to NO French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Simplicty at its best”
Reviews.Author: FunLover20
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I were going to New Orleans on a girls weekend. We were kinda iffy on staying here but loved it from the moment we got there. We are W goers and liked the idea of a more boutique setting. From the guys at the "wheels" stand to the ladies at the desk..even the housekeeping staff in the halls were accomodating. The rooms were very small , but the view of the courtyard was amazing. We loved haning in the cabannas and ordering drinks. The pool is really small, and was quite an attraction. They should definately get more seating, but other than that it was fantastic. This hotel is in walking range to just about anything. We absolutely loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: LakeCharlesFelix
Reviews.Content: We travel monthly into the Big Easy and stay at the W in the Quarter whenever we are in New Orleans. The staff are friendly and recognize you as repeat customers. They are very accommodating and willing to go the extra step to make your stay memorable. The parking valets are particularly outgoing and fully of suggestions. Make use of the golf cart transportation in the Quarter and the Acura for outside trips.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place. great staff”
Reviews.Author: paulgauge
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the W fq and I have to write to say what a wonderful time we had.And a great deal of credit for that good time is owed to the staff of this charming hotel. We arrived on a very early flight and we were at the hotel by 10am. I asked if they could watch our bags until check in. Well, not only did they have a room they upgraded us! score! The entire staff could not have been more pleasant and professional. A special thanks to Brandi and Mr. Volker who went above and beyond the call of duty. I asked if we could have a late check out Brandi asked what time our flight was and when I told her she gave us the latest check out I ever had. 3 p.m. We were at the airport about to go home when we realized we lost a bag with ID and credit cards. We received a call from Mr. Volker saying he had the bag and was sending it over to the airport in a cab. Just in the nick of time! We were the last ones on the plane! The music in on early but was not excessivly loud. If anything the loop was too short. The same songs keep repeating. Our room faced the street. We heard one truck at about 3am. It lasted 2 minutes and that was that.I fell right back to sleep right away .The W is famous for thier comfy beds. lastly the whole staff could not have been kinder to our 6yr old boy. It was his first time to New Orleans and already wants to go back and not only stay at the W, but stay in the same room. Thank you again.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Service”
Reviews.Author: SMShock
Reviews.Content: W New Orleans - French Quarter is located off Canal St and is a great place to stay if your planning on doing all the touristy things in NOLA. Its an easy walk to Bourbon St. I stayed in a Corner room with a balcony which was nice, except there is a lot of road noise. If you are a light sleeper or plan on going to bed early, you may want to ask for an interior room. The pool was very small, but the service was good. Bathroom is a large empty space but the shower was awesome. TV is not centered to the bed, so you have to lie on your side to watch it. Service was great and catered to all my needs expeditiously. Also received a complimentary bottle of wine and movie rental! Bacco is located right next door, so make sure you eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location. Okay Rooms. Bad Service.”
Reviews.Author: sweetiecakes123
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice. The first time we stayed, we got two rooms. One of the rooms was fabulous. It had extra amenities, a beautiful balcony, and it was very clean. The other room was not very pretty, the description said it had a balcony, but it was a balcony shared with a few other rooms, and it lacked many amenities such as a safe. We called and asked them to bring us a safe and they told us they would bring us one up to our room. Well, they were taking forever so we decided to go out to dinner. We came back and still there was no safe. So we called, asked for the safe again, and then we asked for some extra pillows. We are still waiting on that safe and pillows. So we did complain, and we got a free nights stay. We were in town traveling back from Amelia Island, Florida and we used our free nights stay to stay there again. This time it was okay, but it was nothing special. I'm not sure that I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Cool Patio, Flat Screen TV & That's about it...”
Reviews.Author: LAMOTAS
Reviews.Content: Location is great, 2 Blocks off Burbon Street so the noise is greatly reduced. I've stayed a several W's and like the brand, so I thought we'd give this one a try also. The Hotel is wrapped around a courtyard with a pool. We didn't use the pool, which was kind of small, but spent time in the Courtyard, which has bar service and lounge seating while we were waiting for friends to meet us who were staying at the other W Hotel on Ponydras, and they had to walk into the French Quarter to go out to dinner with us or meet for breakfast. The room had a flat screen, towels were nice and the linens perfect as usual, but the carpets and furnishings were quite worn...had a bit of a convention hotel feel to it...or maybe too many wedding partys? For the "right" price, it's a great location, but for the standard rates

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Rooms need updated / renovation.”
Reviews.Author: buckiz1980
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel cannot be beaten. Within walking distance to everything in or near the French Quarter and the casino, riverwalk. I was upgraded to a room in the "Carriage House" with its own private hot tub, not just a jacuzzi, an 8-person hot tub. Other than this, the room was right on the main courtyard with the loud music as the other reviews discuss, but that did not bug me. Actually, I thought it was a pretty cool setup. My main problem with the place is that the room was very tired and in need of an update. The furniture / walls / carpet all looked like they were 10 years old - used and abused. Not typically what you would expect at a W. Also, I waited at least for 10 minutes for the valet to come around for my car when I arrived, and it wasn't busy. If you're looking for a fantastic location and can get a great rate (like I had), I would definitely stay here again; however, if you're looking for a luxury hotel, look elsewhere. Finally, if a fitness center is important to you, then you might stay at the W - New Orleans. You have access to their fitness center, but this hotel does not have its own gym.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not much else.”
Reviews.Author: PrettyPrankster
Reviews.Content: Check-in and Check-out: Good experiences, however was surprised on being in the "Welcome Room" waiting to ask a question when I saw drink tickets for Bacco (the restaurant next door) handed to a person who had just checked in for the weekend. We were checked in from Wednesday through Sunday yet were not offered the same. Seemed a little random to ration the tickets that way. Boarding passes were printed for us on request. Requested taxi was waiting at the appointed time for departure. But in general, good service. Elevators: Only one was working the entire time we were there. It seemed to generally stick on the third floor and do a false, premature opening of the doors on the ground floor before safely opening. Didn't exactly inspire confidence. Pool area: Seemed nice, but we didn't spend time there. I did note the music which is played in the pool area. I didn't think it loud, but then my room didn't open to the courtyard. I was also there while a Saturday night private party took over the entire pool area (basically, the whole courtyard). Nothing better than being made to feel like an outsider in your own hotel by party guests who didn't pay a dime to be there. I am SO glad I didn't have one of the rooms which has doors or windows opening directly to the pool during that. Talk about a nuisance. Room: We had a standard room. VERY minimal. Very small. No closet. No chest of drawers. Only a wardrobe with hangers and two small drawers on the bottom. It did have an in-room safe, though. That was helpful. The bathroom was a series of design flaws. The door to the bathroom was a hung wooden door with frosted glass on a celing track. No floor track. You had to sort of push the door out and slide it over to avoid whacking the wall. Not exactly a quiet procedure if it's the middle of the night and you are trying to avoid waking someone. And with the frosted glass door, turning on the light at night is bound to wake your roommate. By all that is holy, KEEP THE TOILET SEAT DOWN. There was a teeny, unstable glass shelf that was the only surface large enough to store anything. As it was directly below where towels were hung and right beside the sink, things were constantly getting knocked off the shelf. They always ended up in the toilet until we realized we needed to just always keep it closed. The walls were VERY thin in our room. Window opened to a view of the tops of buildings. Sort of industrial. But then we certainly didn't spend time at the window. The room was definitely the worse for wear. It had seen a couple too many Jazzfests and Mardi Gras. Stained carpet. Cigarette hole in our non-smoking room bedspread. But the walk-in shower was nice. Had hot water all but the last morning. Location: Easy walk to everything in the quarter. Nice amenities: Coffee in the morning in their Welcome Center. Ice water flavored with fresh fruit replaces the coffee later in the day. Grab the Times-Picayune, Wallstreet Journal or USAToday from the shelves across from the elevator in the morning. Local paper even available on weekends. Bottom line: The rooms are run down and need sprucing. Service was adequate. Best reason to stay there is location. But better locations (and nicer rooms) are probably available for less money.

Reviews.Title: “In need of some TLC”
Reviews.Author: BusterBluth
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying I'm not a huge fan of W Hotels in general. A little too dark and trendy for me. That said, I've stayed at W Hotels 10-15 times in the past 5 years. The French Quarter property was among the shabbiest I've seen. It is in need of some upgrades asap. The whole place seemed dirty. There was a huge red stain in the middle of the filthy carpet in our room. The AC in our room was very loud, yet not that effective. The pool and outdoor bar areas were covered with leaves and other debris... not at all inviting. One elevator was out of service and the other sounded like it was about to be as well, moving super slow and making a loud buzzing sound as it struggled past the 5 or 6 floors of the hotel. We won't be back...

Reviews.Title: “Loved the W!”
Reviews.Author: donsyb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night using starpoints. I wish we'd had enough points to stay here for the rets of our trip! Lovely decor, room was really nice with a huge bathroom. Pool area was gorgeous. Found everything in good working order. Service was great. We arrived early as we were transferring from the Holiday Inn Express. They gave us the choice of a very small room available immediately or waiting for a better room. We chose to wait, they stored our bags while we went off to Commanders for lunch. The next day we were not leaving until the evening, and as Gold SPG members they gave us a 4pm check out FOC, which was great. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Chic - our oasis in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Laforda
Reviews.Content: First time in NOLA. Traveling with 2 teens and best friend. I was looking for a hotel that had the traditional architecture and look of the French Quarter combined with the contemporary hip upmarket feel of a boutique hotel. Finally settled on the W, somewhat hesitatingly as I was toying with the Ritz (NOT a great location), Monteleone (nope) and others. We all were soo happy we made the right decision. Location fantastic - Chartres charming little street with great shopping (Hemline - fab boutique). Straight shot to Jackson Square - 3 or 4 mini blocks. I made it a priority to have a peek at some of the other contender hotels and found them to be either funky location (in a bad way) or really dated/rough around the edges. Personally, I would not stay on or near St Charles or out of the Quarter. Ditto Bourbon St, unless people running around with ridiculously strong cocktails and ridiculously impaired minds is your idea of a good time. W was a little haven - understated, hip and quiet. We had a room on the 2nd floor with balcony overlooking Chartres Street. Perfect! Had 2 dbl beds, so good for traveling with teens. Room dark and sleek, but big bathroom with Bliss products, which were pilfered on a daily basis. Kids highly amused at mini bar offerings, including the romance pack of lubricant, condom and breath freshner!!! Balcony w/French doors brought light and gave much needed space to beleagured mother! Best part of the hotel, of course, is the courtyard. Balinese oversized beds with cool tables. Candles. Small pool. Cool music. Video shown against side of hotel depicting various room scenes - guests looking out window - very "Rear Window". Only minor downsides - room service is linked to the Italian restaurant downstairs which doesn't offer a great variety of app/snack items - only really an issue for kidlings, but so much around, really, a non-issue. Also - service not terriffic, but possibly due to full house. Breakfast - go across the street to the Fleur de Lys - amazing and quick food. Pizza place (Rotelos) also across the street and killer calzones. Stanley on the square good for lunch. Take the New Orleans Haunted History tour with Jonathan as your guide. Bottom line - kind of a hybrid with old world accents and contemporary perks. I will definitely come back, but with my husband this time!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful as Usual!”
Reviews.Author: Timmy485
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at this hotel and it was just as good as I remembered it. I didn't have any problems with hot water or pressure. The bathrooms are great as well as the comfy beds. I was approached by the staff many times asking me how my stay was, if I needed anything or to contact them if I needed anything. The only complaint I had the entire time was the hallway smelled a bit musty but it didn't smell like that in my room so it wasn't bad. The courtyard has been changed a bit but its still one of the best places to relax with friends and some drinks. Great happy hour in Bacco with half priced wine and friendly bartenders.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like I was home; I was treated like family as soon as I arrived...”
Reviews.Author: x36hoursx
Reviews.Content: Malik and Alvin were very hospitable, the service was excellent, the staff was friendly and accommodated our every need; they went beyond the call of duty. The room and courtyard were beautiful and very intimate and relaxing. We had a great time, thank you guys!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: 22alon
Reviews.Content: The W French Quarter is the best hotel I have stayed in while in New Orleans. It has a great location, is small enough so each guest matters, has a great outdoor space (courtyard and pool) and the rooms are well appointed and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Worst W ever”
Reviews.Author: chazas
Reviews.Content: This was a dreadful stay at a dreadful hotel. I am generally a Starwood fan, but not in this case. We reserved two suites using Starpoints for a long weekend with friends. Our friends checked into suite 201. It did have a nice balcony overlooking Chartres Street. The closet rod was not attached to the wall, but they were handy and fixed it themselves. (They had a screwdriver with them, go figure!) The door to the minibar cabinet was completely off its hinges, which they politely ignored. There was a TV in the bathroom, for which the remote didn't work. It ultimately was fixed by maintenance - with duct tape. The shower was in a moldy claw-foot tub which was difficult for them to access. That was the good experience. We were originally put into the suite on the opposite side of the second floor. There was a loud courtyard speaker directly outside the bedroom window, so there was no rest possible until night-time when the sound went off. They said they could "turn it down" â€“ but we didn't want to be fighting that battle for 4 days, so we asked to be moved. No other suites were available. They promised to refund us the point difference between a suite and a regular room, which they did after I called to bug them a few days later. They put us on the 5th floor overlooking the courtyard. It was a large room, but most of the space taken up by huge dormers which were useless space. The shutters on the dormers were broken so they didnâ€™t close properly. Neither the floor in the dormers nor the shutters on the windows had been cleaned any time in recent memory. There were huge stains on the carpet. There was a leak around the shower door, so it was moldy and the plaster was falling apart. The paint on the walls generally was dirty and scratched up, so that the drywall showed through in several places. There was a disco right across the courtyard from this room, so it was even noisier than the original room. One of the bedside lamps was completely broken (the bulb socket hanging to the side) - maintenance did fix that. The front desk promised to move us to 204 the next day, a connecting room to our friends' suite, and to refund a night's worth of points for our inconvenience (that credit came through without a hitch). They asked us to leave our bags packed so they could be moved while we were out. We returned around 4:30 p.m. The keys we were given didnâ€™t work. So back downstairs. Ordinarily, that wouldnâ€™t have been a big deal, but only one of two elevators was in service the entire time and the stairway doors were locked from the bottom, so every trip upstairs required a lengthy wait for the elevator. Second time the keys worked. Another elevator wait - and this time our bags weren't in the room. Yet another trip downstairs for my partner. He was told the bags were in the hallway outside the room. Valuables left sitting in the hall, are you kidding? No matter, they weren't there anyway. Where were they? No one knew. After a few minutes of waiting and no news, a curt word to the desk clerk elicited from the duty manager, not a query as to what was wrong and whether she could help, but an admonition not to speak impolitely to her staff. Ultimately the bags were found. My partner had to lug them all up himself, no offer of help. After another wait for the elevator, of course. It was a small room, but the balcony was nice and we could share the sitting area with our friends' suite. And it was not quite as dirty as the room on the 5th floor. The TV didn't work. Maintenance fixed it by fiddling with the nest of wires under the desk and replaced the batteries in the remote. At least two of the outlets in the room (including the outlet by the sink for the hair dryer) didn't work, but we didnâ€™t bother with reporting those. Overnight the room became stifling. The next morning, maintenance told us that was "normal," that the cool air was escaping through the connecting door to the suite (which had been closed during the night and, in any event, did have cool air and working a/c) and (most importantly) that the thermostat had to be set at 40 degrees F to work. We gave up on that as well. The final evening in this room the hot water stopped working as we were trying to get ready for dinner. A call to "whatever, whenever" resulted in enough lukewarm water for a quick shower, though no explanation. On return from our evening out, it was completely off again. A call downstairs produced no results or reply. About an hour later, we called Starwood customer service. They opened a file on our case and called the hotel. All they got was excuses - it is an old hotel, it takes the hot water a while to get there. All transparent fibs, as usually the hot water worked fine, and in any event it was completely back on the next morning. The issues werenâ€™t solely room-related. As I already noted, there was only one working elevator. The (limited) common areas were as dirty and decrepit as the rooms. The linens were stringy and threadbare. Absent a request, housekeeping only left one bar of soap per room, so it had to be moved back and forth between the sink and the shower. A call to room service the first morning for coffee was dismissed with a reply that there was complimentary coffee in the lobby. So we went down â€“ only to find no cups. They scrounged a couple up for us. Several times after that, there were either no cups or the coffee pot was empty. We took to buying coffee across the street. There does not appear to be anyone actually managing this horrible little hotel. Stay far, far away.

Reviews.Title: “Unparalleled service!!”
Reviews.Author: Nolanative
Reviews.Content: I never post about my "in-town" staycation experiences, but the service at W FQ prompted me to comment. I live in New Orleans proper (not far from the French Quarter )and have either stayed, visited, eaten or drank at every hotel in the Quarter and Downtown. My girlfriends (former New Orleanians) came in town for a quick Nola visit and weekend in the Quarter. We stayed at the W French Quarter b/c of Starwood points and the desirable courtyard and pool. I eat at Bacco for lunch pretty often and have always peekend into the fabulous courtyard and commented that I wanted to stay there. ANYWAY, let me just say that I have never had more incredible service in any New Orleans establishment! The guys who are the outdoor attendants--Malik and Ryan--were so friendly, helpful, courteous and constantly making sure we were happy as we lounged outside and snacked and drank. They were completely dedicated to checking in on us...and it didnt stop there. Our courtyard server was so friendly, prompt and efficient. We actually met a couple who lives near me and were also on a staycation and they were commenting about the wonderful service as well. As you can see, I have posted about another TERRIBLE W experience so this has completely revived my love of the W hotel chain! I recommend this quaint, boutique hotel for anyone who likes the atmosphere of W hotels but would enjoy a GREAT courtyard with a tiny, but refreshing pool. You can enjoy drinks and apps from Bacco and people watch. The rooms are nice, clean, well-appointed, but nothing to necessarily comment about...they are not gorgeous by any means, but very "W." The location is also a nice spot in the Quarter. It is in a safe and well-traveled block and is walking distance to anything you would want to do down there. Again, I recommend it most bc of the unreal friendliness of the staff. They will make you feel sad to leave them...they truly became our little friends over the short weekend! **Please note that this is not the main W location on Poydras. I have stayed there a couple of times and am happy to answer any questions about it. **

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Room in the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: 9463chick
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W French Quarter for business recently and it was my first stay at a W. Normally I stay at the Westin or the Sheraton but I thought the W seemed appropriate for New Orleans. The location is great. In the French Quarter but off the main street. The rooms are on the small side. I had a room facing the street and it was very bright and noisy in the morning. No blackout shades. The hotel has no workout room which was disappointing. It was a 7 minute walk to the other W to workout. The bathrooms are quite large but not very clean. Loved the Bliss bathroom products. Beware of unexpected charges to your credit card for mini bar items. I am still disputing items that I never used that keep poppoing up on my bill. All in all a decent stay but not sure I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Mardi Gras in a great location”
Reviews.Author: trip4mari
Reviews.Content: My daughter turned 21 Mardi Gras day so we booked 2 rooms with starpoints for 5 nights each. We were given 2 rooms on the 3rd floor with windows that open to the street. I was pleased with this because in the past I have redeemed a Marriott room with points and felt like I was given the crappiest room in the worst location. This is the 5th stay for me at 5 different W hotels. The rooms are a little small but more than adequate. I did have trouble with hot water like a previous reviewer but I also give them a little lattitude because this is an old building. Bed as usual is wonderful. No fitness facility but you can use the other W's if you like. Room was clean. Had minibar and safe and 2 robes for your use. Had flat screen TV. Noise wasn't too bad especially considering that we were on the street during the weekend before and through Mardi Gras day. Really, I couldn't imagine anyone expecting no noise in this party town. Location is fabulous-- 2 blocks or so to Bourbon street and 2 or so blocks to Canal where the parades are. Being not directly on the busy streets is a plus because you do not have to fight to get into your hotel. Room service only till 9pm was a little dissapointing considering this is a 24hr party town. Bacco restaurant is on the property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - wish I would have stayed here from the get go ...”
Reviews.Author: hilley
Reviews.Content: I originally stayed at IH house ... it totally sucked. I do not even know how they call that place a boutique hotel. I saw a friend while in NOLA and he was staying at WGQ so I switched to that hotel. It made the rest of my trip so much better. Great location and staff ... had the house car that was available ... loved every minute of my stay. Side Note: Avoid the other W in NOLA ... I had another buddy choose that one based upon price and he told me that it completely sucked.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but...”
Reviews.Author: trvllisted
Reviews.Content: The location of the W French Quarter is perfect, close enough to where ever you are headed in NOLA. The room was fine, actually larger than I had expected, we had a street view (Chartres). Friday and Saturday night there was noise from the street revelers/traffic, but that was to be expected. Our first main issue was the hot water, or lack there of. In our five day stay, I took one hot shower. Friday and Saturday was warm, Sunday was the hot shower, likely because we stopped back to the hotel directly after super bowl to change for dinner and everyone was already out on the town. Monday cold, Tuesday, cold. The staff, from Friday to Sunday was extremely helpful, however the Monday-Tuesday crew was not so. Monday evening the elevators were stuck on the 3rd floor, security was called and we were told they were not sure what was going on, we discovered ourselves that the elevator was turned off and then told they did not have the "elevator key". Walking up a few flights of stairs is never an issue, especially once we found them (unmarked door). We continued to use them the remainder of our stay, so I'm not really sure if and when they found the "elevator key". The bellman were helpful upon our arrival and departure, obtaining cabs, finding where we were going etc. W FQ has potential, however slid through the cracks on occasion. The downtown W property appeared to have a lot more going for it, bar scene, size, available amenities etc. We stopped by for a look around and a few beverages...so if you are hell bent on a Starwood property you could go that route. I think there are better places to stay in the Quarter and will look for them on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel....NOT”
Reviews.Author: dbk3700
Reviews.Content: I travel alot for my job and stay in Starwood hotels often. This is the worst W hotel I have every stayed in by far. The property need to be competely remodeled. The rooms are old and very small and smell bad. My wife and I moved 3 times to find a acceptable room. The first one was so small you could hardly walk around the bed, the second you had double beds..NOT QUEENS and smelled like vomit, was not clean, not a single picture on the walls.The water presser and the beds were terriable and I had my ipod stolen for the 3rd room the first night. The office acted like they could care less.. From the moment I step out of the taxi, I knew we were in trouble.There was no one to help with luggage, there were several steps to go up to the lobby. The lobby is the smallest lobby I have every been to with the exception of a motel.The countyard could be cool if it were cleaned up. The only thing positive is the location. It is in a perfect spot. I cannot believe The W would put their name on this property! I is the worst W I have every seen! I also found extra charges on my bill after check out. I called and they did remove them. They also charge $4.50 for a 10oz pesi and $14.95 for acess to the internet. Too many good places to stay in N.O. to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Bourbon Street”
Reviews.Author: DallasTraveler1977
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the W Bourbon Street New Orleans. Myself and a large group of buddies stayed there for 3 nights and had a great time on Bourbon Street. It is nice being only about 2 blocks off of Bourbon Street, but still off of Bourbon Street. I was sleeping soundly so the noise did not bother me much. The rooms were tiny, but we kind of expected that due to the location and the type of hotel. The staff could have been more friendly and helpful but everything worked out fine. I would not suggest this hotel for business, as the rooms are tiny and it is noisy being so close to Bourbon Street. For a fun trip with friends I would suggest this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Day at the W French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: puilam
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried after reading the negative reviews but have to say we had a GREAT experience. This is our second time in NO and first time at a W Hotel. As mentioned in previous reviews, this hotel has a boutique feel in the heart of the French Quarter. We didn't have any issues with staff - they were all friendly and laid back. If you can get a room or suite during non-peak times it's worth it. We traveled with our 4-year old son who loved the pool and lounge area. By day the hotel is family friendly, by night the hipsters come out and start their drinking in the courtyard. The pool is bathtub warm with lots of fluffy towels and robes nearby. We had a corner room on the 4th floor facing the streets - thankfully, my hubby and son can sleep through anything so street noise and drunken revelers didn't bother them, but if you're a light sleeper bring earplugs as the noise lasts through the night. You can look out the french windows and watch the world go by (we witnessed a woman on a corner screaming/fighting with her boyfriend, then manhandled and thrown into a fast moving car, the car then sped off after making a squealing 5-point turn! lots of drama in the Quarter!) We loved how we were a few steps away from very good breakfast (Fleur de Lis cafe), and a few blocks away from nearly everything else of interest in the French Quarter. The room and hotel - the good: -big, luxurious bathrooms with nice amenities and robes (though robes were made of polyester) -very comfortable bed -although the room is not very big, there was just enough space for the 3 of us -beautifully lit courtyard at night- perfect for an evening drink or tea -complimentary coffee in the mornings -complimentary drop-off with their in-house Acura (took us to the local Budget car rental place) The bad: -mysterious stains on the carpet, duvet cover, and hallway carpets -the $14.95/day fee for wi-fi access -small desk area taken over by the big flat-screen TV, DVD player, and lamp -not enough storage space for our luggage and clothes (there was a small wardrobe, ie. no closet in room 420) -if you care about in-room coffee makers, there are none here -an inefficient toilet that took ages to flush Conclusion and tips: For those who can't normally afford staying in a W in NYC, Chicago, etc. do splurge in New Orleans - it's a lot cheaper and worth a try. We considered the larger W Hotel just west of Canal street but were happy to be in the more intimate setting of the Quarter. Try a lunch at Jager Bistro on Conti St. (4-5 blocks north of hotel). They serve great little German lunches and the BEST coffee concoctions anywhere in the Quarter. And if you like wheat beer this is the only place to find it close by. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: CFNOBIS
Reviews.Content: I am amazed at the recent poor reviews of this hotel. I have the opposite opinion of this place. I guess it depends on what you are looking for. This W is a boutique hotel, small and intimate. If you want the hustle and bustle of a hotel with poor service stay at the other W. See my previous review of that property. Upon arrival after our week long cruise we were greeted by Troy, the bellman who came to the curb and loaded our bags onto a cart. He was very friendly and helpful and directed us to the lobby. We were greeted at the front desk by another friendly face, however, I do not remember his name. He advised us they have upgraded us to a nicer room as I am an SPG gold member but the room was not ready yet. It was about 11:00 am, so I did not expect the room to be ready. He did have another room available but recommended we wait for the one they selected for us since it was a better room. We decided to wait for the room and he indicated he would call us when it was ready. We walked around the French Quarter and had lunch at a mexican place that made the food right n front of you. I can't remember the name but it was on Decatur. While having lunch we were called and told that our room was ready. The room was very large with it's own private balcony which included a patio set. The bathroom enormous and the room was very clean. This was one of the best rooms I have stayed at in a while. We spent three days there checking out New Orleans and the French Quarter. Spend the money and take a carriage ride through the Quarter. If you share one, it will be cheaper. Every time we returned to the hotel, Troy remembered us and asked if there was anything we needed to just ask him. He was great. There are plenty of places to eat here. We did not try Bocca, at the hotel, as the food was not our kind of food. There is a great breakfast place right across the street much cheaper than the room service breakfast the hotel offers,. On our last night, we went to Dickie Brennan's steakhouse. I have eaten at a lot of steakhouses in my time and this was by far my favorite, It is rated one of the top ten in the US and i believe it. A must try!! We really enjoyed our stay here and if we return it will be to this W. The service was 100% better and more personal than our say at the other W.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!”
Reviews.Author: ordcub
Reviews.Content: This was my SECOND bad experience at this hotel. I share some of the blame for my deep dissappointment at this hotel. for being foolish enough to book a second stay. During this stay, housekeeping failed to clean my room for two CONSECUTIVE DAYS. Although generally the room was cleaner than my previous stay (there were no stains on the carpet or ceilings and there was hot water this time), there was an outdoor stereo speaker right below my balcony that blasted trendy dance tunes everynight until 10pm. The final insult: I was charged $32.24 for the Manager's welcome "gift" of a bottle of cheap red wine (with an attached card of course) that had a twist off cap. When I contacted Starwood Preferred Guest relations, I was assured that I would be compensated and contacted later the same day with a resolution to my concerns about being billed for the gift. Needless to say, I never received that call. I think it's time to put an end to my support of Starwood Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Best option in the quarter”
Reviews.Author: LondonHoratio
Reviews.Content: This really is a great little spot in the best bit of the French Quarter. A lot of New Orleans hotels cater to the huge convention trade and are as a result a little dull and soulless. Not so the W. Located in a traditional French Quarter building, It manages to be modern and funky whilst retaining some old school deep south charm. The courtyard is cute, with a great little pool and there is a decent on site restaurant. All the best stuff in the Quarter is a short walk from here (make sure you try the breakfast at Brennan's - simply fabulous) and, importantly for this city, it is a safe area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, not what I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: laundrygal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W French Quarter for two nights prior to a cruise out of the New Orleans port. We have stayed at Westins and W's before in other cities. This W had plenty of boutique-y feel but was just a little worn around the edges. The staff was friendly, particularly the valet staff and we had no problems checking in. The room, which looked into the courtyard, was spacious with a large flat-screen TV, a mini-bar, a very comfortable bed and some other furniture. Everything was spic and span but some of the handles were loose on doors (door to the bathroom, door to the shower). The spa products placed in the room (the complimentary ones, not the minibar items) were very nice and beyond what you normally see in more moderately priced hotels. The room was pretty quiet, although my boyfriend reported that he was awakened during the night and could hear someone throwing up in another room, which wasn't terribly appetizing. The hotel is in the heart of the French Quarter just a block from Bourbon Street, so unfortunately it is not always going to be silent. We were there during cooler winter weather close to a family holiday, which should be kept in mind if you are planning to visit during Mardi Gras, etc, the noise level could certainly go up.

Reviews.Title: “Nice W!”
Reviews.Author: singtx
Reviews.Content: The W is the W. We were greeted by Malik (valet), who was professional and nice. He gave us some drink coupons which we were very appreciative of. While the front desk staff got the job done, they could have been more customer service oriented. I never understand why people work in this area but dont have the skills for it? Room and shower were small. Again, mold in the shower, I took pictures to upload but must have deleted them. Bartenders are good and attentive (even when busy). Location is awesome! Walking distance to EVERYTHING. The courtyard at the W is well done with cabana and open seating. I would return, but complain and not accept a shower with mold!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location , Pretty good small hotel”
Reviews.Author: dergondarkhelm
Reviews.Content: Just got back from two nights at the W- French Quarter this weekend. Pros: Room was large with big bi-fold shuttered windows that opened to the the lower courtyard. Big 50 inch plasma. Service was prompt and polite. The Courtyard is a great place to gather for some nice coktails beofre heading out out into the French Quarter. Cons: This is a small hotel. The main lobby is probably only 20x15 feet and gets crowded if more than 2 parties are trying to check in. There is no spa or fitness center, but that's not why I was staying in the French Quarter anyway. ;) . The only real public space is the outdoor courtyard. Limited parking at something like $35 a day. (But I didn't have a car) It is a couple blocks off of Bourbon street, so even being in the Quarter I did not find it loud or disturbing.

Reviews.Title: “Good for people looking to party!”
Reviews.Author: SimonBow
Reviews.Content: A few things you should be aware of: -This hotel is in the center of town. It is centrally located and near tons of bars/clubs/restaurants. The downside of this is that it can be noisy and not appropriate for some (families, possibly kids, etc). -I stayed at the W French Quarter for a bachelor party and it was an ideal place for that purpose: Great location, great staff, everyone was ready to party at the hotel, pool, or bar! -If I were with my family or a significant other, this may not be the best place to stay as I may prefer something quieter, off the beaten path. -The pool is nice, but kind of small (get there early for a seat!). See my pic. It did make for a great party scene saturday afternoon... -The staff was attentive and friendly. However at the time i arrived the check in was very crowded and there was a bit of a wait to get my room key. They could probably use more than 2 receptionists at check in, but the people there were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, Friendly Vibe- Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MeAMeandering
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to stay at a W property. Our travel agent recommended it to us. We've stayed just about everywhere in the Quarter. We loved every minute we stayed at this modern, boutique-chic hotel. We took our 5 year old with us this trip, so location was important. We wanted to be close enough to everything ( as to not wear her out walking), yet not on Bourbon St. (No place for the kiddos) The lobby is small, but modern & sets the vibe of this hotel. The front desk staff were awesome. Well, everyone was awesome! The customer service & the attention we received during our stay was outstanding. We booked a 2 double bed room, that overlooked the quarter. (Some rooms have balconies) The feather top mattresses & goose down-like bedding were to die for. We had shuttered windows that opened so we could let the fresh air in & the sounds of the quarter. Our room came with a wall mounted plasma flat screen t.v., with dvd player, stocked mini fridge & snacks ( not inclusive), cordless phone, internet access, Bliss bath products, safe & of course the gumball machine. I loved the fresh Birds Of Paradise in the hallways. We also liked the slate tiled, 2 person, stand alone shower, and seperate vanity area w/ extra wall mounted make up mirror in the bathroom. My granddaughter especially loved watching movies that were still playing in the cinemas. The ambiance of the upper & lower courtyards was nice surprise, with lots of private enclaves, cabanas & sitting areas to relax. The restraunt served first class cuisine. We loved the room service! The location of this hotel is perfect, right in the middle of everything. We'll definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel with Attentive Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Mamarayna
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, as well as several other couples, stayed at the W last week. Our hotel experience was awesome! For starters, we were taken to the Welcome room (reception desk area) where the walls are covered in deep red velvet. There is also soft plush couches for kicking back , a flat screen tv, and large windows that look out onto Chartres. The welcome area immediately sets the tone of the W as being a place that offers a classy club lounge feel. The front desk staff warmly greeted us and gave us the low down on all the events going on in the city as well as a schedule of the voodoo fest. Although we arrived early, our room was ready- - - so we were immediately escorted up to the third floor, which overlooks Conti St. The room was a little small but the large bathroom, flat screen tv, walk-in shower, and great amenities such as his/her robes, ipod docking station, and Bliss Spa products more than make up for it. The snack bar and refigerator are stocked full of wine and beverages too. The bed was soooo comfortable. I think it was a down pillow top mattress. I'm really not sure but whatever it was - - -it felt as though I was sleeping on clouds (all those hurricanes could have also had something to do with it. :) Anyway, the rooms overlook either the street or the W's swanky courtyard area, which boasts private style gazebos and quaint sitting areas great for lounging or socializing with friends. This is also where folks gather during the W's happy hour for specialty drinks or free little wine spritzers. Make sure if you value your sleep, get a room that faces the courtyard. Remember, you are in the French Quarters and it can get quite rowdy at night. To wrap things up - - -one of the W's mottos is "whatever you want whenever you want" and the staff was always eager to deliver this type of service to their guests. I wish all hotel staff could be so attentive! Kudos to Malik and the rest of the staff for making our trip memorable!!!! When we go back to NOLA, we are definitely staying at the W.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in new orleans”
Reviews.Author: quarfark
Reviews.Content: I went for a 5 day trip with my girlfriends to new orleans (We are all 28 or 29 years old). Our first hotel was the W in the french quater, which was AMAZING. We were treated like royalty as soon as we got there. From the free shuttle that takes you wherever you want to go, to the drinks poolside, everything was perfect! The staff treated us so well, Malik and Troy were great!! The pool was definitely the best part, with beautiful cabanas, drinks and a movie at night (not to mention the cute boys). We later stayed at Le Pavilion, which we found stuffy and boring in comparision. I highly, highly recommend the W. We had such a great time, we didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Shag-a-delic good time at the W French Qtr”
Reviews.Author: news222
Reviews.Content: Just returned today from a stay in NOLA at the charming W-FQ. The hotel is on Chartres Street and is conveniently located two blocks from Bourbon Street, two blocks from the riverfront, three blocks from Canal Street (and Harrahs), and 4 blocks from Jackson Square. We recommend walking to one of the nearby markets after check-in and stocking up on your own snacks and beverages. There is a mini-bar and fridge in the room, but why pay their prices? All of the little stores sell beer, wine and liquor, even the Walgreens nearby. You are more than welcome to bring your own beverages to sip in the courtyard or poolside. The ever-accomodating staff will happily keep your ice bucket full while you relax. There is regular bar service outside during the day also. W Hotels all have a young, contemporary "shag-a-delic" vibe to them, so if funky design that sometimes takes priority over practicality bothers you, don't stay at any W. But if you enjoy the novelty of it all and their attention to somewhat non-traditional details, you'll love it. This W is a renovated, traditional french quarter series of interconnected buildings which surround a huge and beautiful courtyard, complete with fountain, cabanas, soothing lighting, and pool. If you've never been to NOLA, pools are not a given at all hotels, nor is a courtyard, and this outdoor living area is large by most standards. We had standard hotel rooms on the 4th floor facing Chartres and we were surprised by how large the rooms were, because most rooms and especially bathrooms tend to be quite small due to traditional french quarter architecture. The bathrooms were actually quite large even by normal hotel standards, everything was clean and maintained (not perfect, but clean), and the beds are always heavenly. They do have onsite enclosed parking (for a fee, and parking is never cheap in NOLA) but we didn't use it. We booked online at SPG.com and did the prepaid rates which were around $170/night. We found all the staff to be friendly and the vast majority of them went out of their way to welcoming and accomodating. I've stayed at the Omni Royal Orleans and the Le Richileu in the past when visiting NOLA. While I'd return to anyone of them, the W was the perfect choice for our small group of thirty-something ladies. Most of us had stayed at 1 or more different W's in the past and we found this one to be the perfect blend of funky fresh W and New Orleans historic charm. Please note there are quieter places to stay, but this is to be expected in certain areas of the Quarter on a busy weekend. Being 2 blocks from a busy stretch of Bourbon and not far from busy Canal Street, this hotel is in one of those areas. It was quiet on Thursday and not bad Friday, but Saturday was pretty noisy from 11pm-4am (sirens, music, crowd noise, foot traffic). Being 2 blocks from a busy stretch of Bourbon and not far from busy Canal Street, this hotel is in one of those areas. They have an onsite restaurant Bacco by Brennan's which provided a wonderful poolside lunch one day, and handles all the hotel's room service. We frequented La Bouriche cafe across the street for coffee and breakfast. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again if visiting New Orleans, and I also recommend the review by NolaHal posted Sept 5th for additional good info on the W.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - ok W”
Reviews.Author: Cruze-lover
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a birthday celebration in the Quarter. The location of this W is great, close to Bourbon and also close to Canal Street for shopping, casino, etc. As for the W, all and all not bad, but not the best by a long shot. The lobby is very small and hard to find. We had actually arrived a day before our check-in (a mistake by my other half), they found us a room, but I can't say the lobby staff was friendly. All the suites (which we had booked) were full that night, odd since Hurricane Ike was coming. The first room was standard. It was musty, but nice beds and bathroom. It was very windy (due to Ike) and we had to put a washcloth in the window frame to keep it from banging. The shower is a poor design. You open the door, then lean in to turn on the water, you then get hit by cold, then scalding water because you are in the stream of water to adjust. We moved the next day to a suite as booked. The desk was supposed to call when it was available (we were told that Starwood Members in suites could check out as late as 4pm), but they never did. We inquired and the room was available. We moved everything ourselves and went to the suite. It was large, but still musty. It was also handicapped, so the shower was a big open area so you had to put towels over the floor to mop up the water while showering. There was a private outdoor area, but it wasn't very clean or inviting. Housekeeping was spotty. We had friends coming over to have drinks before dinner and the room was cleaned until after 5pm! The day we were to check out, they were knocking on the door at 8am (even with do-not-disturb) and asked every time we were out in the hall. I will say that the concierge made last minute reservations for 14 at the Gumbo Shop - that was perfect. The valet was very nice as well, helpful with bags and taxis. Upon check-out, we needed to break a $50 bill for tips, etc. We were told at the front desk that they didnt have change.... New Orleans was wonderful as always and the weather was pretty good given Ike, but this overall hotel experience was fair.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding French Quarter hotel”
Reviews.Author: NolaHal
Reviews.Content: Because of unusual circumstances, I stayed at the W French Quarter on two back-to-back August Saturday nights, one during a Saints game, the other during a tropical storm. The fact that the hotel was both soothing and fun under both circumstances is itself outstanding. It's all in the design and the location. Goodness knows, I never felt pampered. In fact, both times I stood at the counter--alone, but for the beta fish--waiting too long for an attendant. There's no bell, just lots of velvet. However, it's adjacent to the hotel's noisy, elegant restaurant, and I knew that whoever was running the show there, would soon produce an employee to help me with my room here, and voila, a cheerful clerk appeared to check me in or check me out. Like other French Quarter hotels--the Maison Dupuis comes to mind--the W is composed of several older buildings retrofitted for its purpose. If you want a traditional hotel room, rectangular and with perhaps a terrace, they're in the building facing Chartres. On my other night, the room was somehow in the back, in what was maybe servants quarters, and was small with uneven, carpeted floors. Romantic for a couple, creepy and fussy for a business traveller. The hotel is surrounded by restaurants and night clubs, and is a short walk to Saks. The gym is a healthy walk away at their sister hotel, the W New Orleans, but it's by far one of the largest and best furnished hotel fitness rooms I've encountered. I can't help you with their brand identity: it doesn't have the golly gee of the Chicago W's room design--"I can see Lake Michigan from a secret window in my shower!"-- and certainly doesn't have the quirky dorm rooms of the W San Diego. It's just a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property and Location”
Reviews.Author: dcmtnbiker
Reviews.Content: I spent Labor Day weekend at the W and loved it. Great staff, very nice room and property. We had to leave early due to Hurricane Gustav and the staff and management were very helpful. I would highly suggest the hotel and plan on staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at a True Boutique Property”
Reviews.Author: traveler213
Reviews.Content: While in New Orleans on business, I chose the W French Quarter for its location and the fact that i got a great rate...$169 for a package that included welcome cocktails and breakfast. I read some reviews on the hotel service level before staying, but I found the staff to be welcoming, friendly, competent and eager to please. From the check-in agent to the bellmen to the housekeeping staff, everyone was wonderful. We had dinner at the hotel's restaurant (Bocco?) one evening and it was fantastic. Great salads and the filet mignon was one of the best I've ever had. I was upgraded to the mega room...which the staff also referred to as a carriage house room...which was interesting because the room entrance is directly off the courtyard, so unless the door shutters are closed, you're on display to everyone enjoying the pool and cabanas...plus, there was a small courtyard off the back of the room with a private hot tub suitable for about 4-6 people...really nice room! Overall, I would highly recommend this property for both business and leisure travelers due to its proximity to the french quarter attractions (ie. Bourbon St. and Cafe du Monde) and businesses on Canal St. Will definitely be staying here again when I return to NO.

Reviews.Title: “Art-Noise Chic?”
Reviews.Author: orcbyte
Reviews.Content: Computer animated building art, comfy cabanas, a fire fountain, and pretty noisy. If there are people in the courtyard imbibing NOLA into the sloppy wee hours of the morning, you will be listening to them from your hotel room. Unless you are on the street side, which honestly might be quieter. But if said revelers decide to chat somewhere near the elevator, you will also hear them. And then you will hear the maids in the morning as they careen through the halls. At the W, life is a party and attendance is mandatory, by hotel design. Pray for an off night. But wait there's more! The ice machine and its constant conversation with the beaded curtain in front of it. The walls are clearly made of thin mints, but who cares, because the room looks good right? Above all one should not underestimate the bathroom privacy issue that everyone brings up. The door â€œslidesâ€� over the entrance like a rock in front of a cave. It does not close like a proper door. It is however slightly more private than a beaded curtain. Think of it like camping, only you can't walk a half mile away from where others may be sleeping to make your embarrassing noises. Not sexy. This refers to a standard room, which is pretty darn small too. That said, if you have enough pills and ear plugs to get some sleep, the location is great, the hotel looks good, the courtyard is a nice place to relax and have drinks. Service is hit or miss, the people that hustle for tips do indeed hustle. The front desk and its life forms are oh so stylishly incompetent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - horrible service”
Reviews.Author: travel_fiend_75
